text: ARTICLE 1 - PURPOSE
label: BODY

text: This Contract is made between the City of Columbus, Ohio, hereinafter referred to as "City" and
label: BODY

text: AFSCME, Local 1632, and Ohio Council 8, American Federation of State, County and Municipal
label: BODY

text: Employees, AFL-CIO, hereinafter referred to jointly as the "Union".
label: BODY

text: The objectives of this Contract are as follows:
label: BODY

text: To achieve and maintain a satisfactory, stable and productive employer-
label: BODY

text: employee relationship and to promote improved work performance;
label: BODY

text: To foster a cooperative employer-employee relationship that will improve City
label: BODY

text: government efficiency and effectiveness and provide high quality service and
label: BODY

text: customer satisfaction;
label: BODY

text: To provide for the peaceful adjustment of differences which may arise;
label: BODY

text: To attract and retain qualified employees by providing benefits that are
label: BODY

text: competitive and fair;
label: BODY

text: To assure the effectiveness of service by providing an opportunity for employees
label: BODY

text: to meet with the Administration through their representatives to exchange views
label: BODY

text: and opinions on policies and procedures affecting the conditions of their
label: BODY

text: employment, subject to the Charter of the City of Columbus, ordinances and
label: BODY

text: resolutions of the Columbus City Council, resolutions of the Columbus Board of
label: BODY

text: Health (where applicable), Civil Service Commission Rules and Regulations,
label: BODY

text: State and Federal laws, and the Constitution of the State of Ohio and the United
label: BODY

text: States of America; and
label: BODY

text: To set forth the entire understandings and agreements between the parties
label: BODY

text: governing the wages, hours, and terms and conditions of employment for those
label: BODY

text: employees included in the bargaining unit as defined herein.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 2 - DEFINITIONS
label: BODY

text: "Active Service" means being present and able to perform the duties to which an
label: BODY

text: employee of the City of Columbus has been assigned.
label: BODY

text: “AWOL” means away without leave as defined in Section 24.1.
label: BODY

text: "Appointing Authority" means an individual, officer, commission, agency, board or
label: BODY

text: body having the power under the Charter or Columbus City Codes of appointment to, or
label: BODY

text: removal from, a position with the City.
label: BODY

text: "Calendar Week" means seven (7) consecutive calendar days starting on Sunday and
label: BODY

text: ending on Saturday.
label: BODY

text: "Call-Back Pay" means pay for an unscheduled work assignment which does not
label: BODY

text: immediately precede or follow an employee's scheduled work hours (this, for example, does not
label: BODY

text: apply to a prescheduled early call-in or in cases of overtime authorized as an extension of a
label: BODY

text: regular shift).
label: BODY

text: “Casual Employee” means an employee who is assigned on an on-call or as-needed
label: BODY

text: basis to supplement the work force and either: averages in the aggregate less than five hundred
label: BODY

text: (500) hours over the previous year; or, among whom less than sixty percent (60%) who worked
label: BODY

text: one year returned for the following year.
label: BODY

text: "Chief Steward" means a Union representative assigned to the department by which
label: BODY

text: he/she is employed and whose responsibilities are outlined in Article 6.
label: BODY

text: "Class or Classification" means a group of positions with the same descriptive title
label: BODY

text: having similar duties and responsibilities and requiring similar qualifications and which can be
label: BODY

text: distinguished from other groups of positions. There may be only one position in some job
label: BODY

text: classes or classifications.
label: BODY

text: “Class Action Grievance” means a grievance of the type outlined in Section 11.1.
label: BODY

text: “COBRA” (Consolidated Omnibus Budget Recovery Act) means full-time employees
label: BODY

text: who terminate City employment, or reduce their hours to part-time, may participate in
label: BODY

text: continuation of specific health care benefits at their own expense pursuant to the federal
label: BODY

text: COBRA provisions. For employees with less than one (1) year of City service, only
label: BODY

text: comprehensive major medical and prescription drug benefits are subject to be purchased.
label: BODY

text: Employees with more than one (1) year of City service are eligible for comprehensive major
label: BODY

text: medical, prescription drug, dental care and vision care benefits which are subject to be
label: BODY

text: purchased.
label: BODY

text: "Compensatory Time" means time off with pay for authorized overtime worked in lieu
label: BODY

text: of salary or wages, calculated in accordance with Article 16 of this Contract.
label: BODY

text: "Continuous Service" means an employee's length of service as a full-time employee
label: BODY

text: of the City uninterrupted by a separation from City employment; provided, however, time in
label: BODY

text: unpaid status and/or part-time status shall be deducted from length of service.
label: BODY

text: "Daily Overtime" means premium pay at one and one-half (1-1/2) times regular pay
label: BODY

text: rates for time actually worked beyond eight (8) straight-time hours or more in a workday (for
label: BODY

text: example, daily overtime would apply after ten (10) straight-time hours of actual work for a
label: BODY

text: normal workday of ten (10) hours).
label: BODY

text: "Day" means calendar day unless otherwise specified.
label: BODY

text: "Demotion" means a change to a classification which has a lower rate of pay.
label: BODY

text: "Division" means the Appropriation Unit for budgetary purposes.
label: BODY

text: "Employee" means any member holding a bargaining unit classification who is not 1) a
label: BODY

text: uniformed employee of the Police or Fire Divisions within the Department of Public Safety; 2) an
label: BODY

text: employee of the Human Resources Department; 3) an employee of the Civil Service
label: BODY

text: Commission; 4) a confidential secretary of an Appointing Authority; 5) an employee who
label: BODY

text: regularly works less than twenty (20) hours per week during the course of a payroll year; and 6)
label: BODY

text: an employee who is in seasonal or temporary appointment.
label: BODY

text: "Extended Illness" means more than three (3) consecutive workdays, including the day
label: BODY

text: on which the holiday is celebrated, of injury leave, sick leave and/or disability leave.
label: BODY

text: "Floating Chief Steward" means a Union representative not assigned to a specific
label: BODY

text: department and whose responsibilities are outlined in Article 6.
label: BODY

text: "Full-Time Employee" means an employee who is hired to perform duties for the City
label: BODY

text: according to an established work schedule which includes not less than forty (40) hours per
label: BODY

text: work week and contemplates fifty-two (52) work weeks per year. "Full-Time Employee" includes
label: BODY

text: employees on full-time limited appointments of one year and employees who have been
label: BODY

text: employed for more than one year of consecutive full-time limited appointments.
label: BODY

text: "Operating Unit" means a department, division, facility or reporting location, whichever
label: BODY

text: is applicable.
label: BODY

text: "Operating Unit Seniority" means the employee's seniority in his/her classification
label: BODY

text: within the operating unit.
label: BODY

text: "Overtime" means time during which an employee is on duty, working for the City in
label: BODY

text: excess of regularly scheduled hours of work as set forth in Article 16. Overtime applies only to
label: BODY

text: that time authorized to be worked by an Appointing Authority in accordance with the provisions
label: BODY

text: of this Contract.
label: BODY

text: "Paid Status" means employment by the City in active service or authorized leave with
label: BODY

text: pay; for purposes of Article 16, paid status means time worked plus all paid leaves except for
label: BODY

text: sick leave, injury leave and/or disability leave.
label: BODY

text: "Part-Time Employee" means an employee who is hired to perform duties for the City
label: BODY

text: according to a work schedule less than forty (40) hours per five (5) consecutive calendar days,
label: BODY

text: and contemplates an average in the aggregate of more than 1040 hours in a year. Part-Time
label: BODY

text: Employee includes employees on part-time limited appointments of one (1) year and employees
label: BODY

text: who have been employed for more than one (1) year of consecutive part-time limited
label: BODY

text: appointments.
label: BODY

text: "Pay Period" means a two (2) calendar week period beginning on a Sunday and ending
label: BODY

text: on the second Saturday thereafter.
label: BODY

text: "Personnel Policy" means a policy or procedure which implements and clarifies
label: BODY

text: contract provisions regarding terms and conditions of employment for employees in the
label: BODY

text: bargaining unit in specific sections, reporting locations, divisions or department. It does not
label: BODY

text: include oral or written work direction on how to perform a specific job duty from a supervisor or
label: BODY

text: manager, or the exercise of other management rights under Section 3.2.
label: BODY

text: "Post-Training New Hires" means an employee who has successfully completed the
label: BODY

text: requisite training period, but who may not have completed his/her probationary period.
label: BODY

text: "Pyramiding of Overtime" means the paying of a premium rate of pay above the
label: BODY

text: appropriate overtime rate.
label: BODY

text: "Position" means any office, employment or job calling for the performance of certain
label: BODY

text: duties and the exercise of certain responsibilities by one individual. A position may be vacant,
label: BODY

text: occupied part-time, or occupied full-time.
label: BODY

text: "Reemployment" means taking a position with the City following a break in continuous
label: BODY

text: service.
label: BODY

text: "Resignation" means the voluntary termination of employment of an employee, or
label: BODY

text: unauthorized leave for five (5) consecutive workdays.
label: BODY

text: "Retirement" means separation from City service which is not caused by resignation,
label: BODY

text: layoff or discharge, with application for retirement benefits approved by the Ohio Public
label: BODY

text: Employees Retirement System (OPERS) for an employee who (a) is sixty (60) years of age at
label: BODY

text: the time of separation with at least five (5) years of service under the OPERS system, or (b) is
label: BODY

text: fifty-five (55) years of age at the time of separation with at least twenty-five (25) years of service
label: BODY

text: under the OPERS system, or (c) regardless of age at the time of separation, has at least thirty
label: BODY

text: (30) years of service under the OPERS system, or (d) is approved for disability retirement
label: BODY

text: benefits by the OPERS.
label: BODY

text: "Seasonal Employees" means an employee who works a certain regular season or
label: BODY

text: period of the year performing some work or activity limited to that season and either: 1)
label: BODY

text: averages in the aggregate less than five hundred (500) hours over the previous year, or; 2)
label: BODY

text: among whom less than sixty percent (60%) who worked one (1) year returned to employment
label: BODY

text: the following year.
label: BODY

text: "Seniority" means an employee's uninterrupted length of continuous service within the
label: BODY

text: City, department, division or job classification, depending upon the issue involved.
label: BODY

text: "Separation from City Employment" means a termination of the employer-employee
label: BODY

text: relationship and includes resignation, retirement, discharge for cause, layoff and certification
label: BODY

text: termination resulting from the establishment of an eligible list. A layoff or certification termination
label: BODY

text: of thirty five (35) days or less, or resignation to immediately accept another position in the
label: BODY

text: employ of the City, shall not be considered a separation from City employment.
label: BODY

text: "SERB" means the State Employment Relations Board of Ohio.
label: BODY

text: "Shift" means the employee's regularly scheduled hours of work. In areas with multiple
label: BODY

text: shifts or twenty-four (24) hour operations, the early morning shift hereinafter is referred to as the
label: BODY

text: first shift, the late afternoon shift hereinafter is referred to as the second shift, and the late
label: BODY

text: evening shift hereinafter is referred to as the third shift.
label: BODY

text: "Steward" means a union representative assigned to the division by which he/she is
label: BODY

text: employed and whose responsibilities are outlined in Article 6.
label: BODY

text: "Temporary Appointment" means that definition which is contained in the Charter of
label: BODY

text: the City of Columbus and related Civil Services Rules and Regulations.
label: BODY

text: “Union” means, for notification purposes, the current mailing address of the Local Union
label: BODY

text: Hall.
label: BODY

text: "Unpaid Status" means time an employee is on suspension, on leave without pay or is
label: BODY

text: away without leave. Leave without pay status resulting from either injury received in the line of
label: BODY

text: duty, approved disability coverage, or approved activities related to City-employee relations
label: BODY

text: shall not be considered to be unpaid status.
label: BODY

text: "Vacancy” means a position to be filled, as determined by management, that results
label: H3

text: from one of the following circumstances: (1) an employee has separated from a position and the
label: BODY

text: appointing authority has decided to fill the position; (2) an increase in the total number of
label: BODY

text: positions in the class; (3) a reallocation of a position as approved by the Civil Service
label: BODY

text: Commission.
label: BODY

text: "Weekly Overtime - On First Regular Day Off" means premium pay at one and one-
label: BODY

text: half (1-1/2) times regular pay rates for time worked on the employee's first regular day off after
label: BODY

text: the employee has completed forty (40) hours in paid status in that work week (excluding sick
label: BODY

text: leave, injury leave and disability leave).
label: BODY

text: "Weekly Overtime - On Second Regular Day Off" means premium pay at two (2)
label: BODY

text: times regular pay rates for time worked on the employee's second regular day off after the
label: BODY

text: employee has completed forty (40) hours in paid status in that work week (excluding sick leave,
label: BODY

text: injury leave and disability leave). A Fourth shift employee’s second regular day off will start
label: BODY

text: twenty-four (24) hours immediately preceding the start of the first regular shift of the next work
label: BODY

text: week. Alternative work schedules shall establish when the employee’s second regular day off
label: BODY

text: occurs and therefore when double time pay will apply to overtime.
label: BODY

text: "Work Schedule" means an employee's days of work, hours of work and days off.
label: BODY

text: "Workweek" means a workweek as defined in Section 16.1.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 3 – MANAGEMENT RIGHTS
label: HH1

text: Section 3.1. Relation of Contract to Other Sources of Authority.
label: HH2

text: Nothing contained in this Contract shall alter the authority conferred by the Charter of the City of
label: BODY

text: Columbus, ordinances and resolutions of the Columbus City Council, resolutions of the
label: BODY

text: Columbus Board of Health (where applicable), Civil Service Commission Rules and
label: BODY

text: Regulations, State and Federal laws, and Constitutions of the State of Ohio and the United
label: BODY

text: States of America upon any City official or to in any way abridge or reduce such authority,
label: BODY

text: except as specifically provided in Section 11.8(A) and in Article 15 of this Contract. This
label: BODY

text: Contract shall be construed as requiring City officials to follow the procedures, agreements, and
label: BODY

text: policies prescribed herein, to the extent they are applicable, in the exercise of the authority
label: BODY

text: conferred upon them by law.
label: BODY

text: Section 3.2. Statement of Management Rights.
label: HH2

text: The management and direction of work forces in the interest of maintaining and
label: BODY

text: improving efficiency in all municipal operations is reserved to the City, subject to
label: BODY

text: the provisions governing the exercise of these rights as expressly provided
label: BODY

text: herein. Except as expressly limited by a specific provision of this Contract and
label: BODY

text: except as limited by the laws referred to in Section 3.1 of this Contract, the City
label: BODY

text: retains the sole and exclusive right to: (1) plan, direct and control city operations
label: BODY

text: and the work of city employees; (2) hire, promote, demote, transfer (permanently
label: BODY

text: or temporarily), assign, layoff, recall and retain employees in positions within the
label: BODY

text: City; (3) discipline, suspend and discharge employees for just cause; (4) maintain
label: BODY

text: the efficiency of City operations; (5) maintain, expand, reduce, alter, consolidate,
label: BODY

text: merge, relocate, transfer or terminate work or other operations; (6) determine,
label: BODY

text: create, maintain, expand, reduce, alter or abolish the means, methods, materials,
label: BODY

text: processes, procedures, products, tools, equipment, locations or schedule of work
label: BODY

text: or other operations; (7) determine, maintain, expand, reduce or alter employees'
label: BODY

text: compensation or benefits; (8) determine, create, maintain, expand, reduce, alter
label: BODY

text: or abolish new or existing jobs; (9) determine, create, maintain, expand, reduce,
label: BODY

text: alter, abolish and enforce rules governing employee conduct and other
label: BODY

text: operations; (10) determine, create, maintain, expand, reduce, alter or abolish
label: BODY

text: hours, days or shifts of work; (11) subcontract work or other operations to outside
label: BODY

text: companies; and (12) take such other actions as the City may deem necessary to
label: BODY

text: carry out its mission.
label: BODY

text: The enumeration of the City's rights, as set forth in this Article, shall not be
label: BODY

text: deemed to exclude other rights of management not specifically set forth herein
label: BODY

text: since the parties expressly agree that the City retains all legal rights to which it is
label: BODY

text: entitled as an employer and retains all other rights not otherwise covered by this
label: BODY

text: Contract, whether or not such rights have been exercised in the past.
label: BODY

text: Section 3.3. Subcontracting.
label: HH2

text: In the event that the City exercises its right to subcontract, as set forth in this Article 3, the City
label: BODY

text: shall so notify the Union at least sixty (60) days prior to implementation of such subcontracted
label: BODY

text: work, except that this notice requirement shall not apply in cases of (i) emergencies; or (ii)
label: BODY

text: where the City could be harmed by having to comply with the sixty (60)-day notice requirement
label: BODY

text: due to unforeseen circumstances. The Union may request a meeting with the Director of the
label: BODY

text: Department of Human Resources or designee for discussion of the subcontracting decision.
label: BODY

text: The Union shall be permitted at such meeting to provide evidence that it would be more cost
label: BODY

text: effective for the City to continue to utilize employees of the bargaining unit to perform the work
label: BODY

text: in question. If it is the decision of the Director of Human Resources to continue with the
label: BODY

text: subcontracting decision for the work in question after the above described procedure has been
label: BODY

text: completed, or in the event the City sells, conveys or leases any current operation, the City shall
label: BODY

text: negotiate with the Union as to the effect on employees of the decision to subcontract work or to
label: BODY

text: sell, convey or lease the operation. However, such effects bargaining shall not delay or
label: BODY

text: otherwise affect the City's right to sell, lease, convey or subcontract under this Article 3.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 4 - RECOGNITION
label: BODY

text: Section 4.1. Recognition.
label: HH2

text: The City hereby agrees to recognize the Union as the sole and exclusive
label: BODY

text: bargaining agent for the purpose of collective bargaining in any and all matters
label: BODY

text: relating to wages, hours, and working conditions of all employees in the
label: BODY

text: bargaining unit as described in Appendix A.
label: BODY

text: The Union hereby agrees to abide by the procedures and policies as set forth in
label: BODY

text: this Contract.
label: BODY

text: The Union shall provide to the Director of the Department of Human Resources
label: BODY

text: or designee an official roster of its officers and representatives that is to be kept
label: BODY

text: current at all times and to include the following:
label: BODY

text: Name.
label: BODY

text: Address.
label: BODY

text: Home telephone number.
label: BODY

text: Division.
label: HH1

text: Immediate supervisor.
label: BODY

text: Union office held.
label: BODY

text: Section 4.2. Bargaining Unit.
label: HH2

text: The bargaining unit means that group of City of Columbus employees meeting
label: BODY

text: the definition of a public employee pursuant to Section 4117.01 of the Ohio
label: BODY

text: Revised Code, serving in class titles included in Appendix A attached hereto, and
label: BODY

text: who are not: 1) uniformed employees of the Police or Fire Divisions within the
label: BODY

text: Department of Public Safety; 2) employees of the Human Resources
label: BODY

text: Department; 3) employees of the Civil Service Commission; 4) confidential
label: BODY

text: secretaries of the Appointing Authorities; 5) employees who regularly work less
label: BODY

text: than twenty (20) hours per week during the course of a payroll year; and 6)
label: BODY

text: employees who are in seasonal or temporary appointments.
label: BODY

text: If a dispute occurs between the City and the Union as to the inclusion or
label: BODY

text: exclusion of a classification from the bargaining unit, the parties will discuss the
label: BODY

text: matter and, if they are unable to reach agreement thereon, the parties agree to
label: BODY

text: submit the dispute to arbitration pursuant to the provisions of Section 11.5, Step
label: BODY

text: Should another employee representative express an interest to the City to represent
label: BODY

text: employees to be assigned to the disputed classification, and file a petition with SERB
label: BODY

text: requesting a unit clarification determination with respect to the inclusion or exclusion of
label: BODY

text: the disputed classification from its bargaining unit, the City will notify the Union
label: BODY

text: (AFSCME) upon receipt of the petition from SERB. If the Union (AFSCME) so desires, it
label: BODY

text: may file a Motion to Intervene with SERB to represent employees to be assigned to the
label: BODY

text: disputed classification.
label: BODY

text: Section 4.3. Job Classifications.
label: HH2

text: The City shall make available to the Union copies of classification specifications for all
label: BODY

text: classifications in the bargaining unit. Any changes in Civil Service rules shall be provided to the
label: BODY

text: Union at the earliest possible time prior to the effective date of such changes.
label: BODY

text: The City, through the Civil Service Commission (CSC), may create, modify, or merge
label: BODY

text: classifications and place abolished classifications in moratorium. The CSC will provide the
label: BODY

text: Union with copies of proposed classification specifications, whether newly created, merged or
label: BODY

text: modified at least fourteen (14) days before the Commission meeting where the proposed
label: BODY

text: classification specifications will be on the Commission agenda.
label: BODY

text: Additionally, the Department of Human Resources will determine a proposed pay range for the
label: BODY

text: affected classifications and shall notify the Union. Should the Union dispute the proposed pay
label: BODY

text: recommendation of the City it shall request to bargain. Negotiations shall not exceed thirty (30)
label: BODY

text: days. If the parties are unable to resolve their differences through negotiations, they shall submit
label: BODY

text: unresolved issues through arbitration pursuant to Section 11.5, Step 3, of this Contract. The
label: BODY

text: matter shall be submitted to a mutually agreed upon arbitrator knowledgeable in classification
label: BODY

text: and compensation matters.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 5 - UNION SECURITY AND RIGHTS
label: HH1

text: Section 5.1. Dues Deduction.
label: HH2

text: The agreement of membership between the Union and the members should
label: BODY

text: determine the manner in which Union dues shall be deducted from the payroll.
label: BODY

text: Members of the Union or an employee who authorizes deductions may withdraw
label: BODY

text: from the payment of dues, initiation fees, and assessments during the thirty (30)
label: BODY

text: to forty-five (45) day period prior to the expiration of this Contract or after the
label: BODY

text: stated expiration of this Contract (without regard to extensions) and prior to the
label: BODY

text: commencement of a new Contract by giving written notification by Certified Mail
label: BODY

text: to the Director of the Department of Human Resources or designee and the
label: BODY

text: Union twenty (20) days prior to the effective date of the revocation.
label: BODY

text: The City agrees to deduct Union membership dues once each month from the
label: BODY

text: pay of any employee requesting same. If a deduction is desired, the employee
label: BODY

text: shall sign a payroll deduction form, which shall be furnished by the Union and
label: BODY

text: presented to the appropriate payroll clerk within sixty (60) days of the date of
label: BODY

text: signature.
label: BODY

text: The amount to be deducted shall be certified to each payroll clerk by the
label: BODY

text: Treasurer of the Union. One (1) month advance notice must be given each
label: BODY

text: payroll clerk prior to making any changes in an individual's dues deduction. The
label: BODY

text: City agrees to furnish the Comptroller of AFSCME Ohio Council 8 a warrant in
label: BODY

text: the aggregate amount of the deduction with a listing of the employees for whom
label: BODY

text: deductions were made.
label: BODY

text: Authorization for payroll deduction is not compulsory and employees who
label: BODY

text: voluntarily sign authorization cards do so with full and complete knowledge that
label: BODY

text: what they are doing is only one (1) method of paying their Union dues. The City
label: BODY

text: shall in no way influence or attempt to influence members of the Union in their
label: BODY

text: payment of dues by payroll deduction.
label: BODY

text: Deductions under this Section 5.1 shall be made during one (1) pay period each
label: BODY

text: month; if a member's pay for the period is insufficient to cover Union dues after
label: BODY

text: withholding all other legal and required deductions, the City will make a
label: BODY

text: deduction from the pay earned during the next pay period. In the event a
label: BODY

text: deduction is not made for a member during any particular month, the City, upon
label: BODY

text: verification from the Union, will make the appropriate deduction in the following
label: BODY

text: month.
label: BODY

text: The deductions made under this Section 5.1, accompanied by an alphabetical list
label: BODY

text: of all employees, shall be transmitted to the Union no later than ten (10) days
label: BODY

text: following the end of the pay period in which the deduction is made, if so
label: BODY

text: approved by the City Auditor.
label: BODY

text: The procedure for dues deduction as specified in this Section 5.1 shall be
label: BODY

text: approved by the City Auditor, and the Auditor reserves the right to determine the
label: BODY

text: authenticity of any dues deduction authorized herein.
label: BODY

text: The City shall provide the Union with an alphabetical list of names and addresses
label: BODY

text: of all bargaining unit employees, including hire date and classifications, on July 1
label: BODY

text: of each calendar year. The Director of the Department of Human Resources or
label: BODY

text: designee will receive an alphabetical list of all employees who do not utilize the
label: BODY

text: dues deduction in the payroll system but pay directly to the Union. This list will be
label: BODY

text: provided to the Director of the Department of Human Resources or designee on
label: BODY

text: July 1 of each calendar year.
label: BODY

text: Section 5.2. Fair Share.
label: HH2

text: All bargaining unit employees who are not members in good standing of the
label: BODY

text: Union, shall be required to pay a fair share fee to the Union as a condition of
label: BODY

text: continued employment.
label: BODY

text: All bargaining unit employees who do not become members in good standing of
label: BODY

text: the Union shall be required to pay a fair share fee to the Union effective sixty-one
label: BODY

text: (61) days from the employee's date of hire or the effective date of this Contract,
label: BODY

text: whichever is later. The fair share fee shall be certified to the City Auditor by the
label: BODY

text: Union. The deduction of the fair share fee from any earnings of the employee
label: BODY

text: shall be automatic and does not require written authorization for payroll
label: BODY

text: deduction.
label: BODY

text: Payment to the Union of fair share fees deducted shall be made in accordance
label: BODY

text: with the regular dues deductions as provided in Section 5.1. The City Auditor
label: BODY

text: shall provide the Union with an alphabetical list of names, social security
label: BODY

text: numbers, and addresses of those employees who had a fair share fee deducted
label: BODY

text: along with the amount of the fair share fee deduction.
label: BODY

text: The Union expressly agrees to ensure full compliance with the constitutional
label: BODY

text: rights of fair share fee payors as set forth in Chicago Teachers Union v. Hudson,
label: BODY

text: 106 U.S. 1066 (1986) and other Sixth Circuit and United States Supreme Court
label: BODY

text: decisions. Upon giving notice to the City of changes in the fair share fee, the
label: BODY

text: Union will advise the City in writing of the steps it has taken to ensure continued
label: BODY

text: compliance with the constitutional rights of fair share fee payors as set forth in
label: BODY

text: Chicago Teachers Union v. Hudson, 106 U.S. 1066 (1986) and other Sixth
label: BODY

text: Circuit and United States Supreme Court decisions, and will give the City
label: BODY

text: reasonable access to information to enable the City to verify that the Union's fair
label: BODY

text: share fee procedures comply with applicable Sixth Circuit and U.S. Supreme
label: BODY

text: Court decisions.
label: BODY

text: Disputes between fair share fee payors and the Union regarding fair share fees
label: BODY

text: shall be processed under the Union's internal dispute resolution procedure and
label: BODY

text: are not subject to the grievance and arbitration procedure of this Contract.
label: BODY

text: Section 5.3. Union Indemnification.
label: HH2

text: The Union hereby agrees that it will indemnify and hold the City harmless from any claims,
label: BODY

text: actions or proceedings commenced by an employee against the City arising out of deductions
label: BODY

text: made by the City pursuant to this Article.
label: BODY

text: Section 5.4. Precedence of This Contract.
label: HH2

text: The City agrees not to enter into any agreement or contract with City employees covered by this
label: BODY

text: Contract, individually or collectively, that in any way conflicts with the terms and provisions of
label: BODY

text: this Contract. Any such agreements shall be null and void.
label: BODY

text: Section 5.5. Bulletin Boards.
label: HH2

text: The City will erect bulletin boards for exclusive use by the Union and place them
label: BODY

text: in appropriate locations. Notices shall be restricted to the following:
label: BODY

text: Notices of Union elections;
label: BODY

text: Notices of Union meetings;
label: BODY

text: Notices of Union appointments and results of Union elections;
label: BODY

text: Notices of Union recreational and social affairs; and,
label: BODY

text: Such other notices as may be mutually agreed upon.
label: BODY

text: Any change in the location of such bulletin boards shall be approved by the
label: BODY

text: Appointing Authority and the Union President or their designated representatives.
label: BODY

text: Notices of announcements shall not contain anything political or controversial or
label: BODY

text: anything reflecting upon the City, any of its employees or any labor organization
label: BODY

text: among its employees. No material, notices or announcements, which violate the
label: BODY

text: provisions of this Section 5.5 shall be posted. The Director of the Department of
label: BODY

text: Human Resources or designee and the Union President shall be responsible for
label: BODY

text: dealing with violations of this Section 5.5.
label: BODY

text: Section 5.6. Solicitation of Membership.
label: HH2

text: Solicitation of membership or other internal Union business shall be conducted during the non-
label: BODY

text: duty hours of all employees concerned; provided, however, that a representative from the Union
label: BODY

text: shall be permitted to attend any established City, department or division orientation sessions for
label: BODY

text: new hires into the bargaining unit for the purpose of making a presentation on behalf of the
label: BODY

text: Union.
label: BODY

text: Section 5.7. PEOPLE Checkoff.
label: HH2

text: The City of Columbus will deduct voluntary contributions to the American Federation of State,
label: BODY

text: County and Municipal Employee International Union’s Public Employees Organized to Promote
label: BODY

text: Legislative Equality (PEOPLE) Committee from the wages of an employee upon receipt from
label: BODY

text: the Union of an individual written authorization card voluntarily executed by the employee.
label: BODY

text: The contribution amount will be certified to the City by the Union. Money deducted shall be
label: BODY

text: remitted to the Union no later than ten (10) days following the end of the pay period in which the
label: BODY

text: deduction is made, if so approved by the City Auditor. Payment shall be made to the Treasurer
label: BODY

text: of PEOPLE and transmitted to Ohio Council 8, AFSCME, AFL-CIO, 6800 North High Street,
label: BODY

text: Worthington, Ohio 43085. The payment will be accompanied by an alphabetical list of the
label: BODY

text: names of those employees for whom a deduction was made and the amount of the deduction.
label: BODY

text: This list must be separate from the list of employees who had union dues deducted and the list
label: BODY

text: of employees who had fair share fees deducted.
label: BODY

text: An employee shall have the right to revoke such authorization by giving written notice to the City
label: BODY

text: and the Union at any time.
label: BODY

text: The City’s obligation to make deductions shall terminate automatically upon receipt of
label: BODY

text: revocation of authorization or upon termination of employment or transfer to a job classification
label: BODY

text: outside the bargaining unit.
label: BODY

text: All PEOPLE contributions shall be made as a deduction separate from the dues and fair share
label: BODY

text: fee deductions.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 6 - UNION OFFICERS, STEWARDS AND REPRESENTATIONS
label: HH1

text: Section 6.1. Authorized Union Representatives.
label: HH2

text: Employees of the City who will be recognized as representatives of the Union and who will be
label: BODY

text: authorized to conduct union business on City time as specified in this Article 6 shall be limited to
label: BODY

text: the following:
label: BODY

text: Union President
label: BODY

text: Union Vice-President
label: BODY

text: Chief Stewards - This category of Union representatives shall consist of eight (8)
label: BODY

text: individuals to be selected by the Union President. These eight individuals shall include
label: BODY

text: two (2) Floating Chief Stewards. The Floating Chief Stewards shall have authority to
label: BODY

text: represent the Union in all Departments of the City only in the absence of a designated
label: BODY

text: Chief Steward. The other six (6) Chief Stewards will be limited to representing
label: BODY

text: bargaining unit employees in the following department groupings:
label: BODY

text: 1 from the Department of Public Safety
label: BODY

text: 1 from the Department of Public Service
label: BODY

text: 1 from the Department of Public Utilities
label: BODY

text: 1 from the Department of Recreation and Parks
label: BODY

text: 1 from the Department of Development
label: BODY

text: 1 from the Departments of Technology and Finance and Management; and the
label: BODY

text: Offices of the City Auditor, Treasurer, and City Attorney (to be selected from
label: BODY

text: among the employees in these areas)
label: BODY

text: The Chief Stewards for each of the above-listed six department groupings shall be
label: BODY

text: employed in the Department or Department group they are representing.
label: BODY

text: Stewards - This category of Union representative shall consist of thirty-eight (38)
label: BODY

text: individuals to be selected by the Union President from among the bargaining unit
label: BODY

text: employees in the following departments and in the numbers specified below for each
label: BODY

text: department(s)/division(s):
label: BODY

text: Departments of Technology and Finance and Management; and the Offices of
label: BODY

text: the City Auditor, Treasurer, and City Attorney
label: BODY

text: 1 Steward - Technology, Auditor, Treasurer,
label: BODY

text: Finance and Management and City Attorney
label: BODY

text: 1 Steward – Facilities Management
label: BODY

text: 3 Stewards – Fleet Management
label: BODY

text: Department of Public Safety
label: BODY

text: 2 Stewards - First Shift
label: BODY

text: 1 Steward - Second Shift
label: BODY

text: 1 Steward - Third Shift
label: BODY

text: The Stewards for each of the above-listed departments/divisions shall be employed in

text: the department/division they are representing.

text: The names of all Union officers, Chief Stewards and Stewards and the particular

text: Section 6.2. Union Business That Authorized Union Representatives May Conduct on
label: HH2

text: City Time.
label: HH1

text: Authorized Union representatives as defined and limited by Section 6.1 shall be permitted to
label: BODY

text: conduct the following Union business on City time, subject to the scheduling provisions of
label: BODY

text: Section 6.3.
label: BODY

text: Stewards - Stewards shall be limited to investigating grievances or alleged grievances
label: BODY

text: raised by employees of the bargaining unit at their work location. Stewards may also
label: BODY

text: draft, review and refer grievances to their Chief Steward for filing and further processing.
label: BODY

text: The Stewards may not conduct any other Union business on their work time or the work
label: BODY

text: time of the employee(s) seeking assistance with a grievance. Stewards may not leave
label: BODY

text: their assigned work location to conduct any of the Union business as referenced in this
label: BODY

text: paragraph (they may not, for example, go to the Union Hall to research or investigate a
label: BODY

text: grievance).
label: BODY

text: Chief Stewards - Chief Stewards shall be limited to the following matters. Only one (1)
label: BODY

text: Chief Steward may be present at any of the events enumerated in (1) through (7) below,
label: BODY

text: unless they are a witness or a grievant.
label: BODY

text: Investigate and draft grievances in those work areas that do not have a
label: BODY

text: Steward on site or when the assigned Steward is absent;
label: BODY

text: Review all grievances drafted by subordinate Stewards and file all
label: BODY

text: grievances at Step 1;
label: BODY

text: Attend, as the Union's representative, Steps 1 and 2 grievance hearings;
label: BODY

text: Attend investigatory interviews of the employee who is the focus of the
label: BODY

text: investigation provided under Article 10.
label: BODY

text: Attend other meetings at the specific request of an employee where the
label: BODY

text: employee reasonably believes the meeting may lead to disciplinary
label: BODY

text: charges;
label: BODY

text: Attend disciplinary hearings conducted under Article 10 with the Union
label: BODY

text: President; and
label: BODY

text: Respond to extreme emergencies involving the health or safety of a
label: BODY

text: bargaining unit employee.
label: BODY

text: Conducting investigatory interviews of the employee who is the focus of the investigation
label: BODY

text: pursuant to Article 10 shall be coordinated with a Union representative if requested by
label: BODY

text: the employee. Step 1 grievance hearings shall be coordinated with the Chief Steward.
label: BODY

text: The Chief Steward for each department shall be limited to handling the above matters
label: BODY

text: within his/her assigned department. The Floating Chief Steward(s) may also provide
label: BODY

text: coverage for a Chief Steward in the event of unavoidable conflicts or leaves of absences
label: BODY

text: of a Chief Steward.
label: BODY

text: Time spent by a Chief Steward or Steward conducting Union business outside their
label: BODY

text: regularly scheduled duty hours shall not be considered time worked for any purpose, nor
label: BODY

text: shall it be compensated by the City in any way. Time spent by employees meeting on
label: BODY

text: Union business outside their regularly scheduled duty hours shall not be considered time
label: BODY

text: worked for any purpose, nor shall it be compensated by the City in any way (for
label: BODY

text: example, time spent by a third shift employee meeting with a Chief Steward in his/her
label: BODY

text: department on first shift).
label: BODY

text: Union Vice President - The Union Vice President shall conduct second (2) step
label: BODY

text: grievance hearings; act in the place of the Union President or Chief Stewards, as
label: BODY

text: needed; attend labor/management meetings and other related functions.
label: BODY

text: Union business, other than that mentioned above, shall not be conducted by a Steward or any
label: BODY

text: other employee on City time. Union business that is specifically permitted by this Contract to be
label: BODY

text: conducted on City time shall be scheduled to minimize interference with the work assignment of
label: BODY

text: the Chief Steward, Steward or any other employee.
label: BODY

text: Section 6.3. Procedures for Scheduling, Approving and Monitoring Time Off to Conduct
label: HH2

text: Union Business.
label: HH1

text: Union business, other than that specifically mentioned in this Article 6, shall not be conducted
label: BODY

text: on City time. No Union matter of an internal nature shall be conducted during duty hours or
label: BODY

text: overtime work. Only the Chief Steward may respond to matters involving extreme emergencies
label: BODY

text: affecting the health or safety of a bargaining unit employee.
label: BODY

text: Union business, which is specifically permitted by this Article 6 to be conducted on City time by
label: BODY

text: the Union’s representatives as defined in this Article 6, shall be scheduled to minimize
label: BODY

text: interference with the work assignment of the Steward, Chief Steward and/or employee being
label: BODY

text: assisted. This will be accomplished by requiring a Union representative to complete a Request
label: BODY

text: for Leave for Union Business Form (see Appendix D) before attending to Union business on
label: BODY

text: City time (regardless of whether attending to the Union business requires the Union
label: BODY

text: representative to leave his/her work location). Responding to short telephone inquiries or in-
label: BODY

text: person conversations initiated by others shall be the only exception to the prior approval
label: BODY

text: requirement (although such time shall be reported in the aggregate at the end of the day on a
label: BODY

text: Request for Leave for Union Business Form). This form shall specify the Union activities, which
label: BODY

text: are within the particular Union representative's jurisdiction with which to deal (as specifically
label: BODY

text: provided in this Article 6). The form shall be submitted as far in advance as possible to the
label: BODY

text: Union representative's designated management representative for approval before attending to
label: BODY

text: Union business. In addition, the Union representative shall contact the designated management
label: BODY

text: representative of the employee seeking assistance to schedule an appropriate time to discuss
label: BODY

text: Union business, with due regard to the demands of the workplace if such assistance is provided
label: BODY

text: during the duty hours of the employee involved. In the event of a bona fide emergency where it
label: BODY

text: is impracticable for the Union representative to submit the Request for Leave for Union
label: BODY

text: Business Form in advance, such form shall be completed and submitted immediately after
label: BODY

text: attending to such emergency situation, with an explanation of the emergency circumstances
label: BODY

text: involved and the time spent attending to them.
label: BODY

text: Union business leave shall be submitted to payroll as is the case with any other leave form, and
label: BODY

text: shall be tracked in the payroll accounting system like any other leave of absence. The Union
label: BODY

text: President and the Director of Human Resources or designee shall both be provided with
label: BODY

text: periodic reports by the City Auditor's Office through the payroll system of the time spent on
label: BODY

text: union business leave by individual stewards and chief stewards.
label: BODY

text: Any alleged abuse of this Section 6.3 or of Article 6 by the City or the Union shall result in an
label: BODY

text: immediate meeting between the Director of Human Resources or designee and the Union
label: BODY

text: President.
label: BODY

text: Section 6.4. Access to Work.
label: HH2

text: The Chief Steward, a representative of Ohio Council 8, and the President or Vice-President of
label: BODY

text: the Union may consult employees in the assembly area before the start of and at the completion
label: BODY

text: of the day's work. With the approval of the Director of Human Resources or designee and
label: BODY

text: notification to the Division Administrator, these same individuals shall be permitted access to
label: BODY

text: work areas solely for the purpose of adjusting grievances, assisting in the settlement of disputes
label: BODY

text: or carrying into effect the provisions and aims of this Contract. This privilege is extended subject
label: BODY

text: to the understanding that such access will not in fact interfere with work time or work
label: BODY

text: assignments. Any suspected abuse of these privileges shall be resolved through a meeting of
label: BODY

text: the City and the Union.
label: BODY

text: Section 6.5. Privileges of the Representative of Ohio Council 8 and Union President and
label: HH2

text: Vice-President.
label: HH1

text: The representative of Ohio Council 8, and the President and Vice-President of the Union shall
label: BODY

text: have the privileges accorded to a Chief Steward by this Contract. Any suspected abuse of these
label: BODY

text: privileges shall be resolved through a meeting of the City and the Union.
label: BODY

text: Section 6.6. Transfer of Union Representatives.
label: HH2

text: Stewards, Chief Stewards and Union officers shall not be assigned or transferred to a new
label: BODY

text: location unless suitable and satisfactory reasons exist to warrant such an assignment or
label: BODY

text: transfer. Such reasons will be discussed with the Union President in advance by the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority or designee.
label: BODY

text: Section 6.7. Release Time for Union Conventions, Seminars.
label: HH2

text: Union business leave with pay shall be granted for up to eight (8) persons from Local 1632 to
label: BODY

text: attend Union seminars, Union conventions or educational seminars. Such leave shall not
label: BODY

text: exceed four hundred (400) hours collectively per calendar year and shall be permitted with the
label: BODY

text: prior approval of the Director of Human Resources or designee. Request for such leave shall be
label: BODY

text: submitted well in advance using the Request for Leave for Union Business Form (see Appendix
label: BODY

text: D). Further, joint trainings and the number of Union representatives attending said joint training
label: BODY

text: must be agreed upon by the City and the Union and shall not be charged to Union leave.
label: BODY

text: Section 6.8. Release Time for Union President and Vice-President.
label: HH2

text: The President and Vice-President of Local 1632, upon election to their post and as long as they
label: BODY

text: continue in that post, will be permitted to devote their full time during the workweek to Union
label: BODY

text: matters while continuing in their City job classification(s). The Union President's and Vice-
label: BODY

text: President's entitlement to their hourly wage, fringe benefits and seniority accrual will continue as
label: BODY

text: though they were performing their normal job-related duties. The President and Vice-President
label: BODY

text: of Local 1632 will not, however, be eligible to receive overtime or holiday-worked pay.
label: BODY

text: Section 6.9. Release Time for Union Bargaining Team.
label: HH2

text: Prior to the first session of negotiations, the City’s Chief Negotiator will meet with the Presidents
label: BODY

text: and Vice-Presidents of Locals 1632 and 2191 to determine the size and composition of the
label: BODY

text: Union's negotiation team. Union bargaining committee members who participate in negotiations
label: BODY

text: with the City shall be paid for time lost during regular working hours to attend such meetings.
label: BODY

text: Section 6.10. Special Union Leave Without Pay.
label: HH2

text: Upon request of the Union, the City will place up to two (2) full-time Union representatives on
label: BODY

text: administrative leave without pay for periods not to exceed one (1) year.
label: BODY

text: Section 6.11. Proper Authorization for Release Time Required.
label: HH2

text: The privileges listed above do not authorize any Union representative to be absent from his/her
label: BODY

text: job or work without proper notification to and authorization from a designated management
label: BODY

text: representative and any other authorization required under this Article, which authorization will
label: BODY

text: not be unreasonably withheld to delay the Union's compliance with time deadlines.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 7 - JOINT LABOR-MANAGEMENT COMMITTEES
label: HH1

text: Section 7.1.
label: HH2

text: Quality of Working Life Program.
label: BODY

text: Purpose.  The Quality of Working Life Program is a way to provide an opportunity
label: BODY

text: for discussion, experimentation, and improvement of all areas of the City. It is
label: BODY

text: designed to help employees better understand the function of municipal services
label: BODY

text: and the relationship between these services and the employee's role in
label: BODY

text: maintaining, delivering and developing those services. Effective and efficient
label: BODY

text: public service is a responsibility shared by employees and management; and
label: BODY

text: increased sharing of these responsibilities will engender better public service.
label: BODY

text: The City and Union incorporate by reference the Memorandum of Mutual Trust
label: BODY

text: dated July 1984.
label: BODY

text: QWL City-Wide Committee.  A City-Wide Quality of Working Life Committee (the
label: BODY

text: "Committee") is responsible for defining and interpreting the procedures used
label: BODY

text: within the Quality of Working Life Program. Membership on this Committee is
label: BODY

text: restricted to the following: the Mayor or designee, the City’s Chief Negotiator or
label: BODY

text: designee, the Director or designee of each department participating in the QWL
label: BODY

text: Program, the Regional Director of AFSCME, Ohio Council 8 or designee, the
label: BODY

text: President of Local 1632 or designee, the President of Local 2191 or designee,
label: BODY

text: and one Union representative from each department participating in the QWL
label: BODY

text: program.
label: BODY

text: QWL Subcommittees.  The Committee may establish Quality of Working Life
label: BODY

text: subcommittees in reporting locations with bargaining unit employees.
label: BODY

text: Membership on these subcommittees will conform to rules of membership
label: BODY

text: established by the City-Wide QWL Committee. These subcommittees may
label: BODY

text: propose improvements or modifications specifically confined to their reporting
label: BODY

text: location. All such proposed modifications are subject to approval by the City-
label: BODY

text: Wide QWL Committee.
label: BODY

text: Scope of QWL Program.  Neither the Committee or any subcommittee shall have
label: BODY

text: authority to change or abridge the intent or spirit of contractual provisions which
label: BODY

text: prevail through this Contract. Further, disputes which have been submitted
label: BODY

text: through the grievance procedure shall be beyond the scope of the QWL
label: BODY

text: Program.
label: BODY

text: Section 7.2. Health and Safety Committee.
label: HH2

text: General.
label: BODY

text: There shall be a Joint Labor-Management Health and Safety Committee.
label: BODY

text: The Union representatives shall be selected by the Local Union
label: BODY

text: President.
label: BODY

text: The Joint committee shall request the Occupational Safety and Health
label: BODY

text: Programs Administrator or the City’s Occupational Health and Safety
label: BODY

text: Program to perform the following functions, as needed:
label: BODY

text: Make or cause to be made periodic inspections of the various
label: BODY

text: work locations when necessary.
label: BODY

text: Make recommendations for the correction of unsafe or harmful
label: BODY

text: work conditions and the elimination of unsafe or harmful practices.
label: BODY

text: Upon specific request, review and analyze reports of work-related
label: BODY

text: injury or illness, investigate causes of same, and recommend
label: BODY

text: rules and procedures for the prevention of accidents and disease
label: BODY

text: and for the promotion of health and safety of employees.
label: BODY

text: Promote health and safety education.
label: BODY

text: Request that the Safety Office investigate any worker exposure to
label: BODY

text: potentially dangerous substances, fumes, noise, dust, etc.
label: BODY

text: Receive in writing the identification of any potentially toxic
label: BODY

text: substance to which the workers are exposed together with
label: BODY

text: material data sheets, if any, upon specific request.
label: BODY

text: The City shall keep minutes of all meetings and provide Union
label: BODY

text: representatives with copies.
label: BODY

text: The City shall pay Union members of the Committee at their regular rate
label: BODY

text: for all time spent on Committee business, including time spent in
label: BODY

text: meetings and training.
label: BODY

text: The Committee may ask the advice, opinion and suggestions of experts
label: BODY

text: and authorities on safety matters. The Committee shall have the right to
label: BODY

text: call to the work location such experts and authorities, as well as
label: BODY

text: International Representatives of the Union, and they shall be permitted to
label: BODY

text: make such examinations, investigations and recommendations as shall
label: BODY

text: be reasonably connected with the purposes of the Committee.
label: BODY

text: The City and Union committee co-chairs are responsible for creating the
label: BODY

text: meeting agenda.  Provided there is a specific agenda, the Committee
label: BODY

text: shall meet bi-monthly, unless the parties agree to meet at different times.
label: BODY

text: The agenda shall be distributed to committee members at least seven (7)
label: BODY

text: days prior to committee meetings.  The City and Union commit to having
label: BODY

text: the human resources, health and safety personnel and Union officers
label: BODY

text: present at committee meetings who have the information and authority to
label: BODY

text: resolve agenda items.
label: BODY

text: Any safety emergency shall be immediately reported to Department or
label: BODY

text: Citywide safety personnel.
label: BODY

text: Health and Safety. The safety of employees is a mutual concern of the City and
label: BODY

text: the Union. The Union will cooperate with the City in encouraging employees to
label: BODY

text: observe applicable safety rules and regulations.
label: BODY

text: It shall be the exclusive responsibility of the City to provide for the safety
label: BODY

text: of its employees by providing safe work conditions, safe work areas, safe
label: BODY

text: work methods and appropriate safety equipment when such equipment is
label: BODY

text: required in connection with the employee's job duties.
label: BODY

text: The City retains the exclusive responsibility to provide a safe and
label: BODY

text: healthful work place and conditions of employment.
label: BODY

text: To the extent the Union has acquired certain participatory rights in the
label: BODY

text: preceding subparagraphs of Section 7.2; it is not the intent of the parties
label: BODY

text: to diminish the City's exclusive responsibility or to make the Union and/or
label: BODY

text: its officers, agents, or representatives liable for any employee's job-
label: BODY

text: related injury, illness or death.
label: BODY

text: During the term of this Contract, the City may form a city-wide labor–
label: BODY

text: management committee. If such a committee is formed, Union
label: BODY

text: membership shall be proportionate to the membership of each respective
label: BODY

text: participating bargaining unit. City members of the committee shall not
label: BODY

text: exceed the total number of union members. Once such a committee is
label: BODY

text: operational it shall replace the current committee.
label: BODY

text: Employees shall have the right and responsibility to report unsafe
label: BODY

text: equipment and/or working conditions first to their designated person at
label: BODY

text: each work location and then to a representative of the city-wide safety
label: BODY

text: office.
label: BODY

text: Section 7.3. General Labor-Management Meetings.
label: HH2

text: The parties agree to continue the Joint Labor\Management Committee. The City agrees to meet
label: BODY

text: with the Union upon request to discuss matters of mutual interest relating to the employees
label: BODY

text: covered by this Contract. The Union shall be entitled to not more than five (5) representatives
label: BODY

text: with no loss of pay to attend the meeting.
label: BODY

text: Section 7.4. Insurance Committee.
label: HH2

text: The parties agree to continue the joint labor-management insurance committee to provide a
label: BODY

text: forum to discuss concerns regarding insurance. The committee will meet when the Union or the
label: BODY

text: City requests such a meeting.  During the term of this Contract, the City may establish another
label: BODY

text: joint labor-management insurance committee and invite members of other bargaining units to
label: BODY

text: participate. If other bargaining unit representatives agree to participate then union membership
label: BODY

text: shall be in proportion to the size of the bargaining units participating. Upon the operation of the
label: BODY

text: new committee, the current committee shall cease to exist. The number of City representatives
label: BODY

text: on the committee shall never exceed the total number of Union representatives.
label: BODY

text: Section 7.5. Civil Service Committee.
label: HH2

text: The Union will continue to meet with representatives of the Civil Service Commission and the
label: BODY

text: Director of Human Resources or designee on a periodic basis to discuss matters of mutual
label: BODY

text: concern.
label: BODY

text: During the term of this Contract the parties will meet to discuss specific proposals and concerns
label: BODY

text: regarding transfers, layoffs, and/or promotions. Either party may bring to the bargaining table, in
label: BODY

text: the bargaining of a successor contract, recommendations regarding these three (3) topics.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 8 - CENTRAL WORK RULES AND PERSONNEL POLICIES
label: HH1

text: Section 8.1. Establishing.
label: HH2

text: The City will establish and, from time to time, revise Central Work Rules and personnel policies;
label: BODY

text: such rules shall not be in conflict with this Contract. Such rules and policies shall be uniformly
label: BODY

text: applied and any work rules made by individual departments or divisions shall not be in conflict
label: BODY

text: with the Central Work Rules and personnel policies.
label: BODY

text: Section 8.2. Posting.
label: HH2

text: When existing Central Work Rules and personnel policies are changed or new Central Work
label: BODY

text: Rules and personnel policies are established, the appropriate parties will be notified. The City
label: BODY

text: shall furnish the Union with a copy of the changed or new rule or personnel policy at least fifteen
label: BODY

text: (15) days prior to the effective date. In an emergency situation, the Union will be given
label: BODY

text: immediate notice of the affected changes. The changed or new Central Work Rule or personnel
label: BODY

text: policies shall be posted prominently on all bulletin boards for a period of seven (7) consecutive
label: BODY

text: days before becoming effective unless an emergency situation requires Central Work Rules or
label: BODY

text: personnel policies to become effective immediately.
label: BODY

text: Section 8.3. Notification.
label: HH2

text: The City will furnish each affected employee of the bargaining unit with a copy of all Central
label: BODY

text: Work Rules and personnel policies within thirty (30) days after they become effective. Upon
label: BODY

text: request, all Central Work Rules and personnel policies will be available for employees to view.
label: BODY

text: New employees shall be provided with a copy of the Central Work Rules and personnel policies
label: BODY

text: at the time of hire.
label: BODY

text: Section 8.4. Enforcement.
label: HH2

text: Employees shall comply with all Central Work Rules and personnel policies. Such rules and
label: BODY

text: policies shall be uniformly applied and uniformly enforced.
label: BODY

text: Section 8.5. Grievance.
label: HH2

text: Any unresolved complaint as to the reasonableness of any new or revised
label: BODY

text: Central Work Rule or personnel policy or any complaint involving discrimination
label: BODY

text: in the application of any Central Work Rules or personnel policies shall be
label: BODY

text: resolved through the grievance procedure as outlined in Article 11.
label: BODY

text: If a grievance concerning the unreasonableness of a new or revised Central
label: BODY

text: Work Rule or personnel policy results in a modification or elimination of that
label: BODY

text: Central Work Rule or personnel policy, the employee shall be made whole for
label: BODY

text: any and all actions taken as a result of an infraction of that Central Work Rule or
label: BODY

text: personnel policy, to the extent specified in the settlement or arbitration award
label: BODY

text: disposing of such grievance.
label: BODY

text: Section 8.6. Distribution.
label: HH2

text: The City shall maintain a mechanism for global availability of Central Work Rules and personnel
label: BODY

text: policies.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 9 - NO DISCRIMINATION OR COERCION
label: HH1

text: Section 9.1. No Discrimination (EEO).
label: HH2

text: In accordance with applicable law, the provisions of this Contract shall be applied
label: BODY

text: equally to all employees in the bargaining unit without discrimination as to age,
label: BODY

text: sex, marital status, race, color, creed, national origin, disability, sexual
label: BODY

text: orientation, veteran status or political affiliation. The Union shall share equally
label: BODY

text: with the City the responsibility for applying this provision of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: Sexual harassment shall be considered discrimination under this Article. Sexual
label: BODY

text: harassment as prohibited by this Article shall be defined and governed in
label: BODY

text: accordance with applicable state and federal laws, and includes any unwanted
label: BODY

text: sexual attention.
label: BODY

text: Section 9.2. No Discrimination (Union Membership, Activity and Representation).
label: HH2

text: The City recognizes the right of all eligible employees to be free to join the Union
label: BODY

text: and to participate in lawful concerted Union activities. Therefore, the City agrees
label: BODY

text: there shall be no discrimination, interference, restraint, coercion or reprisal by the
label: BODY

text: City against any employee as a result of Union membership or the lawful activity
label: BODY

text: of any member acting in an official capacity on behalf of the Union.
label: BODY

text: The Union recognizes its responsibility as bargaining agent and agrees to
label: BODY

text: represent all employees in the bargaining unit without discrimination,
label: BODY

text: interference, restraint, or coercion. The Union agrees not to intimidate or coerce
label: BODY

text: any employee in an effort to recruit membership in the Union.
label: BODY

text: In filling job vacancies, the City agrees that any Union members appearing on a
label: BODY

text: properly certified Civil Service Commission eligible list shall not be discriminated
label: BODY

text: against as a result of such Union affiliation.
label: BODY

text: Section 9.3. No Discrimination (Application of Contract and Work Rules).
label: HH2

text: The City will not discriminate among employees in the bargaining unit in the application of the
label: BODY

text: terms of this Contract or in the application of City work rules.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 10 - DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURE
label: HH1

text: Section 10.1. Investigation.
label: HH2

text: When an Appointing Authority or designee acquires knowledge which may lead
label: BODY

text: to disciplinary action against an employee or employees, the Appointing Authority
label: BODY

text: or designee shall begin an investigation as soon as possible. The Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority or designee shall investigate all complaints against employees, whether
label: BODY

text: complainant is identified or anonymous.
label: BODY

text: The investigation shall be thorough and complete, and may include, but is not
label: BODY

text: limited to, interviewing possible witnesses, including other bargaining unit
label: BODY

text: members, and locating and researching any relevant documents. Any employee
label: BODY

text: who may be a focus of the investigation may be interviewed as part of the
label: BODY

text: investigatory process, in which event he/she may, upon request, have a Union
label: BODY

text: representative present during that interview.  If a Union representative is not
label: BODY

text: available, and the employee desires a Union representative be present, the
label: BODY

text: interview will be rescheduled within a reasonable period of time to permit the
label: BODY

text: Union to be present.  Interviews will be conducted in private.
label: BODY

text: The investigation must be concluded within a reasonable length of time, not to
label: BODY

text: exceed thirty (30) days, except for those situations set forth in Section 10.8.
label: BODY

text: Investigatory interviews or meetings conducted by the Internal Affairs Bureau and
label: BODY

text: the Division of Police will be subject to tape recording.
label: BODY

text: Section 10.2. Notice to Union After Completion of Investigation.
label: HH2

text: After the investigation has been completed, the Appointing Authority or designee will notify the
label: BODY

text: Union of the results of the investigation. This notice shall be provided on a form agreed upon by
label: BODY

text: the parties, notifying the Union of one of the following results:
label: BODY

text: Counseling, which may be oral or written, is not considered disciplinary action; or
label: BODY

text: Issuance of an oral reprimand; or
label: BODY

text: Issuance of a written reprimand; or
label: BODY

text: Notice that the Appointing Authority intends to bring disciplinary charges against
label: BODY

text: the affected employee(s); or
label: BODY

text: Notice that the Appointing Authority intends to end the investigation with no
label: BODY

text: further action.
label: BODY

text: Said notice shall be provided to the Union as soon as practicable, but no later than thirty (30)
label: BODY

text: days after the Appointing Authority or designee gained knowledge of alleged misconduct by any
label: BODY

text: employee, or at the conclusion of a criminal investigation or investigation of other allegations
label: BODY

text: that local, state, or federal laws or executive orders of the Mayor, have been violated, or at the
label: BODY

text: conclusion of criminal proceedings if criminal charges are filed against the employee.
label: BODY

text: The Notice of Results of Investigation (i.e., Summary of Investigation) shall contain the facts
label: BODY

text: surrounding the incident that was investigated.
label: BODY

text: Section 10.3. Service of Disciplinary Actions.
label: HH2

text: If, disciplinary charges are brought against any employee after the investigation
label: BODY

text: has been completed, they shall be furnished to the employee in writing on a form
label: BODY

text: agreed upon by the City and the Union and signed by the Appointing Authority or
label: BODY

text: designee within ten (10) days after notice to the Union that the investigation has
label: BODY

text: been completed. A copy of such form shall be given to the Union President ten
label: BODY

text: (10) days prior to the hearing.  Failure to provide a timely notice to the President
label: BODY

text: shall not result in the charges being dismissed. The Union shall be notified of the
label: BODY

text: time and location of the hearing on the disciplinary charges and shall have the
label: BODY

text: right to attend said hearing for the purpose of representing the employee and/or
label: BODY

text: to protect the integrity of this Contract.
label: BODY

text: Oral and written reprimands, signed by the Appointing Authority or designee,
label: BODY

text: shall be furnished to the employee in writing on a form agreed upon by the City
label: BODY

text: and the Union within ten (10) days after notice to the Union that the investigation
label: BODY

text: has been completed.  (See Appendix D.)
label: BODY

text: When reasonable, the Appointing Authority or designee will serve disciplinary
label: BODY

text: charges to the employee by personal service. If the employee cannot reasonably
label: BODY

text: be served in person, the Appointing Authority or designee may serve disciplinary
label: BODY

text: charges by regular U.S. mail and certified mail to the last home address
label: BODY

text: furnished by the employee(s) to the Appointing Authority or designee.
label: BODY

text: Mail service shall be deemed complete three (3) days after mailing the
label: BODY

text: disciplinary charges or reprimand to the employee’s home address.
label: BODY

text: Section 10.4. Hearing on Disciplinary Charges.
label: HH2

text: A hearing on the merits of the disciplinary charges shall be conducted by the
label: BODY

text: Director of the Department of Human Resources or designee within thirty (30)
label: BODY

text: days from the delivery of the charges to the employee. All hearings will be
label: BODY

text: conducted in a fair manner, and the designated hearing officer will not assume
label: BODY

text: the role of prosecutor in disciplinary hearings.
label: BODY

text: If an Appointing Authority or designee brings disciplinary charges against an
label: BODY

text: employee as a result of an investigation prompted by a complaint, the
label: BODY

text: complainant will be called to testify at the hearing if reasonably possible, unless
label: BODY

text: there is sufficient independent evidence to prove the charges by a
label: BODY

text: preponderance.
label: BODY

text: The results of said hearing shall be in writing and given to the employee, with a
label: BODY

text: copy sent to the Union President, within twenty (20) days of the hearing.
label: BODY

text: For purposes of Article 10, disciplinary action which may be taken as a result of a
label: BODY

text: disciplinary hearing may be an oral reprimand, a written reprimand, suspension
label: BODY

text: and/or demotion or termination. Discipline shall be commensurate and
label: BODY

text: progressive. Discipline shall be only for just cause.
label: BODY

text: The City and the Union shall each be granted one (1) continuance of the
label: BODY

text: scheduled disciplinary hearing, if requested not less than one (1) work day prior
label: BODY

text: to the hearing.  Additional continuances may be granted by mutual consent
label: BODY

text: between the Director of Human Resources or designee and the Union President
label: BODY

text: or his designee in writing.  Continuances shall not be unreasonably withheld.
label: BODY

text: Thereafter, the City may order an employee to attend a disciplinary hearing, and
label: BODY

text: if the employee refuses, the City may hold the hearing in the employee’s
label: BODY

text: absence.
label: BODY

text: Section 10.5. Disciplinary Grievances.
label: HH2

text: If the Union is not satisfied with the results of the hearing, the Union may appeal this
label: BODY

text: determination to Step 2 of the grievance procedure, together with any alleged violations of
label: BODY

text: administrative procedures and time limits set forth in this Article. The Step 2 grievance meeting
label: BODY

text: shall be a meeting not a hearing; it is not the purpose of the Step 2 grievance meeting in
label: BODY

text: discipline cases to conduct a new review of the evidence and testimony, but rather to review the
label: BODY

text: case based on information and evidence developed through the disciplinary hearing conducted
label: BODY

text: pursuant to Section 10.4. Only evidence and/or information that was not available at the time of
label: BODY

text: disciplinary hearing will be independently reviewed.
label: BODY

text: Section 10.6. Leave Forfeiture or Fine In Lieu of Suspension.
label: HH2

text: The designated hearing officer, after having found an employee guilty of one or more of the
label: BODY

text: disciplinary charges, may make a recommendation as to the appropriate level of discipline.
label: BODY

text: Should this recommendation be a suspension, the Hearing Officer may make a written offer to
label: BODY

text: the employee that the employee forfeit up to one hundred twenty (120) hours of accrued
label: BODY

text: vacation or compensatory time, provided the employee has sufficient vacation and/or
label: BODY

text: compensatory time balances at the time the offer is made. Fines in an amount of one (1) to
label: BODY

text: three (3) days only for violations of Central Work Rule number 5 (Attendance) or any future
label: BODY

text: Central Work Rule addressing attendance may be offered by the Hearing Officer. If the
label: BODY

text: employee agrees to the fine or forfeiture, such accrued leave shall be one (1) hour of accrued
label: BODY

text: leave or fine for each one (1) hour of the proposed suspension. Accepting a fine or the type of
label: BODY

text: leave (vacation or compensatory time) shall be the employee’s choice. The fine or forfeiture of
label: BODY

text: the leave shall constitute corrective/disciplinary action of record, shall be accordingly noted in
label: BODY

text: the employee’s personnel file, and shall constitute the final resolution of the departmental
label: BODY

text: charges, which resolution shall not later be subject to challenge by the employee or the Union
label: BODY

text: under the grievance procedure or in any other forum. If the employee chooses to accept the
label: BODY

text: Hearing Officer's written offer, the Hearing Officer shall acknowledge the employee's
label: BODY

text: acceptance of the offer in writing. Should the Hearing Officer choose not to offer this option or
label: BODY

text: should the employee reject the offer, appropriate disciplinary action shall be imposed.
label: BODY

text: Section 10.7.   Length of Time Prior Discipline May Be Considered.
label: HH2

text: Oral reprimands may be considered in connection with subsequent disciplinary action for a
label: BODY

text: period of one (1) year.  Written reprimands may be considered in connection with subsequent
label: BODY
