text: disciplinary action for two (2) years. Any other form of disciplinary action may be considered in
label: BODY

text: connection with subsequent disciplinary action for a period of three (3) years. After the
label: BODY

text: expiration of the periods specified above, such disciplinary action shall not be used as a basis
label: BODY

text: for any further disciplinary action.
label: BODY

text: Section 10.8.   Exceptions/Extensions To Time Deadlines.
label: HH2

text: If an investigation requires more time to complete, the parties may agree to
label: BODY

text: extend the time period. Such extensions shall not be unreasonably withheld by
label: BODY

text: the Union.
label: BODY

text: The time constraint provisions of this Article shall not be applicable when actions
label: BODY

text: of a criminal or conspiracy nature or when alleged violations of other local, state
label: BODY

text: or federal laws, or Mayor’s executive orders, warrants extensive investigation, or
label: BODY

text: upon mutual consent of the parties.
label: BODY

text: If an employee is off duty on approved or unapproved leave, the time limits for
label: BODY

text: investigation, delivery of charges, hearing and results of hearing shall
label: BODY

text: automatically be tolled. The parties may agree to extend any of the time lines in
label: BODY

text: Article 10.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 11 - GRIEVANCE AND ARBITRATION PROCEDURES
label: BODY

text: Section 11.1. Definition and Purpose.
label: HH2

text: The prompt presentation, adjustment and/or answering of grievances is in the
label: BODY

text: interest of sound relations between employees and the City. The prompt and fair
label: BODY

text: disposition of grievances involves important and equal obligations and
label: BODY

text: responsibilities on the part of representatives of each party to protect and
label: BODY

text: preserve the grievance procedure as an orderly means of resolving grievances.
label: BODY

text: A "grievance" is defined as a complaint arising under and during the term of this
label: BODY

text: Contract raised by an employee or the Union against the City alleging that there
label: BODY

text: has been a violation, misinterpretation or misapplication of an express written
label: BODY

text: provision of this Contract.
label: BODY

text: A grievance classified as a “class action grievance” must contain the following, in
label: BODY

text: addition to the requirements of Section 11.4:
label: BODY

text: A community of interest shared by two or more employees; and
label: BODY

text: The classification of grieving employees; and
label: BODY

text: The identity of who will represent the grievants at hearings,
label: BODY

text: Counseling is not grievable.  Oral reprimands shall be grievable through Step 1.
label: BODY

text: Written reprimands issued by an appointing authority or designee shall be
label: BODY

text: grievable beginning at Step 1 through Step 2.
label: BODY

text: Section 11.2. Who May File A Grievance, Exclusivity of Remedy.
label: HH2

text: Grievances can be initiated by the Union or an aggrieved employee, except as otherwise
label: BODY

text: provided in this Contract (see Section 11.8(A) for special rules on disciplinary grievances).
label: BODY

text: Except as may be specifically provided elsewhere in this Contract, the grievance procedure
label: BODY

text: shall be the exclusive remedy available to the Union and to employees to redress alleged
label: BODY

text: violations of this Contract.  Nothing in this Grievance and Arbitration Procedure shall deny
label: BODY

text: members any rights available at law to achieve redress of their legal rights, including the right of
label: BODY

text: redress in another forum.  However, once a member elects to seek redress in another forum,
label: BODY

text: the member is thereafter denied the right to file or proceed further through the steps of the
label: BODY

text: Grievance and Arbitration Procedure.  Further, any relief obtained by the member under this
label: BODY

text: Contract shall be rescinded and shall not continue to be performed or provided to the extent that
label: BODY

text: the results achieved by the member in another forum is either inconsistent with the result
label: BODY

text: achieved under this Contract or is cumulative and redundant of the result achieved under this
label: BODY

text: Contract.
label: BODY

text: Section 11.3. Time Limits.
label: HH2

text: A grievance must be filed in writing within fourteen (14) days after the occurrence
label: BODY

text: of the first event giving rise to the grievance, or within fourteen (14) days after the
label: BODY

text: Union or the affected employee(s), through the use of reasonable diligence,
label: BODY

text: could have known of the first event giving rise to the grievance. If a grievance is
label: BODY

text: not presented within this fourteen (14) day filing deadline, it will be considered
label: BODY

text: "waived" and may not be pursued further by the aggrieved employee(s) or the
label: BODY

text: Union.
label: BODY

text: If a grievance is not appealed to the next step within the specified time limit or an
label: BODY

text: agreed extension thereof, it shall be considered settled on the basis of the Step 1
label: BODY

text: answer. Failure at any step of this procedure to hold a hearing or meeting or
label: BODY

text: communicate a decision on a grievance within the specified time limits shall
label: BODY

text: permit the aggrieved party to treat the grievance as denied and to proceed
label: BODY

text: immediately to the next step.
label: BODY

text: The time limits prescribed in the following steps in this Article may be extended at
label: BODY

text: any time by mutual consent of the parties involved. Similarly, any step in the
label: BODY

text: grievance procedure may be eliminated by mutual consent. Mutual consent must
label: BODY

text: be indicated in writing and signed by both parties involved. Unless otherwise
label: BODY

text: stated, days as specified herein shall be calendar days.
label: BODY

text: Section 11.4. Specificity Required in Written Grievances and Limitations on Expanding
label: HH2

text: the Scope of a Grievance.
label: HH1

text: The written grievance shall specify the section or sections of this Contract that are allegedly
label: BODY

text: violated, misinterpreted or misapplied; a detailed statement of the full facts on which the
label: BODY

text: grievance is based; the specific relief requested; the name(s) of the aggrieved employee(s) and
label: BODY

text: their position(s); the name of the lowest-level non-AFSCME supervisor(s) of the aggrieved
label: BODY

text: employee(s); the date the grievance was filed; and the signatures of the aggrieved employee(s)
label: BODY

text: and any union official assisting in the preparation of the grievance. After a grievance is filed, the
label: BODY

text: employee or the Union may amend the grievance to clarify the relevant facts and circumstances
label: BODY

text: or to correct clerical errors no later than with the Step 2 filing, but may not amend the grievance
label: BODY

text: to assert new claims, contract violations or to expand the scope of the relief sought without the
label: BODY

text: express written consent of the Director of the Department of Human Resources or designee.
label: BODY

text: Section 11.5. Grievance and Arbitration.
label: HH2

text: The following are steps that shall be followed in the processing of a grievance, and the parties
label: BODY

text: will act in good faith to limit the number of people present at each hearing.
label: BODY

text: Step 1.  A grievance shall be filed in writing (within the time limits and in the form
label: BODY

text: specified in Sections 11.3 and 11.4) with the aggrieved employee's Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority or designee. The Appointing Authority or designee shall hold a hearing
label: BODY

text: with the employee and the Chief Steward (or Local Union Vice-President in
label: BODY

text: his/her absence) within seven (7) days after receipt of the grievance. The
label: BODY

text: Appointing Authority or designee shall give a written answer, after review by the
label: BODY

text: Appointing Authority’s office, to the employee and the Chief Steward (or Local
label: BODY

text: Union Vice-President in his/her absence) within fifteen (15) days after the
label: BODY

text: hearing. If the Union does not refer the grievance to Step 2 of the procedure
label: BODY

text: within seven (7) days after receipt of the decision rendered in this Step, the
label: BODY

text: grievance shall be considered to be satisfactorily resolved.
label: BODY

text: Step 2.  (1) Step 2 Hearings for Non-Disciplinary Grievances. If the grievance is
label: BODY

text: not satisfactorily settled at Step 1, the Union may, within seven (7) days after
label: BODY

text: receipt of the Step 1 answer or within seven (7) days of when the Step 1 answer
label: BODY

text: was due, appeal the grievance to the Director of the Department of Human
label: BODY

text: Resources or designee. The Director of the Department of Human Resources or
label: BODY

text: designee shall hold a hearing with appropriate representatives of the grievant’s
label: BODY

text: department and the employee, the Chief Steward, the Local Union President or
label: BODY

text: the Vice-President, and/or a representative of Ohio Council 8 within ten (10) days
label: BODY

text: after receipt of the grievance. The Director of the Department of Human
label: BODY

text: Resources or designee, after consultation with the Appointing Authority or
label: BODY

text: designee, shall give a written answer to the employee and the Local Union
label: BODY

text: President within ten (10) days after the Step 2 hearing.
label: BODY

text: Step 2.  (2) Step 2 Meetings for Disciplinary Grievances. In disciplinary cases
label: BODY

text: (except for oral and written reprimands issued by a department), a grievance
label: BODY

text: must be filed at Step 2 by the Union within fourteen (14) days of the Hearing
label: BODY

text: Officer’s decision issued pursuant to Section 10.4 of this Contract. The Director
label: BODY

text: of the Department of Human Resources or designee and appropriate
label: BODY

text: representatives of the grievant’s department shall hold a meeting with the
label: BODY

text: employee, the Chief Steward, the Local Union President or the Vice-President,
label: BODY

text: and/or a representative of Ohio Council 8 within ten (10) days after receipt of the
label: BODY

text: grievance. The hearing officer conducting the Step 2 disciplinary grievance
label: BODY

text: meeting shall not be the same hearing officer who conducted the disciplinary
label: BODY

text: hearing pursuant to Section 10.4. The review of disciplinary cases at Step 2 shall
label: BODY

text: be a meeting to review the case, not a hearing. The Director of the Department of
label: BODY

text: Human Resources or designee, after consultation with the Appointing Authority
label: BODY

text: or designee, shall give a written answer to the employee and the Local Union
label: BODY

text: President within ten (10) days after the Step 2 meeting.
label: BODY

text: Step 3.
label: BODY

text: If the grievance is not satisfactorily settled at Step 2, the Union may,
label: BODY

text: within thirty (30) days after receipt of the Step 2 answer or within thirty
label: BODY

text: (30) days of when the Step 2 answer was due, submit the issue to
label: BODY

text: arbitration. The Union shall notify the Director of the Department of
label: BODY

text: Human Resources or designee of its intent to submit the grievance to
label: BODY

text: arbitration.
label: BODY

text: A permanent panel of five (5) arbitrators and three (3) alternates will be
label: BODY

text: selected by the parties. An arbitrator shall be selected from the panel to
label: BODY

text: hear grievances through random drawing. For all grievances filed after
label: BODY

text: the effective date of this Contract, an arbitrator shall be selected within
label: BODY

text: 365 days of the Union’s notice of intent to submit the matter to arbitration
label: BODY

text: or the grievance will be waived.  The parties may extend the Union’s
label: BODY

text: deadline to select an arbitrator by mutual consent in writing.
label: BODY

text: Continuances shall not be unreasonably withheld.  Once selected, the
label: BODY

text: arbitrator’s name will no longer be available for selection until all
label: BODY

text: remaining arbitrators on the panel have been selected.
label: BODY

text: The arbitrator shall be notified of his/her selection by a joint letter from the
label: BODY

text: Director of the Department of Human Resources or designee and the
label: BODY

text: Union requesting that he/she set a date and time for the hearing subject
label: BODY

text: to the availability of the City and Union representatives, provided that the
label: BODY

text: hearing must be held within thirty (30) calendar days following the
label: BODY

text: selection of the arbitrator. If the selected arbitrator is unable to schedule
label: BODY

text: the hearing within the thirty (30) day period, the parties may select
label: BODY

text: another arbitrator.
label: BODY

text: After all arbitrators on the panel have been selected once, the above
label: BODY

text: process regarding random drawing will be repeated.
label: BODY

text: The parties may mutually agree to remove an arbitrator from the panel
label: BODY

text: after he/she has issued at least one decision.
label: BODY

text: All arbitrations shall be held in the City of Columbus, Ohio. The fees and
label: BODY

text: expenses of the arbitrator shall be borne equally by the City and the
label: BODY

text: Union.  The arbitrator's decision shall be rendered within thirty (30) days
label: BODY

text: after the close of the hearing or the submission of post-hearing briefs by
label: BODY

text: the parties, whichever occurs later.
label: BODY

text: The arbitrator shall have no right to amend, modify, nullify, ignore, add to, or
label: BODY

text: subtract from the provisions of this Agreement. The arbitrator shall consider and
label: BODY

text: decide only the question of whether there has been a violation, misinterpretation
label: BODY

text: or misapplication of the specific provisions of this Contract based on the specific
label: BODY

text: issue submitted to the arbitrator by the parties in writing. If no joint written
label: BODY

text: stipulation of the issue is agreed to by the Union and the City, the arbitrator shall
label: BODY

text: be empowered to determine and decide the issue raised by the grievance as
label: BODY

text: submitted in writing at Step 1. The arbitrator shall be without power to make
label: BODY

text: recommendations contrary to or inconsistent with any applicable laws or rules
label: BODY

text: and regulations of administrative bodies that have the force and effect of law.
label: BODY

text: The arbitrator shall not in any way limit or interfere with the powers, duties and
label: BODY

text: responsibilities of the City under law and applicable court decisions. The decision
label: BODY

text: of the arbitrator, if made in accordance with the jurisdiction and authority granted
label: BODY

text: to the arbitrator pursuant to this Contract, will be accepted as final by the City,
label: BODY

text: the Union and the employee(s), and all parties will abide by it.
label: BODY

text: Grievance settlements reached at Step 1, shall be in writing, shall have a limited
label: BODY

text: application to the area of responsibility of the Appointing Authority and not
label: BODY

text: precedent setting for the City. Grievance settlements reached at Steps 2 and 3
label: BODY

text: by the Union and the City shall be in writing, and shall be final, conclusive, and
label: BODY

text: binding on the City, the Union, and the employees.
label: BODY

text: A grievance may be withdrawn by the Union at any time from the grievance
label: BODY

text: procedure, and the withdrawal of any grievance shall not be prejudicial to the
label: BODY

text: positions taken by the parties as they related to that grievance or any other
label: BODY

text: grievances.
label: BODY

text: Section 11.6. Persons with Responsibilities Under the Grievance Procedure and Scope
label: HH2

text: of Authority.
label: HH1

text: The Union shall maintain a current list of Union officers, Chief Stewards and Stewards listed by
label: BODY

text: departments and divisions. This list shall be furnished to the Director of the Department of
label: BODY

text: Human Resources or designee together with revisions as changes occur. Persons whose
label: BODY

text: names are not on this list shall not be recognized as officials of the Union for the purpose of this
label: BODY

text: Article. Furthermore, the City emphasizes that all non-AFSCME supervisors have the
label: BODY

text: responsibility for adjudicating grievances pursuant to the provisions of this Article. If requested
label: BODY

text: to do so by the Union, the City shall provide a list of first-line non-AFSCME supervisors. Such
label: BODY

text: responsibility shall prevail only over those employees assigned to that non-AFSCME supervisor.
label: BODY

text: No employee in the bargaining unit shall have any authority to settle or respond to a grievance
label: BODY

text: on behalf of the City.
label: BODY

text: Section 11.7. Time Off For Presenting Grievances.
label: HH2

text: An employee and his/her Chief Steward or other Union representative authorized
label: BODY

text: to act in the place of the Chief Steward as provided in Article 6 (Floating Chief
label: BODY

text: Steward, Union President or Vice President) shall be allowed time off from
label: BODY

text: regular duties with pay for attendance at scheduled hearings and meetings under
label: BODY

text: the grievance procedure with proper notification to their respective supervisors.
label: BODY

text: Employees must provide their own transportation unless otherwise approved by
label: BODY

text: their supervisor.  The appropriate Union representative as provided in Article 6
label: BODY

text: shall have adequate time with pay for a proper investigation of each grievance as
label: BODY

text: provided in Article 6.
label: BODY

text: The aggrieved employee and any necessary witnesses shall not lose any regular
label: BODY

text: straight-time pay for time off the job while attending a grievance hearing, meeting
label: BODY

text: or an arbitration hearing.
label: BODY

text: Section 11.8. Specific Types of Grievances.
label: HH2

text: Disciplinary Grievances.  The right of any employee to file an appeal pursuant to
label: BODY

text: Section 149-1 of the City Charter is specifically waived. If an employee or the
label: BODY

text: Union elects to challenge disciplinary action under the grievance procedure, the
label: BODY

text: grievance must be filed at Step 2.
label: BODY

text: Grievances with City-Wide Application.  A grievance with city-wide application
label: BODY

text: (i.e., involving a matter or issue of repetitive or general application) that may
label: BODY

text: affect bargaining unit employees in different divisions and departments shall be
label: BODY

text: brought directly to Step 2. Once a grievance on a matter or issue of repetitive or
label: BODY

text: general application has been resolved by the parties on the merits (i.e., by a
label: BODY

text: mutually agreed upon written settlement or an arbitration award on the merits),
label: BODY

text: the Union will not advance to arbitration any further grievances on that particular
label: BODY

text: matter or issue, unless the prior settlement or award is being violated.
label: BODY

text: No grievance settlement requiring the payment of money outside the routine
label: BODY

text: payroll operations shall be considered to be authorized by or binding upon the
label: BODY

text: City unless the settlement is authorized by the City Attorney’s office.
label: BODY

text: Grievances Involving Withholding of Terminal Pay. A grievance involving a claim
label: BODY

text: that the City has improperly withheld money allegedly owed to the City by the
label: BODY

text: employee from the employee's final pay (whether it be a final paycheck, vacation
label: BODY

text: pay, pay for sick leave bank or other terminal pay) shall be filed directly at Step 2
label: BODY

text: of the grievance procedure.
label: BODY

text: A grievance classified, as a “class action grievance” must contain the following in
label: BODY

text: addition to the requirements of Section 11.4:
label: BODY

text: A community of interest shared by two or more employees; and
label: BODY

text: The classification of grieving employees; and
label: BODY

text: The identity of who will represent the grievants at hearings.
label: BODY

text: Advance Step Filing - Summary.  The following is a summary of grievances to be
label: BODY

text: filed initially at Step 2 of the grievance procedure:
label: BODY

text: A grievance with city-wide application as provided in Section 11.8(B)
label: BODY

text: above.
label: BODY

text: A grievance involving the withholding of money from terminal pay as
label: BODY

text: provided in Section 11.8(C) above.
label: BODY

text: A grievance involving allegedly dangerous or unhealthful working
label: BODY

text: conditions as provided in Section 12.1(D).
label: BODY

text: A grievance involving a disciplinary appeal as provided in Section 10.4
label: BODY

text: and Section 11.8(A) above.
label: BODY

text: A grievance involving alleged failure of the City to follow the procedural
label: BODY

text: provisions set forth in the Injury Leave Article as provided in Section 22.6.
label: BODY

text: A grievance alleging that a permanent or temporary change to work
label: BODY

text: schedules or shifts is not reasonably related to operational needs as
label: BODY

text: provided in Section 16.2(A) and (D), respectively.
label: BODY

text: Filing of Other Grievances. All other grievances must follow the entire grievance
label: BODY

text: procedure as set forth in this Article 11, unless the parties mutually agree
label: BODY

text: otherwise in writing for a specific case.
label: BODY

text: Section 11.9.  Use of Mediation.
label: HH2

text: The parties acknowledge that they have used mediation processes in the past to expeditiously
label: BODY

text: resolve backlogs of grievances pending Step 3 (arbitration) proceedings. The parties agree that
label: BODY

text: they may utilize the services of a mediator in the future to resolve pending grievances and
label: BODY

text: written reprimands that have been grieved through Step 2. The use of a mediator for such
label: BODY

text: purposes shall be by mutual agreement of the parties as to an identified grievance or
label: BODY

text: grievances and according to procedures mutually agreed to in writing in advance of the
label: BODY

text: mediation process. The Union and City shall meet periodically to attempt to resolve matters
label: BODY

text: prior to mediation or arbitration.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 12 - NO STRIKE OR LOCKOUT
label: HH1

text: Section 12.1. No Strike.
label: HH2

text: The services performed by the City employees included in this Contract are
label: BODY

text: essential to the public's health, safety and welfare. The Union, therefore, agrees
label: BODY

text: that it will not authorize, instigate, aid, condone or engage in any strike, work
label: BODY

text: stoppage or other action at any time, which will interrupt or interfere with the
label: BODY

text: operation of the City. No employee represented by the Union shall cause or take
label: BODY

text: part in any strike, work stoppage, slowdown or other action, which will interrupt or
label: BODY

text: interfere with the operation of the City.
label: BODY

text: In the event of a violation of this Article, the Union agrees to take affirmative
label: BODY

text: steps with the employees concerned such as letters, bulletins, telegrams, and
label: BODY

text: employees' meetings to bring about an immediate resumption of normal work.
label: BODY

text: A "strike" means concerted action in failing to report to duty; willful absence from
label: BODY

text: one's position; stoppage of work; slowdown or abstinence in whole or in part from
label: BODY

text: the full, faithful, and proper performance of the duties of employment for the
label: BODY

text: purpose of inducing, influencing or coercing a change in wages, hours or other
label: BODY

text: terms and conditions of employment.
label: BODY

text: Stoppage of work by employees in good faith because of dangerous or
label: BODY

text: unhealthful working conditions at the place of employment which are abnormal to
label: BODY

text: the place of employment shall not be deemed a strike. The Union or an
label: BODY

text: employee may file a grievance at Step 2 for immediate review in the event of a
label: BODY

text: dispute over dangerous or unhealthful working conditions.
label: BODY

text: Section 12.2. Discipline of Strikers.
label: HH2

text: Subject to the protections provided to employees under Section 12.1(D), any or all employees
label: BODY

text: who violate any of the provisions of this Article may be discharged or otherwise disciplined by
label: BODY

text: the City. The failure to confer a penalty in any instance is not a waiver of such right in any other
label: BODY

text: instance nor is it a precedent.
label: BODY

text: Section 12.3. No Lockout.
label: HH2

text: The City agrees that it will neither lockout employees nor will it do anything to provoke
label: BODY

text: interruptions or prevent such continuity of performance by said employees insofar as such
label: BODY

text: performance is required in the normal and usual operation of City services.
label: BODY

text: Section 12.4. Judicial Relief.
label: HH2

text: Nothing contained herein shall preclude the City from obtaining a temporary restraining order,
label: BODY

text: damages or other judicial relief in the event the Union or any employees covered by this
label: BODY

text: Contract violate any provision of this Article 12.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 13 - SENIORITY
label: BODY

text: Section 13.1. Seniority of Probationary Employees.
label: HH2

text: New hires shall have no seniority during their probationary period of employment, but after
label: BODY

text: completion of their probationary period their seniority date shall be the date of hire used to
label: BODY

text: compute their probationary period.
label: BODY

text: Section 13.2. Accumulation of Seniority While Disabled.
label: HH2

text: An employee who remains in paid status but is unable to work because of a job- or non-job-
label: BODY

text: related injury or illness shall accumulate seniority. After ninety (90) days, the City shall conduct
label: BODY

text: a hearing to determine the employee's ability to perform the essential functions of his/her
label: BODY

text: classification.
label: BODY

text: Section 13.3. Role of Seniority in Filling Vacancies in Position Assignments within a
label: HH2

text: Division.
label: HH1

text: When a vacancy in a job classification occurs within a division, the vacancy shall be filled from
label: BODY

text: among employees in that job classification in that division as set forth below:
label: BODY

text: Position Assignments without Specialized Qualifications. Where the vacancy is a
label: BODY

text: position without specialized qualifications and employees want to switch shifts,
label: BODY

text: reporting locations or work schedules (i.e., different days off or different regular
label: BODY

text: hours), classification seniority shall determine the filling of vacancies within the
label: BODY

text: division.
label: BODY

text: Position Assignments with Specialized Qualifications. Vacancies within a
label: BODY

text: division, where the particular job assignment requires specialized qualifications
label: BODY

text: that are not shared by all employees in the job classification, shall be filled on the
label: BODY

text: basis of management’s evaluation of the specialized qualifications that
label: BODY

text: correspond to the requirements, responsibilities and duties of the position as
label: BODY

text: described by the division and associated specialized knowledge, skills, and
label: BODY

text: abilities. Provided all of the above factors are equal, classification seniority shall
label: BODY

text: determine which applicant is given the position in question.  The Union may
label: BODY

text: grieve the City’s determination that a particular job assignment or position
label: BODY

text: requires specialized qualifications.
label: BODY

text: The term "vacancy" is defined as a position to be filled, as determined by management, that
label: BODY

text: results from one of the following circumstances:
label: BODY

text: An employee has separated from a position and the Appointing Authority
label: BODY

text: has decided to fill the position;
label: BODY

text: An increase in the total number of positions in the class;
label: BODY

text: A reallocation of a position as approved by the Civil Service Commission;
label: BODY

text: An increase in the total number of positions in a class on a specific shift
label: BODY

text: or reporting location.
label: BODY

text: The term "Division" is defined as the Appropriation Unit for budgetary purposes.
label: BODY

text: An employee may exercise his/her classification seniority rights no more than once within a
label: BODY

text: ninety (90) day period under this Section 13.3. This only applies to the employee granted the
label: BODY

text: position.
label: BODY

text: Section 13.4. Seniority List.
label: HH2

text: The City will provide the Union with a seniority list of all employees of the bargaining unit upon
label: BODY

text: request. Seniority lists shall contain the name, job classification, division, and date of
label: BODY

text: classification entry of all employees of the bargaining unit. The City shall meet with the Union to
label: BODY

text: review the seniority list whenever necessary to correct any errors.
label: BODY

text: Section 13.5. Seniority in Merged Job Classifications.
label: HH2

text: The classification seniority of employees in classifications which are merged by the Civil Service
label: BODY

text: Commission shall be determined as provided herein. Where an employee has prior seniority in
label: BODY

text: any of the merged classifications, the employee's new classification seniority date shall be a
label: BODY

text: combination of the total time spent in each of the merged classifications.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 14 - TEMPORARY ASSIGNMENTS
label: HH1

text: Section 14.1. Transitional Return to Work.
label: HH2

text: The City agrees to make reasonable efforts to provide transitional return to work assignments
label: BODY

text: for
label: BODY

text: all
label: BODY

text: employees
label: BODY

text: who
label: BODY

text: have
label: BODY

text: sustained
label: BODY

text: occupational
label: BODY

text: injury
label: BODY

text: illness
label: BODY

text: reoccurrence/exacerbation of a preexisting condition or, in some cases, are returning from
label: BODY

text: short-term disability leave. This Section 14.1 is not to be construed as requiring the assignment
label: BODY

text: of transitional return to work in any case, but only that reasonable efforts to do so will be made.
label: BODY

text: This will be done in accordance with the following:
label: BODY

text: During the time an employee is in a transitional return to work program, the
label: BODY

text: employee will be assigned duties which the employee is capable of performing
label: BODY

text: based upon the recommendation of the employee’s attending physician. Such
label: BODY

text: assignment shall not exceed ninety (90) days. Duties will be reviewed not less
label: BODY

text: than every thirty (30) days and may be discontinued at any time.
label: BODY

text: Upon request of the City employees must participate in the transitional return to
label: BODY

text: work program unless precluded from participation by their attending physician.
label: BODY

text: A transitional return to work assignment may be to a classification in a lower pay
label: BODY

text: range and the employee’s regular hourly rate of pay will not be reduced.
label: BODY

text: The terms of the transitional return to work arrangements shall be reduced to
label: BODY

text: writing including the instructions of the employee’s attending physician.
label: BODY

text: Section 14.2. Assignments to Work Out of Classification.
label: HH2

text: A temporary change of duty assignment is defined as any given situation wherein
label: BODY

text: an employee is required to perform work outside his/her regular job duties above
label: BODY

text: or below his/her normal duties.
label: BODY

text: Employees shall be selected for both regular and overtime temporary duty
label: BODY

text: assignments based upon their dependability and ability to perform the work of the
label: BODY

text: job to which they will be temporarily assigned. Where ability and dependability
label: BODY

text: are relatively equal, then seniority within the job classification shall control.
label: BODY

text: Employees who are temporarily assigned duties of a classification assigned a
label: BODY

text: lower wage rate shall retain their classification and current rate of pay. The
label: BODY

text: provision regarding compensation for temporary change of duty assignments is
label: BODY

text: found in Section 26.7.
label: BODY

text: Employees who receive a temporary assignment of this nature shall continue to
label: BODY

text: accrue seniority within their current classification.
label: BODY

text: A temporary assignment to fill a permanent vacancy shall not exceed one
label: BODY

text: hundred twenty (120) days.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 15 - LAYOFFS
label: BODY

text: Section 15.1. Responsibility.
label: HH2

text: The Civil Service Commission is responsible for the establishment and enforcement of the rules
label: BODY

text: governing layoffs, except as amended in this Article. Both the City and the Union agree to
label: BODY

text: strictly adhere to the rules in effect since April 1, 2002, as follows or as may be amended by the
label: BODY

text: provisions set forth in this Contract.
label: BODY

text: Section 15.2. Notice to the Commission.
label: HH2

text: Whenever it becomes necessary because of a material change in duties, a reorganization or a
label: BODY

text: shortage of work or funds, to reduce the number of full-time employees in any department of the
label: BODY

text: City, the Appointing Authority shall file a notice with the Civil Service Commission at least thirty
label: BODY

text: (30) days prior to the expected day of the layoff specifying the class(es) in which the layoff is to
label: BODY

text: occur and the number of employees to be laid off in each class.
label: BODY

text: Section 15.3. Certification of Layoff.
label: HH2

text: The Civil Service Commission shall certify to the Appointing Authority the names of those full-
label: BODY

text: time employees to be laid off as determined by Civil Service Commission Rules, and the
label: BODY

text: procedures approved by the Commission Executive Secretary except as amended by the
label: BODY

text: procedures set forth in this Article. Layoffs shall be by class and based on seniority, but in
label: BODY

text: accordance with status and appointment type using the following categories:
label: BODY

text: Temporary or Seasonal employees
label: BODY

text: Provisional full-time probationary employees
label: BODY

text: Provisional full-time non-probationary employees
label: BODY

text: Permanent full-time probationary employees
label: BODY

text: Permanent full-time non-probationary employees
label: BODY

text: Employees in the category at the top of the list are to be laid-off first. No employees from a
label: BODY

text: higher category can be laid-off until all employees in the lower categories have been laid-off.
label: BODY

text: The Appointing Authority shall notify any laid-off employee(s) at least thirty (30) days prior to the
label: BODY

text: effective date of the lay off.
label: BODY

text: Section 15.4. Bumping.
label: HH2

text: A laid-off employee may have bumping rights within the same class to another division within
label: BODY

text: the same department, to a lower class within the same class series or to a class in the same job
label: BODY

text: family in which he/she previously served and for which he/she is qualified. No laid-off employee
label: BODY

text: may bump another employee in accordance with the provisions of this section, unless he/she
label: BODY

text: has more seniority and is in the same or a higher category as listed in Section 15.3 above. A
label: BODY

text: bumped employee has the same bumping rights as a laid-off employee.
label: BODY

text: Non-bargaining unit employees shall have no bumping rights into an AFSCME bargaining unit
label: BODY

text: classification(s).
label: BODY

text: Same class.  A laid-off full-time employee in a division shall have bumping rights
label: BODY

text: within the same class against the least senior full-time employee in the
label: BODY

text: department in the order set forth in Section 15.3 above.
label: BODY

text: Class series.  If an employee has no opportunity to bump within the same class,
label: BODY

text: then such employee shall have bumping rights within his/her division (if none,
label: BODY

text: then within the department) against the least senior full-time employee holding a
label: BODY

text: position in the next lower class within the series. If no bumping opportunity is
label: BODY

text: afforded, the same right shall extend to the next and each lower class until the
label: BODY

text: class series is exhausted.
label: BODY

text: Job family.  If an employee has no bumping opportunity within the class series,
label: BODY

text: then such employee shall have bumping rights within his/her division (if none,
label: BODY

text: then within the department) against the least senior full-time employee holding a
label: BODY

text: position in a lower class in the same job family if the laid-off employee previously
label: BODY

text: served in the class and if he/she is presently qualified; however, no such bump
label: BODY

text: may occur in the presence of an appropriate competitive eligible list unless, in
label: BODY

text: accordance with Civil Service Commission Rules, the laid-off employee will have
label: BODY

text: permanent status in the previous class. A "lower class" for purposes of this
label: BODY

text: Subsection means any class which has a maximum rate of pay lower than the
label: BODY

text: minimum rate of pay for the class of the laid-off employee.
label: BODY

text: Part-time.  In the event the laid-off employee has no bumping rights to a full-time
label: BODY

text: position under (A), (B) or (C) above, then such employee shall have bumping
label: BODY

text: rights within the same class against the least senior part-time employee within
label: BODY

text: the division, or if none, within the department.
label: BODY

text: Section 15.5. Eligible List Reinstatement.
label: HH2

text: The names of any laid-off permanent employees shall be placed at the top of the appropriate
label: BODY

text: competitive eligible list, as provided in Civil Service Commission Rule VIII(C)(3), in order of
label: BODY

text: seniority, and shall be certified for appointment in any department in accordance with Civil
label: BODY

text: Service Commission Rules when an Appointing Authority has a vacancy to fill. If the eligible
label: BODY

text: employee at the top of the list was laid-off from that department, that person shall be appointed.
label: BODY

text: Section 15.6. Recall.
label: HH2

text: The names of any laid-off provisional employees or employees in noncompetitive classifications
label: BODY

text: shall be placed on the appropriate recall list, in order of seniority, for a period of twenty-four (24)
label: BODY

text: months. In the event that a vacancy in a department is to be filled in a class for which a recall
label: BODY

text: list exists, then the appointment shall be made of the individual highest on the list who was laid-
label: BODY

text: off from that department. Otherwise, appointment may be made as provided elsewhere by Civil
label: BODY

text: Service Commission Rules. No recall list shall remain in effect after an eligible list for the class
label: BODY

text: has been established.
label: BODY

text: Section 15.7. Limited Positions.
label: HH2

text: Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Article, if a limited position is to be eliminated and
label: BODY

text: the employee in the position was appointed subject to the availability of work or funding, then
label: BODY

text: that employee shall be terminated in accordance with Civil Service Commission Rule X(F)(1). A
label: BODY

text: limited employee who is bumped shall have the same bumping rights as other employees.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 16 - HOURS OF WORK AND OVERTIME
label: HH1

text: Section 16.1. Normal Workweek and Workday.
label: HH2

text: Non-24 Hour Operations.  The normal workweek for full-time employees shall be
label: BODY

text: forty (40) hours of work in five (5) consecutive eight (8) hour shifts, exclusive of
label: BODY

text: the time allotted for lunch periods.
label: BODY

text: 24-Hour Operations.  In twenty-four (24) hour operations or where there is a
label: BODY

text: continuous seven (7) day-a-week operation, made necessary because of the
label: BODY

text: nature of the work, the normal workweek for full-time employees shall be forty
label: BODY

text: (40) hours of work in five (5) consecutive days of eight (8) consecutive hours
label: BODY

text: each day.
label: BODY

text: Refuse Collection Division.  For the classifications of Refuse Collector, Refuse
label: BODY

text: Collection Vehicle Operator (Automated), Refuse Collector and Vehicle Operator
label: BODY

text: (Manual), Refuse Collector and Packer Operator and Refuse Collection
label: BODY

text: Supervisor only in the Division of Refuse Collection, the normal workweek for full-
label: BODY

text: time employees shall consist of five (5) consecutive days of eight (8) hours per
label: BODY

text: day with no lunch break.
label: BODY

text: Section 16.2. Changes in Normal Workweek and Workday.
label: HH2

text: Permanent Changes to Normal Workweek and Workday.
label: BODY

text: In situations where the City believes that alternate or flexible work
label: BODY

text: schedules, different from those set forth in Section 16.1 above, are
label: BODY

text: needed for operational efficiency and effectiveness, the City will give the
label: BODY

text: Union President and Chief Steward for the Department (where applicable)
label: BODY

text: written notice of the proposed work schedule and a list of those job
label: BODY

text: classification(s)/position assignment(s) affected at least fourteen (14)
label: BODY

text: days in advance of any proposed change(s). If the Union wants to bargain
label: BODY

text: about the proposed change(s), one representative from the City's Labor
label: BODY

text: Relations Section and two representatives from the Department involved
label: BODY

text: shall meet with the Union President, Regional Director or designee and
label: BODY

text: Chief Steward in the affected Department (where applicable), to negotiate
label: BODY

text: the proposed schedule changes as well as the impact of such change(s)
label: BODY

text: on matters such as holidays, sick leave, vacation leave, etc. In the
label: BODY

text: absence of an agreement being reached within the fourteen (14)-day
label: BODY

text: period, the City may, at the end of the fourteen (14)-day period,
label: BODY

text: implement its proposed work schedule.
label: BODY

text: The Union may file a grievance at Step 2 of the grievance procedure if it
label: BODY

text: believes the schedule change is not reasonably related to operational
label: BODY

text: needs. If an arbitrator finds in favor of the Union in such a grievance, the
label: BODY

text: remedy shall be limited to directing the City to prospectively restore the
label: BODY

text: pre-existing work schedule pending further negotiations and/or agreement
label: BODY

text: on a different schedule.
label: BODY

text: The process set forth in this Section 16.2(A) applies only to changes in
label: BODY

text: work schedules or shifts that are of a permanent nature. "Permanent
label: BODY

text: nature" is defined for purposes of this Section 16.2 to be periods of ninety
label: BODY

text: (90) days or longer. No changes shall be made to work schedules or
label: BODY

text: shifts unless they are of a permanent nature, except as provided
label: BODY

text: elsewhere in this Article 16.
label: BODY

text: Employees affected by any changes in work schedules or shifts as a
label: BODY

text: result of the process set forth in this Section 16.2(A) shall be given
label: BODY

text: fourteen (14) days prior notice of a permanent work schedule or shift
label: BODY

text: change. Reassignment of employees to new or revised work schedules or
label: BODY

text: shifts established as a result of the process set forth in this Section
label: BODY

text: 16.2(A) shall be done in accordance with Article 13 (Seniority).
label: BODY

text: Establishing an Alternate Work Schedule for a Vacancy. When a vacancy occurs,
label: BODY

text: the City may, before filling the vacancy, decide to establish an alternate work
label: BODY

text: schedule for the vacant position without following the procedures set forth in
label: BODY

text: Section 16.2(A). When this occurs, the City may hire a new employee or transfer
label: BODY

text: a current employee, pursuant to Article 13, on the condition they accept the
label: BODY

text: alternate work schedule as a condition of employment or as a condition of
label: BODY

text: accepting transfer into the vacancy.
label: BODY

text: Temporary Change In Shift Assignment.  When any full-time employee is
label: BODY

text: scheduled for a shift other than that to which he/she is regularly assigned in
label: BODY

text: multiple-shift operations, he/she shall be paid a minimum of four (4) hours of pay
label: BODY

text: at time and one-half his/her regular rate unless he/she has been given at least
label: BODY

text: forty-eight (48) hours notice of a change in his/her regular shift assignment, in
label: BODY

text: which case payment shall be at his/her regular hourly rate.
label: BODY

text: Temporary Change in Work Schedule.  Temporary work schedule changes of
label: BODY

text: less than ninety (90) days may be made in response to specific short-term
label: BODY

text: operational requirements.  Absent any unforeseen circumstances, the employee
label: BODY

text: will be given seven (7) days prior notice of a temporary work schedule change.
label: BODY

text: Such changes may be made without following the procedures set forth in Section
label: BODY

text: 16.2(A). The Union may file a grievance at Step 2 of the grievance procedure if it
label: BODY

text: believes the change is not reasonably related to operational needs.
label: BODY

text: Section 16.3. Overtime Eligibility and Pay.
label: HH2

text: Calculation of Daily Overtime.  Overtime will be calculated from shift to shift.
label: BODY

text: Overtime will be paid if an employee works more hours than the hours of his/her
label: BODY

text: regular shift. Time and one-half will be paid for time worked beyond the
label: BODY

text: employee's regular shift provided the employee has completed eight (or more, if
label: BODY

text: applicable) hours of straight-time work that workday (for example, an employee
label: BODY

text: working a normal workday of ten (10) hours, shall be eligible for daily overtime
label: BODY

text: after actually working ten (10) hours in the workday). For purposes of this
label: BODY

text: Subsection (A), the term "time worked" shall mean only actual work time, and
label: BODY

text: shall not include any paid or unpaid time that is not actually worked, except for
label: BODY

text: paid lunch periods in continuous operations as referenced in Section 16.7. Time
label: BODY

text: and one-half will also be paid for call-backs as referenced in Section 26.5,
label: BODY

text: regardless of whether the employee has actually worked eight (8) hours in the
label: BODY

text: day.
label: BODY

text: Calculation of Weekly Overtime - On First Regular Day Off. Time and one-half
label: BODY

text: will be paid for time worked on an employee's first regular day off provided the
label: BODY

text: employee has accumulated forty (40) straight-time rate hours in paid status
label: BODY

text: during the workweek. For purposes of this Subsection (B), paid status will include
label: BODY

text: periods of Union leave without pay, but shall not include sick leave, injury leave
label: BODY

text: or disability leave.
label: BODY

text: Calculation of Weekly Overtime - On Second Regular Day Off.  Double time will
label: BODY

text: be paid for time worked on an employee's second regular day off provided the
label: BODY

text: employee has accumulated forty (40) straight-time rate hours in paid status
label: BODY

text: during the preceding six (6) days. A fourth shift employee’s second regular day
label: BODY

text: off will start twenty-four (24) hours immediately preceding the start of the first
label: BODY

text: regular shift of the next workweek. Alternative work schedules can establish
label: BODY

text: when an employee’s second regular day off occurs and therefore when double
label: BODY

text: time pay will apply to overtime. For purposes of this Subsection (C), paid status
label: BODY

text: will include periods of Union leave without pay, but shall not include sick leave,
label: BODY

text: injury leave or disability leave.
label: BODY

text: Inapplicability of Overtime When Changing/Trading of Work Days by Mutual
label: BODY

text: Consent.  Time worked due to work schedules being changed at the request of
label: BODY

text: the employee or trading days off by mutual consent of employees and the prior
label: BODY

text: consent of the Appointing Authority is not subject to overtime compensation, to
label: BODY

text: the extent permitted by the Fair Labor Standards Act.
label: BODY

text: Inapplicability of Overtime for Scheduled Shift Changes. Time worked by
label: BODY

text: employees who are subject to a regularly scheduled three (3) month shift change
label: BODY

text: at the time a shift change is scheduled, or time worked by employees at the time
label: BODY

text: a shift change is scheduled in a twenty-four (24) hour-a-day operation and/or a
label: BODY

text: continuous seven (7) day-per-week operation, is not subject to the compensation
label: BODY

text: set forth in this Section 16.3, unless subject to the overtime payment
label: BODY

text: requirements established in the Fair Labor Standards Act.
label: BODY

text: Section 16.4. Distribution of Overtime.
label: HH2

text: Overtime Eligibility.  Employees within the same classification and with the same
label: BODY

text: work capabilities within the same reporting location who are participating in the
label: BODY

text: overtime provisions shall have an equal opportunity to earn voluntary overtime
label: BODY

text: pay. Classifications which include different work capabilities shall be identified to
label: BODY

text: the Union prior to the formation of a separate overtime list. It is the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority’s burden to prove that work capabilities needed are different.
label: BODY

text: Employees desiring to work voluntary overtime shall so indicate in writing to their
label: BODY

text: immediate supervisor. All employees who choose to participate in overtime will
label: BODY

text: be given an equal opportunity to earn overtime on a continuing basis. The
label: BODY

text: opportunity for overtime work shall be computed by totaling overtime earned plus
label: BODY

text: overtime offered but declined. If overtime is cancelled by management the hours
label: BODY

text: will not be charged. Post-training new hires, transferees, and those employees
label: BODY

text: returning to the reporting location from an extended leave who desire to work
label: BODY

text: voluntary overtime shall be initially assigned the highest number of overtime
label: BODY

text: hours in the assignment unit in order to place them on the overtime equalization
label: BODY

text: list. All overtime, whether in class or out of class, shall be recorded on the same
label: BODY

text: overtime equalization list.
label: BODY

text: Overtime Distribution Procedures.
label: BODY

text: On each occasion the opportunity to work scheduled overtime shall be
label: BODY

text: offered to the employees desiring to work overtime who have the least
label: BODY

text: number of overtime hours to their credit at that time. If an employee does
label: BODY

text: not accept the assignment, the employee with the next fewest number of
label: BODY

text: overtime hours to his/her credit shall be offered the assignment. This
label: BODY

text: procedure shall be followed until the required number of employees has
label: BODY

text: been selected for the overtime work.
label: BODY

text: If an employee turns down overtime or is unable to respond when
label: BODY

text: contacted for overtime, the number of hours offered to him/her shall be
label: BODY

text: credited to his/her overtime hours. Employees who have declined to
label: BODY

text: participate in the voluntary overtime shall be automatically charged for
label: BODY

text: overtime hours worked in the classification at the reporting location.
label: BODY

text: Employees on military leave not exceeding twenty-two (22) eight (8) hour
label: BODY

text: work days (176 hours) shall not be contacted or charged for overtime
label: BODY

text: work during that period.
label: BODY

text: An employee on leave shall not be contacted for voluntary overtime, but
label: BODY

text: shall be charged for overtime work during such leave as long as the
label: BODY

text: employee comes up for overtime work during that period. However, an
label: BODY

text: employee on holiday; jury duty; vacation leave or compensatory time of
label: BODY

text: three (3) workdays or less; or his/her regularly scheduled days off shall be
label: BODY

text: contacted for voluntary overtime subject to the provisions of this Section
label: BODY

text: If an employee is not offered the opportunity to work overtime when
label: BODY

text: qualified and entitled, he/she shall be offered the next opportunity to work
label: BODY

text: overtime consistent with the terms of this Article. Those hours not offered
label: BODY

text: when initially entitled shall not be included in hours credited when worked.
label: BODY

text: Posting of Overtime Equalization List.  A record of the overtime hours worked
label: BODY

text: and of overtime hours offered but not worked, by each employee, shall be posted
label: BODY

text: on a bulletin board within the employee's general work area daily. Each time
label: BODY

text: overtime is offered and charged the list will be updated.
label: BODY

text: Section 16.5. Overtime Scheduling.
label: HH2

text: Where practical, overtime shall be administered on a voluntary basis; otherwise,
label: BODY

text: it shall be mandatory that each employee scheduled to work overtime must
label: BODY

text: perform the job assignment within his/her given classification.
label: BODY

text: Mandatory Overtime.  Mandatory overtime may be required when volunteer(s)
label: BODY

text: cannot be found to work the overtime. An exception to the application of
label: BODY

text: mandatory overtime scheduling shall be permissible when a valid reasonable
label: BODY

text: request is made by an employee. Mandatory overtime shall be distributed in an
label: BODY

text: equitable manner starting with the least senior employee on the first mandatory
label: BODY

text: occasion. Thereafter, the next least senior employee shall be assigned to the
label: BODY

text: next mandatory occasion, until all employees have worked a mandatory overtime
label: BODY

text: assignment.
label: BODY

text: In cases of overtime scheduled as a result of holidays or extreme emergencies
label: BODY

text: involving a departmental operation, it shall be the established procedure for the
label: BODY

text: department or division head to confer with the employee's Union representative
label: BODY

text: when available regarding a mutually acceptable work schedule.
label: BODY

text: Working overtime out of class in a lower classification shall be scheduled by
label: BODY

text: using the lowest number of hours worked among persons with the ability and
label: BODY

text: dependability to do the work.
label: BODY

text: Pre-scheduled overtime shall be offered no later than the end of the employee’s
label: BODY

text: workday prior to the overtime.
label: BODY

text: Section 16.6. Rest Periods.
label: HH2

text: All employees' work schedules shall provide for a fifteen (15) minute rest period
label: BODY

text: during each half shift. The rest period shall be scheduled at the middle of each
label: BODY

text: half shift whenever feasible. When practicable, rest periods shall be taken within
label: BODY

text: the work area or in close proximity to the work area that shall afford no more than
label: BODY

text: the allotted fifteen (15) minutes. Rest periods shall not be taken at the beginning
label: BODY

text: or end of each half shift, and shall not be used to extend a lunch break.
label: BODY

text: Employees who for any reason work beyond their regular quitting time shall
label: BODY

text: receive a fifteen (15) minute rest period before they start to work on the extended
label: BODY

text: shift. In addition, they shall be granted the regular rest periods that occur during
label: BODY

text: the extended shift.
label: BODY

text: Section 16.7. Lunch Period.
label: HH2

text: All employees shall be granted a lunch period during each full shift. Whenever possible the
label: BODY

text: lunch period shall be scheduled at the middle of each full shift. Employees who work in a
label: BODY

text: twenty-four (24) hour operation shall receive a paid lunch period; all other employees shall
label: BODY

text: receive an unpaid lunch period. When there is an extension of the regular shift as a result of an
label: BODY

text: emergency or scheduled overtime, a lunch period shall be granted when the extension exceeds
label: BODY

text: four (4) hours.
label: BODY

text: Section 16.8. Tardiness.
label: HH2

text: Employees are required to be punctual at all times. A grace period of six (6) minutes from the
label: BODY

text: shift starting time will be allowed without disciplinary action unless frequent abuse occurs.
label: BODY

text: Section 16.9. Reporting Off Work Procedure.
label: HH2

text: The failure of any employee to report off duty in any twenty-four (24) hour City operation at least
label: BODY

text: one (1) hour before his/her scheduled starting time shall constitute away without leave for all
label: BODY

text: scheduled hours which were not worked. All other employees shall report themselves off duty at
label: BODY

text: least thirty-(30) minutes prior to their regularly scheduled starting time. Failure to so report shall
label: BODY

text: constitute away without leave for all scheduled hours not worked. The provisions of this Section
label: BODY

text: 16.9 shall not apply when it is impossible for the employee to so report due to circumstances
label: BODY

text: beyond his/her control, provided that the employee will then report at the earliest opportunity
label: BODY

text: followed by a written explanation of the circumstances which made it impossible for him/her to
label: BODY

text: report as directed.
label: BODY

text: Section 16.10. Compensatory Time.
label: HH2

text: The amount of compensatory time earned may be calculated at the straight time
label: BODY

text: rate, or in lieu of payment of overtime, by one and one-half (1-1/2) when time and
label: BODY

text: one-half is applicable or by two (2) when double time is applicable by the number
label: BODY

text: of hours actually worked on an authorized overtime basis. The compensatory
label: BODY

text: time account balances shall be maintained in units of one-tenth of an hour.
label: BODY

text: Eligibility.  A compensatory time account may be established for full-time
label: BODY

text: employees. Compensatory time may only be earned in lieu of cash payment for
label: BODY

text: authorized time worked on a premium basis. The employee may, at his/her
label: BODY

text: option, receive either cash payment or compensatory time for time worked on a
label: BODY

text: premium basis.
label: BODY

text: The following conditions shall govern the use of compensatory time:
label: BODY

text: Compensatory time upon request by the employee may be taken by the
label: BODY

text: employee at such time or times as may be approved by the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority.
label: BODY

text: An employee who is about to be separated from city service for any
label: BODY

text: reason and who has an unused compensatory time account balance to
label: BODY

text: his/her credit shall be paid such account balance upon separation. Such
label: BODY

text: payment shall be calculated by multiplying the employee's regular hourly
label: BODY

text: straight time wage rate by the number of hours in his/her compensatory
label: BODY

text: time account upon separation.
label: BODY

text: Any compensatory time account balance above eighty-(80) hours shall be
label: BODY

text: paid off at the employee's hourly rate. Pay out of compensatory time over
label: BODY

text: the approved balance will be paid once per year unless the Union and the
label: BODY

text: Appointing Authority agree to a different pay-out schedule. The cut-off
label: BODY

text: time established pursuant to this section shall be set no less than six (6)
label: BODY

text: months in advance of the pay period selected. Notice of the date of the
label: BODY

text: end of the selected pay period shall be posted within the Division and the
label: BODY

text: Chief Steward shall be notified of the date.
label: BODY

text: Notwithstanding the provisions of Subsection (C)(3) above, all
label: BODY

text: compensatory time account balances for grant-funded positions shall be
label: BODY

text: paid out by the end of the grant award period.
label: BODY

text: No interest is to be paid by the City on any compensatory time account.
label: BODY

text: Section 16.11.
label: HH2

text: No Pyramiding.
label: BODY

text: Compensation shall not be paid (nor compensatory time taken) more than once for the same
label: BODY

text: hours under any provision of this Article or Contract.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 17 - HOLIDAYS
label: HH1

text: Section 17.1. Holidays.
label: HH2

text: The holidays observed by the City and for which full-time employees are to be compensated
label: BODY

text: shall be as follows:
label: BODY

text: New Year's Day, January 1
label: BODY

text: Martin Luther King Day, the third Monday in January
label: BODY

text: Washington's Birthday, the third Monday in February
label: BODY

text: Memorial Day, the last Monday in May
label: BODY

text: Independence Day, July 4
label: BODY

text: Labor Day, the first Monday in September
label: BODY

text: Columbus Day, the second Monday in October
label: BODY

text: Thanksgiving Day, the fourth Thursday in November
label: BODY

text: Christmas Day, December 25
label: BODY

text: Any other holidays proclaimed by the Mayor
label: BODY

text: Employee's Birthday. If the employee's birthday falls on an above-named
label: BODY

text: holiday, the employee shall be granted and compensated for one
label: BODY

text: additional holiday. The Appointing Authority shall allow the employee to
label: BODY

text: take his/her birthday holiday on his/her birthday, or any other day within
label: BODY

text: one (1) year of the employee’s birthday, upon appropriate request by the
label: BODY

text: employee, at least forty-eight (48) hours in advance of the leave, with
label: BODY

text: approval of the Appointing Authority or designee. If an employee requests
label: BODY

text: his/her birthday holiday less than forty-eight (48) hours in advance of the
label: BODY

text: leave, the Appointing Authority or designee may approve the leave within
label: BODY

text: his/her discretion. If the employee's birthday falls on February 29, the
label: BODY

text: holiday, for the purpose of this Section 17.1, shall be considered as
label: BODY

text: February 28 unless otherwise authorized by the Appointing Authority.
label: BODY

text: Section 17.2. When Holidays Are Observed.
label: HH2

text: When a holiday falls on the first day of an employee's regularly scheduled days off, it shall be
label: BODY

text: celebrated on the previous day; when a holiday falls on the second day of an employee's
label: BODY

text: regularly scheduled days off, it shall be celebrated on the following day, except that at the time
label: BODY

text: of a shift change which necessitates more than a two (2) day weekend, a holiday which falls on
label: BODY

text: either of the first two (2) days shall be celebrated on the last previous workday, and a holiday
label: BODY

text: which falls on any other day of such weekend shall be celebrated on the next subsequent
label: BODY

text: workday.
label: BODY

text: Section 17.3. Holiday Pay and Holidays During Vacation Periods.
label: HH2

text: For each holiday observed (including the employee's birthday), a full-time employee will be
label: BODY

text: excused from work with pay on such day at the discretion of the Appointing Authority. If one (1)
label: BODY

text: of the holidays mentioned in Section 17.1 above occurs while an employee is on vacation leave,
label: BODY

text: such day shall not be charged against vacation leave. Non-full-time employees will only be
label: BODY

text: compensated for time actually worked on holidays.
label: BODY

text: Section 17.4. Extra Pay for Work on a Holiday.
label: HH2

text: When a full-time employee working a forty (40) hour workweek works on a day celebrated as an
label: BODY

text: eight (8) hour holiday, in addition to his/her regular eight (8) hour holiday pay, he/she shall be
label: BODY

text: paid at the rate of time and one-half for the first eight (8) hours worked. For time worked in
label: BODY

text: excess of eight (8) hours on such holiday, he/she shall be compensated at the rate of time and
label: BODY

text: one-half, unless the holiday worked falls on the second day of the employee's regularly
label: BODY

text: scheduled days off, in which case he/she shall be compensated at the double-time rate.
label: BODY

text: Section 17.5. Eligibility Requirements for Holiday Pay.
label: HH2

text: Except as set forth below, to be eligible for holiday pay, an employee must have worked, been
label: BODY

text: on vacation, military leave, compensatory time or sick leave on the full workday before and the
label: BODY

text: full workday after the holiday, in addition to the full holiday if the employee is scheduled to work
label: BODY

text: on the holiday as his/her regularly scheduled day or for overtime. The day before refers to the
label: BODY

text: employee's last regularly scheduled workday. The day after refers to the regularly scheduled
label: BODY

text: workday following the day on which the holiday is celebrated.  Employees returning from an
label: BODY

text: extended illness the day after a holiday shall receive holiday pay.
label: BODY

text: Section 17.6. Shifts Eligible for Holiday Pay.
label: HH2

text: For the purpose of administering the provisions of this Article, holiday time shall apply to the
label: BODY

text: shift beginning on the day which is celebrated as a holiday.
label: BODY

text: Section 17.7. Shift Worker Holidays in Continuous Operations.
label: HH2

text: Shift workers shall be guaranteed a minimum of five (5) holidays off during each calendar year.
label: BODY

text: During November of each year such employees shall bid on the holidays which they desire to
label: BODY

text: take off during the following calendar year. Such requests shall be granted in order of
label: BODY

text: classification seniority within an operational unit based upon the operational needs of that unit
label: BODY

text: and the City.  If an employee does not bid all five (5) holidays, then the guarantee only applies
label: BODY

text: to the number of holidays bid and awarded.
label: BODY

text: Section 17.8. Religious Holy Days.
label: HH2

text: An employee may charge religious holy days with the approval of the Appointing Authority to
label: BODY

text: either (1) vacation, (2) earned compensatory time, (3) personal leave without pay, or (4) a
label: BODY

text: regular day off which he/she is allowed to work.
label: BODY

text: Section 17.9. Holiday Pay for Alternative Work Schedules.
label: HH2

text: If an Appointing Authority maintains the alternative work schedule on a holiday
label: BODY

text: week, the employee will be paid holiday pay for the hours of his/her regular
label: BODY

text: scheduled shift. However, the Appointing Authority may adjust the work schedule
label: BODY

text: for the holiday week. If so, then the employee will only receive eight (8) hours of
label: BODY

text: holiday pay.
label: BODY

text: Current employees working under an alternative work schedule at the time this
label: BODY

text: Contract is signed will continue to be paid holiday pay for the employee’s regular
label: BODY

text: scheduled shift.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 18 - PERSONAL BUSINESS DAY
label: HH1

text: Each bargaining unit member shall receive one (1) eight (8) hour Personal Business Day per
label: BODY

text: vacation year as defined in Section 19.1 to conduct personal business that cannot be conducted
label: BODY

text: outside of the regular workday. Part-time regular employees shall receive four (4) hours of leave
label: BODY

text: annually. Days shall not accumulate. If notice is given at least forty-eight (48) hours in advance,
label: BODY

text: no reason needs to be stated, and no documentation will be required. If notice of less than forty-
label: BODY

text: eight (48) hours is given, the leave may be approved at the discretion of the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority or designee. The day shall have no cash-out value. The Personal Business Day
label: BODY

text: cannot be used the workday before or the workday after a holiday. The use of this Personal
label: BODY

text: Business Day is subject to the usual operational need requirement.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 19 - VACATION LEAVE
label: HH1

text: Section 19.1.
label: HH2

text: Vacation Year.
label: BODY

text: The vacation year shall end at the close of business on the last day of the first full pay period
label: BODY

text: that begins in the month of January.
label: BODY

text: Section 19.2.
label: HH2

text: Vacation Schedule and Accrual.
label: BODY

text: Each full-time employee working a forty-(40) hour workweek shall earn vacation
label: BODY

text: in accordance with the schedule below. The vacation accrual schedule shall be
label: BODY

text: as follows:
label: BODY

text: Years of Total
label: BODY

text: Hours Per
label: BODY

text: Days Per
label: BODY

text: City Service
label: BODY

text: Pay Period
label: BODY

text: Year
label: BODY

text: Less than 3 years
label: BODY

text: 3.077 hours
label: BODY

text: 10 days
label: BODY

text: 3 years but less than 6 years
label: BODY

text: 4.924 hours
label: BODY

text: 16 days
label: BODY

text: 6 years but less than 13 years
label: BODY

text: 7.077 hours
label: BODY

text: 23 days
label: BODY

text: 13 years but less than 20 years 8.000 hours
label: BODY

text: 26 days
label: BODY

text: 20 years but less than 25 years 8.616 hours
label: BODY

text: 28 days
label: BODY

text: 25 or more years
label: BODY

text: 9.231 hours
label: BODY

text: 30 days
label: BODY

text: Vacation accrual rates are based on total full-time City service for all employees,
label: BODY

text: including prior full-time service with the City of Columbus. In addition, for
label: BODY

text: employees hired prior to July 5, 1987, vacation accrual rates shall be based on
label: BODY

text: the total of all periods of full-time employment with the City, the State of Ohio and
label: BODY

text: any political subdivision of the State. However, any employee who has retired
label: BODY

text: from the State of Ohio or any of its political subdivisions, including the City of
label: BODY

text: Columbus, and is or was re-employed or hired by the City of Columbus before,
label: BODY

text: on or after July 5, 1987, shall not have prior full-time service with the State of
label: BODY

text: Ohio or any of its political subdivisions, including the City of Columbus,
label: BODY

text: recognized for purposes of determining the vacation accrual rate.
label: BODY

text: If applicable, requests for recognition of periods of full-time service with the State
label: BODY

text: of Ohio and its political subdivisions for accrual rate purposes shall be made in
label: BODY

text: writing and forwarded to the City Auditor through the Appointing Authority before
label: BODY

text: adjustments can be made to the vacation accrual rate. Adjustments to vacation
label: BODY

text: accrual rates, based on previous full-time employment with the State of Ohio or
label: BODY

text: political subdivisions of the State, as specified herein, shall be applied
label: BODY

text: prospectively to be effective the first full pay period following the verification by
label: BODY

text: the Appointing Authority to the City Auditor.
label: BODY

text: Any periods of time in unpaid status of more than eight (8) hours, as outlined in
label: BODY

text: Section 19.4, will not be included in the computation of City service for the
label: BODY

text: purpose of this Section 19.2.
label: BODY

text: This computation will be used only for the purpose of determining the rate at
label: BODY

text: which vacation is earned.
label: BODY

text: The provisions of this paragraph shall be prospective only and shall be in lieu of
label: BODY

text: any prospective or retrospective application of Section 9.44 of the Ohio Revised
label: BODY

text: Code.
label: BODY

text: Section 19.3. Maximum Vacation Carryover/Payout.
label: HH2

text: Any vacation balance in excess of the amounts listed below shall become void as of the close of
label: BODY

text: business on the last day of the first full pay period that begins in the month of January of each
label: BODY

text: year:
label: BODY

text: Years of Total
label: BODY

text: Maximum Vacation
label: BODY

text: City Service
label: BODY

text: Balances
label: BODY

text: Less than 3 years
label: BODY

text: 160 hours (20 days)
label: BODY

text: 3 years but less than 6 years
label: BODY

text: 256 hours (32 days)
label: BODY

text: 6 years but less than 13 years
label: BODY

text: 368 hours (46 days)
label: BODY

text: 13 years but less than 20 years
label: BODY

text: 416 hours (52 days)
label: BODY

text: 20 years but less than 25 years
label: BODY

text: 448 hours (56 days)
label: BODY

text: 25 or more years
label: BODY

text: 480 hours (60 days)
label: BODY

text: At the end of the last pay period in the vacation year, employees may be paid for any vacation
label: BODY

text: balances in excess of the maximums fixed by the above schedule upon certification by the
label: BODY

text: Appointing Authority to the City Auditor and the approval of the City Council, that due to
label: BODY

text: emergency work requirements, it is not in the best interests of the City to permit the employee to
label: BODY

text: take vacation leave which would otherwise be forfeited as provided in this Section 19.3.
label: BODY

text: Section 19.4. Eligibility Requirements for Vacation Accrual.
label: HH2

text: No vacation credit shall be allowed for any employee working a forty (40) hour workweek for any
label: BODY

text: pay period in which such employee is off duty and not in paid status for more than eight (8)
label: BODY

text: hours of regularly scheduled work; except that when an employee is required to report for work
label: BODY

text: and does so report but is denied work because of circumstances beyond his/her control, his/her
label: BODY

text: absence from work for the balance of that workday shall not be construed as unpaid work status
label: BODY

text: for the purpose of this Article.
label: BODY

text: Section 19.5. Scheduling Vacations.
label: HH2

text: All vacation leaves shall be taken at such times as may be approved by the
label: BODY

text: Appointing Authority. Vacation leave may be taken in increments as small as
label: BODY

text: one-tenth (1/10) of an hour with the approval of the Appointing Authority.
label: BODY

text: Previously approved vacations may be canceled due to unforeseeable and
label: BODY

text: exigent operational needs.
label: BODY

text: For new hires or rehires, no vacation leave may be granted until the employee
label: BODY

text: has accrued thirteen pay periods of vacation hours in continuous active City
label: BODY

text: service at the rate of vacation accrual appropriate for that employee.
label: BODY

text: The determination of preferences for the purpose of scheduling vacations shall
label: BODY

text: be based upon classification seniority within the operating unit.
label: BODY

text: Section 19.6. Vacation Payoff at Time of Separation.
label: HH2

text: A full-time employee with more than thirteen (13) pay periods of vacation accrual in paid status
label: BODY

text: who is about to be separated from City service through discharge, resignation, retirement or
label: BODY

text: layoff and who has unused vacation leave to his/her credit, shall be paid in a lump sum for each
label: BODY

text: hour of unused vacation leave (less any amounts owed to the City by the employee) in lieu of
label: BODY

text: granting such employee a vacation leave after his/her last day of active service with the City,
label: BODY

text: provided, however, that such payment shall not exceed the maximum number of vacation hours
label: BODY

text: outlined in Section 19.3.
label: BODY

text: Section 19.7. Vacation Payoff at Death.
label: HH2

text: Notwithstanding the provisions of this Article, when an employee dies while in paid status, any
label: BODY

text: unused vacation leave to his/her credit shall be paid to the surviving spouse, less applicable
label: BODY

text: withholding and any amounts owed by the employee to the City. In the event that the employee
label: BODY

text: has no surviving spouse, said unused vacation leave shall be paid to the employee's estate.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 20 - SICK LEAVE
label: HH1

text: Section 20.1. Sick Leave Entitlement.
label: HH2
