text: Each full-time non-seasonal employee employed at the beginning of the first day of the first pay
label: BODY

text: period of the year shall receive ninety-six (96) hours of sick leave with pay (hereinafter referred
label: BODY

text: to as Sick Leave Entitlement).
label: BODY

text: Each full-time, non-seasonal employee hired on or after the first pay period of each year shall,
label: BODY

text: on the date of hire receive his/her current sick leave with pay for the remainder of that payroll
label: BODY

text: year computed as follows:  3.692 hours for each pay period in the year of hire, commencing with
label: BODY

text: the first full pay period which occurs on or after the date of hire.  However, for each pay period
label: BODY

text: in which an employee is in unpaid status for more than eight (8) hours, 3.692 hours shall be
label: BODY

text: deducted from his/her paid sick leave entitlement.
label: BODY

text: When an employee is required to report to work and does so report but is denied work because
label: BODY

text: of circumstances beyond his/her control, absence from work under these circumstances shall
label: BODY

text: not be considered as unpaid work status for purposes of this Section.
label: BODY

text: If an employee’s sick leave entitlement is exhausted and the employee is in unpaid status, and
label: BODY

text: therefore no deduction from sick leave entitlement can be made, the employee shall be
label: BODY

text: considered absent without leave unless the employee applies for unpaid personal leave and
label: BODY

text: such leave is granted by the City.
label: BODY

text: Should an employee voluntarily move from full-time non-seasonal status to part-time or
label: BODY

text: seasonal status during a calendar year in which he/she is eligible for sick leave, the employee
label: BODY

text: shall retain his/her sick leave balance for the number of pay periods months he/she was in full-
label: BODY

text: time status, but 3.692 hours shall be deducted from his/her paid sick leave account for each full
label: BODY

text: pay period in which the employee is in part-time or seasonal status.  No such deduction will
label: BODY

text: apply to employees who are laid off and are compelled to bump into a part-time or seasonal
label: BODY

text: position to retain continued employment.
label: BODY

text: Section 20.2. Eligible Uses and Procedures.
label: HH2

text: Sick leave with pay shall be allowed for full-time employees only in the following
label: BODY

text: situations:
label: BODY

text: Illness of, or injury to, the employee, whether work or non-work related.
label: BODY

text: Physical, dental or mental consultation or treatment of the employee by
label: BODY

text: professional medical or dental personnel, whether work or non-work
label: BODY

text: related.
label: BODY

text: Sickness of a spouse, child, step-child, foster child, person for whom the
label: BODY

text: employee is the legal guardian and upon prior approval of the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority, a family member who is dependent on the employee for his/her
label: BODY

text: health and well-being.
label: BODY

text: Quarantine because of contagious disease. The Appointing Authority
label: BODY

text: shall require a certificate of the attending physician before allowing any
label: BODY

text: paid sick leave under this Subsection.
label: BODY

text: Maternity, paternity, and adoption leave for employees.
label: BODY

text: Death of immediate family member for up to five (5) days per instance.
label: BODY

text: For the purposes of this Subsection, immediate family shall be defined as
label: BODY

text: including the employee's spouse, child, step-child, foster child, brother,
label: BODY

text: sister, parent, grandparent, grandchild, father or mother-in-law, son or
label: BODY

text: daughter-in-law, brother or sister-in-law, stepfather or mother, step-
label: BODY

text: sibling, a legal guardian or other person who stands in the place of a
label: BODY

text: parent. Employees may also elect to use compensatory time or vacation
label: BODY

text: leave instead of sick leave because of a death in the immediate family, or
label: BODY

text: may use a day of compensatory time or vacation leave to attend the
label: BODY

text: funeral of an Aunt or Uncle.
label: BODY

text: Any leave which is granted under this Article 20 for reasons permissible under an
label: BODY

text: FMLA leave as provided in Section 24.7 shall be charged as an FMLA leave and
label: BODY

text: shall be subject to the twelve (12) week per year limitation for the length of an
label: BODY

text: FMLA leave.
label: BODY

text: Any employee scheduled to work on a holiday, designated in Article 17 of this
label: BODY

text: Contract, who reports sick shall be charged the number of sick leave hours
label: BODY

text: appropriate for his/her workday for the holiday, and further shall be ineligible for
label: BODY

text: holiday pay under the provisions of Section 17.5 of this Contract. When an
label: BODY

text: employee is absent due to illness on the workday before or the workday after a
label: BODY

text: holiday, and the holiday is celebrated on a regularly scheduled workday, he/she
label: BODY

text: shall be charged the number of sick leave hours appropriate for his/her workday
label: BODY

text: for the holiday. The day before refers to the employee's last regularly scheduled
label: BODY

text: workday occurring before the holiday. The day after refers to the regularly
label: BODY

text: scheduled workday following the day on which the holiday is celebrated.
label: BODY

text: However, no charge will be made under this Section 20.2 for sick leave on the
label: BODY

text: holiday when the employee has been on sick leave the day before and the day
label: BODY

text: after the holiday.
label: BODY

text: Sick leave, when used, shall be paid at an hourly rate equal to the employee's
label: BODY

text: regular straight time wage in effect at the time of the usage. No sick leave with
label: BODY

text: pay will be allowed for increments of less than one tenth (1/10) of an hour.
label: BODY

text: Section 20.3 Sick Leave Documentation and Suspected Sick Leave Abuse.
label: HH2

text: If an employee has sufficient sick leave accruals, and there is no evidence of sick leave abuse,
label: BODY

text: the Appointing Authority shall grant sick leave upon the written request of the employee. In
label: BODY

text: cases of extended illness, that is, illness which lasts more than three (3) consecutive workdays,
label: BODY

text: or suspected abuse, as determined by the Appointing Authority or designee, the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority or designee may require evidence as to the adequacy of the reason(s) for an
label: BODY

text: employee's absence during the time for which sick leave is requested. Any sick leave use
label: BODY

text: protected by the Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) shall not be considered as sick leave
label: BODY

text: abuse.
label: BODY

text: Sick leave abuse may be indicated by any or all of the following:
label: BODY

text: Excessive use of sick leave within a twelve (12) month period which has
label: BODY

text: not been substantiated by a physician’s or other licensed health care
label: BODY

text: provider’s statement;
label: BODY

text: Use of sick leave as soon as it has been credited to an employee’s sick
label: BODY

text: leave balance;
label: BODY

text: Consistent use of sick leave on the same day of the week;
label: BODY

text: Consistent use of sick leave on the day(s) before and/or after regularly
label: BODY

text: scheduled days off or holidays.
label: BODY

text: Falsification or misrepresentation of the reason(s) for an employee’s
label: BODY

text: absence;
label: BODY

text: Low sick leave balances in relation to an employee’s length of service;
label: BODY

text: and
label: BODY

text: Being in unpaid status for whole or part of a day, which absence is not
label: BODY

text: covered by the FMLA.
label: BODY

text: If there are one or more indicators of sick leave abuse, the Appointing Authority
label: BODY

text: or designee shall notify the employee, in writing, that he/she will be required to
label: BODY

text: provide documentation from a physician or other licensed health care provider for
label: BODY

text: each use of sick leave until further notice, and the reasons for that requirement.
label: BODY

text: The Appointing Authority or designee shall review the situation not longer than
label: BODY

text: every one hundred twenty (120) days to determine if the problem has been
label: BODY

text: abated. Upon receipt of the written notice, the employee may request a meeting
label: BODY

text: with the Appointing Authority or designee to discuss the requirement to provide
label: BODY

text: such documentation. The employee may, upon request, be accompanied by a
label: BODY

text: Union representative at such meeting.
label: BODY

text: Failure to correct sick leave abuse or provide medical documentation when
label: BODY

text: required to do so may result in disciplinary action consistent with the provisions
label: BODY

text: of Article 10 of this Contract.
label: BODY

text: Falsification of a physician's or other licensed health care provider’s statement
label: BODY

text: may also be grounds for disciplinary action, up to and including dismissal.
label: BODY

text: If the Appointing Authority or designee questions the reason(s) offered by the
label: BODY

text: employee for his/her sick leave, the Appointing Authority or designee may require
label: BODY

text: the employee to be examined by a licensed physician identified by the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority or designee. Failure to submit to the examination shall constitute
label: BODY

text: grounds for disciplinary action.
label: BODY

text: Each Appointing Authority or designee shall develop a procedure for his/her
label: BODY

text: department to implement the provisions of this section.
label: BODY

text: Section 20.4. Sick Leave Reciprocity.
label: HH2

text: Entitlement.  During January of each year, each full-time employee has the
label: BODY

text: option of receiving payment in cash for unused sick leave hours at the end of the
label: BODY

text: preceding fiscal year, provided such employee was entitled to sick leave benefits
label: BODY

text: during all of the twenty-six pay periods of the previous year and is in paid status
label: BODY

text: or on authorized leave without pay, based on the following calculation table:
label: BODY

text: CASH BENEFIT CALCULATION TABLE
label: H3

text: Hours of Sick
label: BODY

text: Leave Taken
label: BODY

text: (New Sick Accrual
label: BODY

text: Cash Benefit
label: BODY

text: or Old Bank)
label: BODY

text: Hours Allowed
label: BODY

text: Greater than 41
label: BODY

text: Any disallowance of sick leave credit by the Appointing Authority as provided for
label: BODY

text: in Section 20.1, and any hours paid on disability leave will be considered as
label: BODY

text: hours of sick leave taken during the year for the purpose of computing paid sick
label: BODY

text: leave hours available to an employee under the reciprocity plan. If an employee
label: BODY

text: uses five (5) days or less of injury leave (regardless of the number of claims)
label: BODY

text: during the year, this leave shall not be considered sick leave taken for computing
label: BODY

text: sick leave reciprocity. If an employee uses more than five (5) days of injury leave,
label: BODY

text: all injury leave used during the year will be considered hours of sick leave taken
label: BODY

text: in computing sick leave reciprocity.
label: BODY

text: Procedures.  Each full-time employee who qualifies for sick leave benefits as of
label: BODY

text: the first pay period of each year shall notify the Appointing Authority by February
label: BODY

text: 1 of that fiscal year, on a form to be provided by the City, if the employee wishes
label: BODY

text: to participate in the reciprocity plan. The payment will be made in January
label: BODY

text: following the fiscal year. The payment will be calculated at the employee's hourly
label: BODY

text: rate in effect as of the final pay period of the fiscal year preceding payment. The
label: BODY

text: period to be utilized in calculating sick leave reciprocity benefits shall be the fiscal
label: BODY

text: year for which payment is to be made. Any employee may withdraw from the
label: BODY

text: plan prior to the end of the twenty-fourth (24th) pay period of each fiscal year
label: BODY

text: upon the written notification to the Appointing Authority.
label: BODY

text: Effect on Unused Sick Leave.  The number of reciprocity hours paid each
label: BODY

text: employee will be subtracted from his/her total accrued unused sick leave. The
label: BODY

text: remainder of his/her unused sick leave will be carried forward each year as
label: BODY

text: his/her current sick leave account.
label: BODY

text: An employee who is eligible to participate in the provisions of this Section 20.4 is
label: BODY

text: limited to and must elect only one of the following options:
label: BODY

text: Not to participate in any of the provisions.
label: BODY

text: To participate solely in the provisions of Paragraphs (A), (B), and (C) of
label: BODY

text: this Section.
label: BODY

text: Section 20.5. Carryover Sick Leave Balances from Certain Prior Public Employment.
label: HH2

text: Employees who have been employed in the classified or unclassified Civil Service or as
label: BODY

text: teachers, school employees, firefighters, peace officers or state highway patrol officers of the
label: BODY

text: State of Ohio or any of its political subdivisions shall be credited with any certified, unused and
label: BODY

text: unpaid balance of accumulated sick leave earned in such service when such persons are
label: BODY

text: employed in the classified or unclassified Civil Service of the City on or after April 1, 1987,
label: BODY

text: provided employment with the City occurs within ten (10) years after leaving his/her prior
label: BODY

text: position when such action occurs after January 1, 1972. Such unused balance shall then be
label: BODY

text: subject to all other provisions of this Article, with the exception of Section 20.7.
label: BODY

text: Section 20.6. Old Sick Leave Bank.
label: HH2

text: The old sick leave bank shall represent the employee's balance of unused sick leave as of the
label: BODY

text: effective date of the Contract that went into effect in April 1987.
label: BODY

text: Any sick leave hours in this bank, when used, shall be paid on the basis of the
label: BODY

text: employee's straight-time hourly rate in effect on March 31, 1987.
label: BODY

text: Sick leave may be withdrawn from the old sick leave bank, at the value provided
label: BODY

text: in this Section 20.6 for the sick leave purposes outlined in Section 20.2(A),
label: BODY

text: provided the employee has exhausted his/her current sick leave accrual to date.
label: BODY

text: An employee may withdraw from the old sick leave bank the number of hours or
label: BODY

text: tenths of an hour necessary to compensate the employee at not greater than
label: BODY

text: his/her current regular straight time hourly rate for approved sick leave time.
label: BODY

text: An employee who experiences a break in continuous City service through
label: BODY

text: retirement, discharge, resignation or layoff shall receive pay for unused sick
label: BODY

text: leave or, in lieu thereof, may elect to transfer such sick leave to another
label: BODY

text: governmental unit. Beginning with the effective date of this Contract and for the
label: BODY

text: duration of the Contract, if the employee elects payment, his/her account balance
label: BODY

text: shall be valued as of the time of the break in continuous service at one hundred
label: BODY

text: percent (100%) of the amount obtained by multiplying the number of unused sick
label: BODY

text: leave hours by the employee's straight-time hourly rate in effect on March 31,
label: BODY

text: 1987. At such time, the employee who is not transferring such sick leave to
label: BODY

text: another governmental unit must elect one (1) of the following options: (a)
label: BODY

text: immediate payment in a single lump-sum; or (b) two (2) equal installment
label: BODY

text: payments, the first to be paid at the time of retirement or separation and the
label: BODY

text: second to be paid one (1) year thereafter; or (c) three (3) equal installment
label: BODY

text: payments, the first to be paid at the time of retirement or separation, the second
label: BODY

text: to be paid one (1) year thereafter, and the third to be paid one (1) year after the
label: BODY

text: second payment. However, the City must approve those employee elections
label: BODY

text: which provide for payment in other than a single lump-sum.
label: BODY

text: For the purposes of this Section 20.6, all sick leave in an employee's old sick
label: BODY

text: leave bank that represents sick leave transferred from another governmental unit
label: BODY

text: shall be valued using the unit's sick leave separation payment plan existing on
label: BODY

text: March 31, 1987 and the employee's regular straight-time hourly wage as of
label: BODY

text: Section 20.7. Payment of Sick Leave Balances at Time of Separation.
label: HH2

text: An employee who experiences a break in continuous City service through
label: BODY

text: discharge, resignation, retirement or layoff may elect to receive pay for
label: BODY

text: accumulated current sick leave or to transfer said sick leave to another
label: BODY

text: governmental unit, provided such election is made within a period of not more
label: BODY

text: than one (1) year. If an employee elects to receive a lump-sum payment, said
label: BODY

text: payment shall be computed as follows:
label: BODY

text: One (1) hour pay for each four (4) hours of unused sick leave in the new
label: BODY

text: bank for all accruals up to and including nine hundred and fifty (950)
label: BODY

text: hours.
label: BODY

text: One (1) hour of pay for each three (3) hours of unused sick leave in the
label: BODY

text: new bank for all accruals from nine hundred and fifty-one (951) hours up
label: BODY

text: to and including seventeen hundred and fifty (1,750) hours.
label: BODY

text: One (1) hour pay for each two (2) hours of unused sick leave in the new
label: BODY

text: bank for all accruals from seventeen hundred and fifty-one (1,751) hours
label: BODY

text: up to and including twenty five hundred and fifty (2,550) hours.
label: BODY

text: One (1) hour pay for each hour of unused sick leave in the new bank for
label: BODY

text: all accruals in excess of twenty five hundred and fifty (2,550) hours.
label: BODY

text: Notwithstanding the provisions of Paragraph (1) above, no payment of
label: BODY

text: any unused sick leave upon separation shall be made to any employee
label: BODY

text: with less than four hundred (400) hours accrued sick leave credit.
label: BODY

text: However, an employee who is temporarily laid-off for thirty-five (35)
label: BODY

text: calendar days or less and who has less than four hundred (400) hours of
label: BODY

text: accrued sick leave at the time of layoff, shall be credited at the time of
label: BODY

text: rehire with the actual number of sick leave hours accrued prior to the
label: BODY

text: temporary layoff of thirty-five (35) calendar days or less.
label: BODY

text: The City reserves the right to deduct from any final sick leave payment to the
label: BODY

text: employee any amounts which the employee owes to the City.
label: BODY

text: Section 20.8. Payment of Sick Leave Balances at Death.
label: HH2

text: If an employee dies while in paid status, his/her unused sick leave account balance (less
label: BODY

text: applicable withholding and any amounts owed by the employee to the City) shall be paid to
label: BODY

text: his/her surviving spouse. In the event that the employee has no surviving spouse, said balance
label: BODY

text: shall be paid to the employee's estate. The employee's account balance shall be valued as of
label: BODY

text: the time of death in the manner as set forth in this Article for new and old sick leave, as
label: BODY

text: applicable, less any amounts owed by the employee to the City.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 21 - DISABILITY LEAVE
label: HH1

text: Section 21.1. Eligibility and Waiting Period.
label: HH2

text: The City will provide, at no cost to employees, a disability program covering full-
label: BODY

text: time employees for non-work related illnesses and injuries. Employees will be
label: BODY

text: eligible for this benefit on the first of the month following one (1) year of
label: BODY

text: continuous City service.
label: BODY

text: This program shall provide for payment to the employee from the fifteenth (15th)
label: BODY

text: day of accident or illness for a maximum of twenty-six (26) weeks per disability
label: BODY

text: per calendar year.
label: BODY

text: Section 21.2. Application Procedure and Deadlines.
label: HH2

text: The proper forms must be submitted to the City, through the Division Personnel Officer or
label: BODY

text: designee, no later than forty-five (45) days from the commencement of the disability. In the
label: BODY

text: event Injury Leave and/or Workers’ Compensation benefits were denied and the employee
label: BODY

text: chooses to apply for short-term disability benefits for the same disabling condition, the
label: BODY

text: employee must submit the proper forms for short-term disability benefits within thirty (30) days
label: BODY

text: of the occupational injury denial.
label: BODY

text: Section 21.3. Disability Benefits.
label: HH2

text: Disability benefits shall be based on eighty one percent (81%) of the employee's standard gross
label: BODY

text: wages.  The applicable tax rates will be deducted. The employee may, if he/she so desires,
label: BODY

text: elect to use all, or part of, his/her accumulated but unused sick leave in order to make up any
label: BODY

text: difference between one hundred percent (100%) of his/her gross wages and the amount which
label: BODY

text: he/she receives under the disability program, provided that all new sick leave accruals are
label: BODY

text: exhausted before an employee may use the available balance in his/her old sick leave bank. If
label: BODY

text: an employee exhausts all sick leave benefits, other approved leave may be granted by the
label: BODY

text: Appointing Authority. If, while receiving disability payments, the employee performs work for the
label: BODY

text: City, the amount of payment under the disability program shall be reduced by the compensation
label: BODY

text: which he/she receives during that time period. If the employee is capable of performing his/her
label: BODY

text: regular duties or transitional duties, such duties are available and the employee refuses to
label: BODY

text: return to work, disability benefits shall not be paid.  Any insurance premium not paid during
label: BODY

text: disability leave must be brought current upon return from leave.
label: BODY

text: Section 21.4. Limitations and Fraudulent Claims.
label: HH2

text: No disability payments shall be made to any employee who is working for another employer or
label: BODY

text: also receiving temporary total benefits. Fraudulent actions automatically preclude employees
label: BODY

text: from receiving any disability benefits. If a payment is made pursuant to a fraudulent claim, the
label: BODY

text: employee shall repay the City immediately.
label: BODY

text: Section 21.5. Continued Contact With Division and Return to Work Notification.
label: HH2

text: An employee on disability leave shall maintain biweekly contact with the division personnel
label: BODY

text: officer or designee during the period of time they are disabled. This requirement may be
label: BODY

text: modified in writing by the personnel officer for extended leaves. An employee shall notify the
label: BODY

text: personnel officer or designee at least seven (7) days before his/her expected return to work
label: BODY

text: date to reconfirm that date.
label: BODY

text: Section 21.6. Ninety (90)-Day Fitness Hearing.
label: HH2

text: After ninety (90) days, the City may conduct a hearing to determine the employee's ability to
label: BODY

text: perform the essential functions of his/her classification.
label: BODY

text: Section 21.7. Coordination with FMLA Leave.
label: HH2

text: Any disability leave which is granted for reasons permissible under an FMLA leave shall be
label: BODY

text: subject to the twelve (12) week per year limitation for the length of an FMLA leave.
label: BODY

text: Section 21.8. Continuation of Certain Benefits While on Disability.
label: HH2

text: While an employee is paid disability benefits pursuant to this Article, vacation accruals shall
label: BODY

text: cease. During the period in which an employee receives disability payments, he/she shall suffer
label: BODY

text: no reduction in his/her paid sick leave accrual set forth in Article 20 of this Contract, as
label: BODY

text: applicable. Holidays shall be paid at the disability benefit rate as set forth in Section 21.3.
label: BODY

text: Medical, dental, drug, vision, and life insurance shall continue uninterrupted until the employee
label: BODY

text: is no longer on the disability program.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 22 - INJURY LEAVE
label: HH1

text: Section 22.1. General Scope of Benefits and Eligibility for Injury Leave.
label: HH2

text: The injury leave program is a benefit intended to cover employees injured on the job, which is
label: BODY

text: separate and distinct from any Workers’ Compensation benefits. Injury leave will be approved
label: BODY

text: according to the provisions of this Contract, and the rules and policies of the Human Resources
label: BODY

text: Director or designee and the Board of Industrial Relations. Workers’ Compensation laws, rules,
label: BODY

text: and court decisions do not apply to the injury leave program. All full-time and part-time
label: BODY

text: employees shall be allowed injury leave with pay up to a maximum of sixty (60) workdays per
label: BODY

text: calendar year for on-the-job injuries, not to exceed a total of one hundred twenty (120)
label: BODY

text: workdays per injury, for on-the-job injuries that meet the requirements set forth in this Article.
label: BODY

text: The one hundred twenty (120) day total shall apply to injury leave taken on or after April 1,
label: BODY

text: 1990, and any injuries (and any recurrences of the same injuries) occurring prior to January 1,
label: BODY

text: For all injuries that occur on or after January 1, 2009, all full-time and part-time employees shall
label: BODY

text: be allowed injury leave with pay up to a maximum of fifty (50) workdays per calendar year for
label: BODY

text: on-the-job injuries, not to exceed a total of one hundred (100) workdays per injury, for on-the-job
label: BODY

text: injuries that meet the requirements set forth in this Article. The one hundred (100) day total shall
label: BODY

text: apply to injuries (and any recurrences of the same injuries) occurring on or after January 1,
label: BODY

text: For all injuries that occur on or after January 1, 2010, all full-time and part-time employees shall
label: BODY

text: be allowed injury leave with pay up to a maximum of forty (40) workdays per calendar year for
label: BODY

text: on-the-job injuries, not to exceed a total of eighty (80) workdays per injury, for on-the-job injuries
label: BODY

text: that meet the requirements set forth in this Article.   The eighty (80) day total shall apply to
label: BODY

text: injuries (and any recurrences of the same injuries) occurring on or after January 1, 2010.
label: BODY

text: Section 22.2. Deadline for Reporting Injury.
label: HH2

text: Injuries, both original and recurrent, must be reported to the employee's immediate supervisor
label: BODY

text: no more than two (2) working days after such injury occurs.
label: BODY

text: Section 22.3. Payment for Absence on Day of Injury.
label: HH2

text: Whenever an employee is required to stop working because of an injury or other service
label: BODY

text: connected disability, he/she shall be paid for the remaining hours of that day or shift at his/her
label: BODY

text: regular rate, and such time shall not be charged to leave of any kind.
label: BODY

text: Section 22.4. Deadline for Submitting Medical Documentation for Original and Recurrent
label: HH2

text: Injuries.
label: HH1

text: All medical documentation, supporting documentation, and a report of the cause of all injuries,
label: BODY

text: whether original or recurrent, must be submitted by the employee to the employee's immediate
label: BODY

text: supervisor within fourteen (14) days from the date the injury occurs. Signatures of the
label: BODY

text: employee’s immediate supervisor, the Division Administrator, and the Appointing Authority are
label: BODY

text: required thereafter. Claims are to be submitted to the Human Resources Department within a
label: BODY

text: total of twenty-eight (28) days from the date the injury occurs (provided, however, that an
label: BODY

text: employee's eligibility for injury leave shall not be prejudiced by a delay in filing caused by
label: BODY

text: supervisors if the employee has complied with his/her fourteen (14)-day filing deadline). If the
label: BODY

text: employee is physically unable to comply with the fourteen (14) day filing deadline or the medical
label: BODY

text: documentation submitted by the employee is inadequate, the employee will be given an
label: BODY

text: additional fourteen (14) days to submit adequate documentation.
label: BODY

text: Section 22.5. Determination by Director of Human Resources and Related Limitations
label: HH2

text: and Procedures.
label: HH1

text: Director of Human Resources Approval Required.  Injury leave with pay shall be
label: BODY

text: granted to an employee only for injuries determined by the Director of the Human
label: BODY

text: Resources Department or designee as caused by the performance of the actual
label: BODY

text: duties of the position. No employee shall be granted injury leave with pay unless
label: BODY

text: the Appointing Authority has in his/her possession written authorization signed by
label: BODY

text: the Director of the Human Resources Department or designee indicating the
label: BODY

text: approximate length of the leave. If, in the judgment of the Director of the Human
label: BODY

text: Resources Department or designee, the injury is such that the employee is
label: BODY

text: capable of performing his/her regular duties or transitional duties during the
label: BODY

text: period of convalescence, he/she shall so notify the Appointing Authority in writing
label: BODY

text: and deny injury leave with pay.
label: BODY

text: Medical Examination/Documentation.  The City may require an independent
label: BODY

text: medical examination for any employee requesting injury leave, at the City's
label: BODY

text: expense. No employee on injury leave shall be returned to work without the
label: BODY

text: written approval of an attending physician. The employee is required to provide
label: BODY

text: continuing medical documentation prior to the estimated return to work date, to
label: BODY

text: ensure uninterrupted injury leave coverage.  All such documentation must be
label: BODY

text: submitted to the appropriate Department or Division Human Resources
label: BODY

text: representative.
label: BODY

text: Duty to Reapply for Recurrence or Relapse.  If there is a recurrent injury during
label: BODY

text: working hours or a relapse during recovery or ongoing treatment, the employee
label: BODY

text: must request approval for each instance of injury leave.
label: BODY

text: Continued Contact with Division and Return to Work Notification.  An employee
label: BODY

text: on injury leave shall maintain biweekly contact with the division personnel officer
label: BODY

text: or designee during the period of time he/she is injured. This requirement may be
label: BODY

text: modified in writing by the personnel officer for extended leaves. An employee
label: BODY

text: shall notify the personnel officer or designee at least seven (7) days before
label: BODY

text: his/her expected return to work date to reconfirm that date.
label: BODY

text: Forty (40) Day Fitness Hearing.  After forty (40) workdays, the City may conduct
label: BODY

text: a hearing to determine the employee's ability to perform the essential functions of
label: BODY

text: his/her classification.
label: BODY

text: Fraudulent Claims.  Fraudulent actions automatically preclude employees from
label: BODY

text: receiving injury leave benefits and, if any benefits are paid pursuant to a
label: BODY

text: fraudulent claim, they shall be repaid immediately and/or may be withheld from
label: BODY

text: an employee's final pay upon termination.
label: BODY

text: No Outside Employment.  No injury leave payments shall be made to any
label: BODY

text: employee who is working for another employer nor also receiving temporary total
label: BODY

text: benefits.
label: BODY

text: Limitation on Recreational Activities.  In addition, no injury leave payment shall
label: BODY

text: be made to any employee engaged in recreational activities when the physical
label: BODY

text: demands of engaging in the recreation conflict with the approved injury/medical
label: BODY

text: condition.
label: BODY

text: Coordination With FMLA Leave.  Any injury leave which is granted for reasons
label: BODY

text: permissible under an FMLA leave shall be subject to the twelve (12) week per
label: BODY

text: year limitation for the length of an FMLA leave.
label: BODY

text: Vocational Rehabilitation.  If the Physician of Record indicates an employee is
label: BODY

text: medically eligible to participate in vocational rehabilitation, the employee shall
label: BODY

text: agree to participate in the Bureau of Workers’ Compensation voluntary vocational
label: BODY

text: rehabilitation program. In the event the employee chooses not to participate, the
label: BODY

text: Appointing Authority will be notified in writing and injury leave with pay will be
label: BODY

text: denied.
label: BODY

text: Section 22.6. Board of Industrial Relations Proceedings.
label: HH2

text: Any injured employee may appeal the decision of the Director of the Human Resources
label: BODY

text: Department or designee by written notice to the Board of Industrial Relations within ten (10)
label: BODY

text: days of notification that injury leave has been denied. The Board of Industrial Relations shall
label: BODY

text: render a written decision within thirty (30) days after the close of the employee’s hearing.  The
label: BODY

text: Board of Industrial Relations, at the City's expense, may require an employee to be examined
label: BODY

text: by a physician of the Board's choice. The Board of Industrial Relations decision shall be final.
label: BODY

text: The employee may appeal the Board's decision to the Franklin County Court of Common Pleas.
label: BODY

text: Appeals of injury leave denials cannot be grieved through the grievance procedure, with the
label: BODY

text: sole exception of allegations that the City has not adhered to procedural provisions expressly
label: BODY

text: set forth in the written provisions of this Article 22. Such a grievance shall be filed at Step 2 of
label: BODY

text: the grievance procedure.
label: BODY

text: Section 22.7. Use of Other Leaves Pending Decision on Injury Leave.
label: HH2

text: Pending a decision by the Director of the Human Resources Department or designee, an
label: BODY

text: employee applying for injury leave may be carried on sick leave, vacation leave or
label: BODY

text: compensatory time with pay, in that order, which shall be restored to his/her credit upon
label: BODY

text: certification by the Director of the Human Resources Department or designee that injury leave
label: BODY

text: has been approved. If injury leave is not certified by the Director of the Human Resources
label: BODY

text: Department or designee, the employee will be charged sick leave, vacation leave or
label: BODY

text: compensatory time, in that order, for the time used or charged leave without pay after the
label: BODY

text: employee's sick leave, vacation leave, and compensatory time are exhausted.
label: BODY

text: Section 22.8. Use of Injury Leave for Medical Examinations/Treatment and Certain
label: HH2

text: Related Hearings.
label: HH1

text: Pursuant to rules established by the Director of the Human Resources Department or designee,
label: BODY

text: time off for the purpose of medical examination, including examinations by the Bureau of
label: BODY

text: Workers' Compensation, and/or treatments resulting from an injury approved under the injury
label: BODY

text: leave program, shall be charged to injury leave. A maximum of four (4) hours of injury leave
label: BODY

text: shall be allowed per scheduled physician's appointment and/or treatment resulting from an on-
label: BODY

text: the-job injury. An employee will be retained in his/her current pay status at the time of Bureau of
label: BODY

text: Workers’ Compensation hearings or Industrial Relations Board hearings if the employee
label: BODY

text: provides his/her immediate supervisor with proof of hearing notice prior to the date of hearing.
label: BODY

text: The Director of the Human Resources Department or designee may approve an employee's
label: BODY

text: request for injury leave of greater than four (4) hours for a scheduled physician's appointment or
label: BODY

text: for treatment resulting from an on-the-job injury if the Director of Human Resources or designee
label: BODY

text: determines that such request is supported by medical documentation. However, such medical
label: BODY

text: documentation must be submitted to the Director of Human Resources or designee by the
label: BODY

text: employee prior to such appointment and/or treatment in order to be considered.
label: BODY

text: Section 22.9. Continuation of Benefits While on Injury Leave.
label: HH2

text: While an employee is on approved injury leave with pay, sick leave entitlement and vacation
label: BODY

text: accruals, PERS contributions and all employee benefits shall continue uninterrupted and the
label: BODY

text: City shall maintain applicable insurance benefits for the employee until such time as the
label: BODY

text: employee returns to duty or is terminated from employment. Upon proof that an employee is
label: BODY

text: receiving payments in lieu of wages from the Ohio Bureau of Workers' Compensation, sick
label: BODY

text: leave entitlement and vacation accruals and all applicable insurance benefits shall continue
label: BODY

text: uninterrupted until the employee returns to duty or is terminated from employment.  Any
label: BODY

text: insurance premium not paid during injury leave must be brought current upon return from leave.
label: BODY

text: Section 22.10.  Extension of Injury Leave in Certain Circumstances and Repayment from
label: HH2

text: Workers’ Compensation.
label: HH1

text: If an employee who has been granted injury leave does not begin receiving payments in lieu of
label: BODY

text: wages from the Ohio Bureau of Workers' Compensation by the time the injury leave has been
label: BODY

text: exhausted (i.e., after sixty (60), fifty (50), or forty (40) workdays, whichever is applicable), and
label: BODY

text: the employee has filed a timely claim under the Ohio Workers' Compensation laws for such
label: BODY

text: payment, then the City shall pay the employee seventy-two percent (72%) or sixty-six and 2/3
label: BODY

text: percent (66-2/3%), whichever is applicable, of his/her wages until such time as payments from
label: BODY

text: the Bureau are received or the claim is denied by a Staff Hearing Officer of the Industrial
label: BODY

text: Commission of Ohio. In any instance of payment by both the City and the Ohio Bureau of
label: BODY

text: Workers' Compensation for the same day or days, the employee shall promptly provide full
label: BODY

text: reimbursement to the City as determined by the City unless the City has received payment
label: BODY

text: directly from the Bureau of Workers’ Compensation. The employee will be required to execute
label: BODY

text: any necessary forms with the Ohio Bureau of Workers' Compensation to effectuate payment to
label: BODY

text: the City.
label: BODY

text: Section 22.11. Deadline for Application for Disability Following Exhaustion of Injury
label: HH2

text: Leave.
label: HH1

text: In the event the employee has been denied all remedies through injury leave and Workers’
label: BODY

text: Compensation, the employee has thirty (30) days to file for short-term disability benefits.
label: BODY

text: Section 22.12. Reopener.
label: HH2

text: The parties agree that this Article 22 will be reopened if either of the following two actions occur:
label: BODY

text: The City opts to self insure.
label: BODY

text: The Bureau of Workers’ Compensation (BWC) changes its rating methodology in
label: BODY

text: such a way as to negatively impact the injury leave program.
label: BODY

text: Upon notice to the other party, the parties shall meet within fifteen (15) days to begin
label: BODY

text: negotiations for successor language. Impasse reached in this section shall be governed by
label: BODY

text: applicable State Employment Relations Board (SERB) law.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 23 - SPECIAL LEAVE WITH PAY
label: HH1

text: Section 23.1. Military Leave.
label: HH2

text: Full-time employees who are members of the Ohio National Guard, U.S. Air
label: BODY

text: Force Reserve, U.S. Army Reserve, U.S. Marine Corps Reserve, U.S. Naval
label: BODY

text: Reserve or U.S. Coast Guard Reserve shall be granted military leave of absence
label: BODY

text: with pay when ordered to temporary active duty (e.g. active duty for training or
label: BODY

text: annual training) for a period or periods not to exceed twenty-two (22) eight (8)
label: BODY

text: hour work days (176 hours), whether or not consecutive, during each calendar
label: BODY

text: year. Active duty does not include inactive duty training (e.g. unit training
label: BODY

text: assemblies). In the event the Chief Executive Officer of the State of Ohio or the
label: BODY

text: Chief Executive Officer of the United States declares a state of emergency
label: BODY

text: exists, the employee, if ordered to active duty for purposes of that emergency,
label: BODY

text: shall be paid pursuant to this Section 23.1 for a period or periods, not to exceed
label: BODY

text: twenty-two (22) eight (8) hour work days (176 hours), whether or not
label: BODY

text: consecutive, during each calendar year.
label: BODY

text: An employee shall be paid his/her regular salary for each scheduled workday
label: BODY

text: such employee is absent during military leave of absence with pay as authorized
label: BODY

text: by this Section 23.1.
label: BODY

text: The City shall comply with all applicable Federal and State laws, and any City
label: BODY

text: ordinances relating to the granting of military leave and reinstating employees
label: BODY

text: upon the conclusion of said leave.
label: BODY

text: Section 23.2. Jury Duty Leave.
label: HH2

text: Full-time employee serving upon a jury in any court of record of Franklin County,
label: BODY

text: Ohio, or adjoining counties shall be paid his/her regular salary for the period of
label: BODY

text: time so served. Time so served upon a jury shall be deemed active service with
label: BODY

text: the City for all purposes, including perfect attendance. The employee is required
label: BODY

text: to obtain a signed record from the courts to document the time spent on jury
label: BODY

text: duty. Upon receipt of payment for jury service during regular working hours, the
label: BODY

text: employee shall deposit such funds with the City Treasurer. An employee on jury
label: BODY

text: duty leave who is normally assigned to the second or third shift in a twenty-four
label: BODY

text: (24) hour continuous operation shall be assigned to the first shift, Monday
label: BODY

text: through Friday, for the duration of his/her jury duty.
label: BODY

text: Part-time regular employees serving upon a jury in any court of record of Franklin
label: BODY

text: County, Ohio, or adjoining counties shall be paid his/her regular hourly rate for
label: BODY

text: any period of time so served during the employee’s scheduled work hours.  Time
label: BODY

text: so served upon a jury shall be deemed active service with the City for all
label: BODY

text: purposes.  The employee is required to obtain a signed record from the courts to
label: BODY

text: document the time spent on jury duty.  Upon receipt of payment for jury service
label: BODY

text: which occurs during the employee’s scheduled work hours, the employee shall
label: BODY

text: deposit such funds with the City Treasurer.
label: BODY

text: When the employee receives notice for jury duty in any court of record of Franklin
label: BODY

text: County, Ohio, or in any adjoining county, he/she shall present such notice to
label: BODY

text: his/her immediate supervisor. A copy will be made of the notice and filed and
label: BODY

text: recorded in the employee's personnel file.
label: BODY

text: When notified by the court to report for jury duty on a day certain, a time
label: BODY

text: report shall be completed and signed by the assignment commissioner or
label: BODY

text: appropriate court official for each day during jury service setting forth the
label: BODY

text: time of arrival and departure from the court. Such record shall be
label: BODY

text: presented by the employee to his/her supervisor upon return to work.
label: BODY

text: When an employee is required to be in court for jury duty he/she shall
label: BODY

text: report directly to court.  If an employee is released from Jury Duty two (2)
label: BODY

text: or more hours prior to the end of his/her assigned shift, or if an employee
label: BODY

text: is not required to report for Jury Duty until two (2) hours after the
label: BODY

text: beginning of his/her assigned shift, he/she shall return/report to work.
label: BODY

text: Alternatively, the employee, at his/her option, may charge such duty time
label: BODY

text: at the beginning or end of his/her shift as vacation leave or compensatory
label: BODY

text: time.
label: BODY

text: Section 23.3. Examination Leave.
label: HH2

text: Provisional employees shall be permitted time off with pay to participate in City Civil Service
label: BODY

text: tests for their current position. All employees shall be permitted time off with pay to participate in
label: BODY

text: City Civil Service tests for promotions (i.e., testing for a higher rated job classification than the
label: BODY

text: employee currently holds). Any employee taking a required examination pertinent to his/her
label: BODY

text: current City position before a state or federal licensing board shall be permitted time off with pay
label: BODY

text: provided the Appointing Authority is given prior notice as soon as the employee knows the date
label: BODY

text: of the examination.
label: BODY

text: Section 23.4. Court Leave.
label: HH2

text: Time off with pay shall be granted employees who are subpoenaed to attend any
label: BODY

text: legal proceedings as a witness on behalf of the City of Columbus. Vacation leave
label: BODY

text: or leave without pay shall be granted to employees who are subpoenaed for
label: BODY

text: other purposes. The provisions of Section 23.2 above shall apply in such cases.
label: BODY

text: In the event an employee is required to appear as a witness in a legal proceeding
label: BODY

text: on behalf of a governmental body other than the City, the Director of the
label: BODY

text: Department of Human Resources or designee shall consider and may grant
label: BODY

text: leave with pay, if appropriate.
label: BODY

text: Whenever employees are required, as a term of their employment, to appear in
label: BODY

text: Court to testify as a witness, they shall not be required to furnish their home
label: BODY

text: addresses or telephone numbers, unless directed to do so by the Court.
label: BODY

text: Section 23.5. Disaster Leave.
label: HH2

text: Time off with pay shall be allowed to a fully qualified employee for service in specialized disaster
label: BODY

text: relief service for the American Red Cross. Said leave shall be granted only after the requisition
label: BODY

text: of the individual serving in such capacity by the American Red Cross. Eligibility of any employee
label: BODY

text: for such service shall be established prior to the granting of leave and subject to the approval of
label: BODY

text: the Appointing Authority for the individual involved.
label: BODY

text: Section 23.6. Betty Brzezinski Living Organ Donor Leave.
label: HH2

text: A full-time employee in active service will be eligible to receive regular pay for up to two hundred
label: BODY

text: forty (240) hours of leave per year for the employee’s donation of any portion of an adult liver,
label: BODY

text: lung or pancreas or because of the employee’s donation of an adult kidney.
label: BODY

text: A full-time employee in active service is eligible to receive regular pay for up to fifty-six (56)
label: BODY

text: hours of leave per year for the employee’s donation of adult bone marrow.
label: BODY

text: Such leave shall be charged as Family Medical Leave (FMLA) as provided in Article 24 of the
label: BODY

text: contract and shall be subject to the twelve (12) week per year limitation for the length of an
label: BODY

text: FMLA leave provided the employee qualifies as provided in Section 24.7.
label: BODY

text: Paid time off pursuant to the Section is subject to review of appropriate medical documentation
label: BODY

text: by the Director of Human Resources or designee.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 24 - LEAVE WITHOUT PAY
label: BODY

text: Section 24.1. Away Without Leave.
label: HH2

text: An employee who is absent from work with the approval of the Appointing Authority or designee,
label: BODY

text: whether in paid or unpaid status, is excused and shall not be subject to disciplinary action. An
label: BODY

text: employee who is away without leave, or AWOL, may be subject to disciplinary action. AWOL
label: BODY

text: includes, but is not limited to, the following situations:
label: BODY

text: The employee does not call off by following the proper procedure and does not
label: BODY

text: report for work;
label: BODY

text: The employee does not have enough accrued leave time to cover his/her
label: BODY

text: absence;
label: BODY

text: The employee leaves the workplace without notifying and/or securing the
label: BODY

text: approval of his/her supervisor, or if unavailable, the next available supervisor
label: BODY

text: within his/her chain of command;
label: BODY

text: The employee leaves the workplace without adequate approval, e.g., he/she
label: BODY

text: leaves a written request for leave but leaves without finding out if his/her
label: BODY

text: supervisor, or if unavailable, the next available supervisor within his/her chain of
label: BODY

text: command,  has approved the request;
label: BODY

text: The employee fails to show or call off for scheduled overtime;
label: BODY

text: The employee reports to work but is seven (7) or more minutes late; and/or
label: BODY

text: The employee fails to follow the proper call off procedure.
label: BODY

text: These instances of AWOL are not equivalent for purposes of discipline, and discipline will be
label: BODY

text: commensurate with the offense.
label: BODY

text: Section 24.2. Unpaid Personal Leave.
label: HH2

text: The Appointing Authority may at his/her sole discretion grant unpaid leave to employees for
label: BODY

text: good cause. Such leave shall not normally exceed sixty (60) days, except that the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority at his/her sole discretion may extend beyond the sixty (60) day period.
label: BODY

text: Section 24.3. Unpaid Educational Leave.
label: HH2

text: Employees may be granted a leave of absence without pay by the Appointing Authority, for
label: BODY

text: educational purposes. Such leave shall initially be limited to sixty (60) calendar days with
label: BODY

text: possible extensions up to one (1) year provided such further educational pursuits are related to
label: BODY

text: the operations of the City.
label: BODY

text: Section 24.4. Unpaid Union Leave.
label: HH2

text: Long Term.  At the request of the Union, a leave of absence without pay shall be
label: BODY

text: granted to any classified employee who is a member of the Union and who is
label: BODY

text: selected for the Union office or employed by a Union for a fixed term of office,
label: BODY

text: subject to the approval of the Appointing Authority. Such leave shall initially be
label: BODY

text: limited to sixty (60) calendar days with possible extensions up to one (1) year.
label: BODY

text: Such service will not constitute a break in service for seniority rights or
label: BODY

text: promotional examination administered by the Civil Service Commission.
label: BODY

text: Short Term. At the request of the Union, a leave of absence without pay shall be
label: BODY

text: granted to any classified employee who is a member of the Union to attend a
label: BODY

text: convention or other similar functions of short duration subject to the approval of
label: BODY

text: the Appointing Authority. Such leave of absence will affect neither his/her sick
label: BODY

text: leave and vacation leave accruals, premium pay computations, and/or
label: BODY

text: anniversary date for increases or seniority; nor will it constitute a break in service
label: BODY

text: for computing service credits for Civil Service examinations.
label: BODY

text: Section 24.5. Leave of Absence to Accept Provisional Appointment.
label: HH2

text: An employee with permanent status who accepts a provisional appointment shall be granted a
label: BODY

text: leave of absence for a period of two (2) years from his/her permanent classification position.
label: BODY

text: This section does not prohibit an employee from requesting a leave of absence in excess of two
label: BODY

text: (2) years. Such leave may be granted by the Appointing Authority.
label: BODY

text: Section 24.6. Military Leave of Absence.
label: HH2

text: An employee shall be granted a leave of absence to serve in the Armed Forces of the United
label: BODY

text: States of America or any branch thereof. The City shall comply with all applicable Federal laws
label: BODY

text: relating to the granting of military leave and reinstating employees upon the conclusion of said
label: BODY

text: leave. Such leave of absence shall be governed by the following principles:
label: BODY

text: No employee shall lose his/her rank, grade or seniority enjoyed at the time of
label: BODY

text: his/her enlistment, induction or call into the active service of the Armed Forces of
label: BODY

text: the United States of America or any branch thereof.
label: BODY

text: Any employee, upon his/her discharge from the Armed Forces, other than a
label: BODY

text: dishonorable discharge, shall be returned to the position he/she held immediately
label: BODY

text: prior to his/her enlistment or induction into the Armed Forces or to a position of
label: BODY

text: equal rank and grade. This reinstatement is conditioned on the employee
label: BODY

text: establishing the fact that his/her physical and mental condition has not been
label: BODY

text: impaired to the extent of rendering him/her incompetent to perform the duties of
label: BODY

text: the position he/she previously held. Such employee must request restoration to
label: BODY

text: his/her position within ninety (90) calendar days of receiving a discharge, other
label: BODY

text: than a dishonorable discharge, from the Armed Forces or his/her position will be
label: BODY

text: declared vacant. Nothing contained in this Section 24.6 shall obligate the City to
label: BODY

text: pay an employee who is on military leave of absence except under the conditions
label: BODY

text: set forth in Section 23.1 of this contract.
label: BODY

text: An employee selected from an eligible list and having completed the probationary
label: BODY

text: period who is serving in a position vacated temporarily due to the previous
label: BODY

text: incumbent being in the Armed Forces, shall be determined to have been given a
label: BODY

text: permanent appointment if the returning employee does not return to work within
label: BODY

text: the prescribed time.
label: BODY

text: The term "Armed Forces of the United States" as used in this Section 24.6 shall
label: BODY

text: be deemed to include such services as designated by the Congress of the United
label: BODY

text: States.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who is transferred or advanced to a position by reason of a
label: BODY

text: vacancy caused by an employee serving in the Armed Forces shall be returned
label: BODY

text: to the position he/she held before said transfer or advancement or to a position of
label: BODY

text: equal rank or grade, upon the return of the employee from the Armed Forces.
label: BODY

text: An employee appointed from an eligible list for assignment to a temporary
label: BODY

text: position with the City, becoming available by virtue of an employee enlisting or
label: BODY

text: being inducted or called into the Armed Forces, shall be reinstated to the eligible
label: BODY

text: list upon completion of the temporary employment.
label: BODY

text: In any case where two (2) or more employees who are entitled to be restored to
label: BODY

text: a position left the same position in order to enter the Armed Forces, the
label: BODY

text: employee with greatest seniority in that classification shall have the prior
label: BODY

text: restoration right without prejudice to the reemployment rights of the other
label: BODY

text: employee or employees to be restored.
label: BODY

text: Where service in the Armed Forces results from induction or call to active duty,
label: BODY

text: leave shall be granted for the duration of such call.
label: BODY

text: Section 24.7. Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) Leave.
label: HH2

text: Employees who have worked for the City for at least twelve (12) months, and
label: BODY

text: have worked for at least 1,250 hours over the twelve (12) month period
label: BODY

text: preceding the leave, shall be eligible for up to twelve (12) weeks of unpaid leave
label: BODY

text: per twelve (12) month period for the following:
label: BODY

text: For birth of a son or daughter, and to care for the newborn child;
label: BODY

text: For placement with the employee of a son or daughter for adoption or
label: BODY

text: foster care. Adoption is limited to a child of eighteen (18) years of age or
label: BODY

text: younger unless the child is incapable of self-care because of a physical or
label: BODY

text: mental disability;
label: BODY

text: To care for the employee's spouse, child or parent with a serious health
label: BODY

text: condition;
label: BODY

text: Because of a serious health condition that makes the employee unable to
label: BODY

text: perform the functions of the employee's job.
label: BODY

text: For the purposes of Section 24.7(A):
label: BODY

text: FMLA leave shall be granted for an employee's "spouse" as defined by
label: BODY

text: Ohio law (i.e., unmarried domestic partners are not included). If both
label: BODY

text: spouses are working for the City, their total leave in any twelve (12)
label: BODY

text: month period shall be limited to an aggregate of twelve (12) weeks if the
label: BODY

text: leave is taken for either the birth or adoption of a child or to care for a sick
label: BODY

text: parent.
label: BODY

text: "Child" means a child either under eighteen (18) years of age or eighteen
label: BODY

text: (18) years or older who is incapable of self-care because of mental or
label: BODY

text: physical disability. An employee's "child" is one for whom the employee
label: BODY

text: has actual day-to-day responsibility for care and includes a biological,
label: BODY

text: adopted, foster or stepchild or the child of one standing in loco parentis.
label: BODY

text: "Parent" means a biological parent or an individual who stands or stood in
label: BODY

text: loco parentis to an employee when the employee was a child. This term
label: BODY

text: does not include parents "in law."
label: BODY

text: An employee's right to leave for the birth or adoption of a child ends
label: BODY

text: twelve (12) months after the child's birth or placement with the employee.
label: BODY

text: The City retains the option of choosing a uniform method to compute the
label: BODY

text: twelve (12) month period, including a rolling twelve (12) month period
label: BODY

text: measured backward from the date leave is used.
label: BODY

text: The City retains the right to require written documentation of the family
label: BODY

text: relationship, when applicable.
label: BODY

text: For the purposes of Sections 24.7(A)(3) and (4), a "serious health condition"
label: BODY

text: means an illness, injury, impairment or a physical or mental condition that
label: BODY

text: involves:
label: BODY

text: Any period of incapacity or treatment in connection with or consequent to
label: BODY

text: inpatient care (i.e., an overnight stay) in a hospital, hospice or residential
label: BODY

text: medical facility;
label: BODY

text: Any period of incapacity requiring absence from work, school or other
label: BODY

text: regular daily activities of more than three (3) calendar days, and that also
label: BODY

text: involves continuing treatment by (or under the supervision of) a health
label: BODY

text: care provider; or
label: BODY

text: Continuing treatment by (or under the supervision of) a health care
label: BODY

text: provider for a chronic or a long-term health condition that is incurable or
label: BODY

text: so serious that, if not treated, would likely result in a period of incapacity
label: BODY

text: of more than three (3) calendar days; or
label: BODY

text: Prenatal care by a health care provider.
label: BODY

text: Employees may take FMLA leave intermittently or on a reduced leave schedule
label: BODY

text: only when medically necessary because of the employee's own serious health
label: BODY

text: condition or the serious health condition of the employee's spouse, child or
label: BODY

text: parent. If leave is requested on this basis, however, the City may require the
label: BODY

text: employee to transfer temporarily to an alternative position which better
label: BODY

text: accommodates recurring periods of absence or a part-time schedule, provided
label: BODY

text: that the position has equivalent pay and benefits.
label: BODY

text: Upon return from FMLA leave, the employee shall be returned to the position
label: BODY

text: held prior to the leave or an equivalent position.
label: BODY

text: The City shall maintain health insurance benefits for the duration of FMLA leave
label: BODY

text: at the level and under the same conditions (including employee premium
label: BODY

text: contributions) and coverage that would have been provided if the employee had
label: BODY

text: continued in active work status for the duration of the leave.
label: BODY

text: During an unpaid FMLA leave, subject to Section 13.2 (regarding accumulation
label: BODY

text: of seniority) an employee shall not continue to accrue seniority and shall not
label: BODY

text: accrue any employment benefits for the period of the leave, except for
label: BODY

text: continuation of insurance benefits as provided in Paragraph (F) immediately
label: BODY

text: above.
label: BODY

text: All accrued sick leave benefits must be utilized for any FMLA leave taken for any
label: BODY

text: reason which qualifies for sick leave under Article 20 of this Contract. All accrued
label: BODY

text: vacation leave benefits must be substituted for all or part of any unpaid FMLA
label: BODY

text: leave taken after sick leave benefits have first been exhausted or for any FMLA
label: BODY

text: leave for which sick leave is not applicable.
label: BODY

text: The following notice and scheduling requirements shall apply to FMLA leave
label: BODY

text: requests, unless the FMLA leave is being charged to sick or vacation leave, in
label: BODY

text: which case the notice requirements for sick leave in Article 20 or for vacation
label: BODY

text: leave in Article 19 of this Contract shall apply.
label: BODY

text: Employees must give thirty (30) days notice to the City before taking
label: BODY

text: FMLA leave, if the need for leave is foreseeable. If the need for leave is
label: BODY

text: not foreseeable, the employee must notify the City as soon as is
label: BODY

text: practicable (normally no later than twenty-four (24) hours after the need
label: BODY

text: for the leave becomes known).
label: BODY

text: If an employee has actual notice of the notice requirement stated in
label: BODY

text: 24.7(I)(1) above (this requirement of actual notice is fulfilled by posting a
label: BODY

text: notice at the worksite), and fails to provide the City with thirty (30) days
label: BODY

text: notice for a foreseeable leave with no reasonable excuse for the delay,
label: BODY

text: the City may deny the taking of leave until at least thirty (30) days after
label: BODY

text: the employee provides notice.
label: BODY

text: Employees shall provide at least verbal notice sufficient to make the City
label: BODY

text: aware that the employee needs FMLA-qualifying leave, and the
label: BODY

text: anticipated timing and duration of the leave. The City may inquire further
label: BODY

text: of the employee when additional information is needed to determine
label: BODY

text: whether FMLA leave is to be taken.
label: BODY

text: If an employee takes leave based on the serious health condition of the
label: BODY

text: employee or to care for a family member, the employee must make a
label: BODY

text: reasonable effort to schedule treatment so as to not unduly disrupt the
label: BODY

text: City's operation. If an employee does not initiate discussions with the City
label: BODY

text: to attempt to arrange a mutually agreeable treatment schedule, the City
label: BODY

text: may initiate such discussions and require the employee to attempt to
label: BODY

text: make such arrangements, subject to the approval of the health care
label: BODY

text: provider.
label: BODY

text: The following medical certification requirements shall apply to FMLA leave
label: BODY

text: requests:
label: BODY

text: Employees who request leave because of their own serious health
label: BODY

text: condition or the serious health condition of a covered family member shall
label: BODY

text: be required to provide a certification issued by the health care provider of
label: BODY

text: the employee or the employee's family member on a form acceptable to
label: BODY

text: the Director of the Department of Human Resources or designee in
label: BODY

text: accordance with Department of Labor regulations. For the employee's
label: BODY

text: own medical leave, the certification must include, among other things, the
label: BODY

text: date the condition commenced, probable duration of incapacity, a
label: BODY

text: statement that the employee is unable to perform the functions of the
label: BODY

text: employee's position, and a statement of the regimen of treatment
label: BODY

text: prescribed for the condition by the health care provider (including
label: BODY

text: estimated number of visits, nature, frequency, and duration of treatment).
label: BODY

text: For leave to care for a seriously ill child, spouse or parent, the certification
label: BODY

text: must include, among other things, the date the condition commenced,
label: BODY

text: probable duration of incapacity, a statement that the patient requires
label: BODY

text: assistance for basic medical, hygiene, nutritional needs, safety or
label: BODY

text: transportation, or that the employee's presence or assistance would be
label: BODY

text: beneficial or desirable for the care of the family member, and an estimate
label: BODY

text: of the amount of time the employee is needed to provide care.
label: BODY

text: The City shall give employees requesting FMLA leave written notice of
label: BODY

text: the requirement for medical certification.
label: BODY

text: In its discretion, the City may require a second medical opinion and
label: BODY

text: periodic re-certification at its own expense. If the first and second
label: BODY

text: opinions differ, the City, at its own expense, may obtain the binding
label: BODY

text: opinion of a third health care provider, approved jointly by the employee
label: BODY

text: and the City.
label: BODY

text: Employees must provide the requested certification to the City within the
label: BODY

text: time frame requested by the City, unless it is not practicable under the
label: BODY

text: particular circumstances to do so despite the employee's diligent, good
label: BODY

text: faith efforts. The City must allow at least fifteen (15) calendar days after
label: BODY

text: the City's request for certification.
label: BODY

text: In most cases, the City shall request that an employee furnish certification
label: BODY

text: from a health care provider at the time the employee requests leave or
label: BODY

text: soon after the leave is requested or in the case of unforeseen leave, soon
label: BODY

text: after the leave commences. The City may request certification or re-
label: BODY

text: certification at some later date if the City has reason to question the
label: BODY

text: appropriateness of the leave or its duration, if circumstances have
label: BODY

text: changed significantly or if any extension of the leave is requested. If the
label: BODY

text: City believes the certification is incomplete, it shall notify the employee
label: BODY

text: and allow an opportunity to correct the deficiency. In the case of a
label: BODY

text: complete certification which is unclear, the City's health care provider
label: BODY

text: may, with the employee's permission, contact the employee's health care
label: BODY

text: provider to clarify and authenticate the certification.
label: BODY

text: Certification shall be submitted using a form approved by the Director of
label: BODY

text: the Department of Human Resources for use by employees consistent
label: BODY

text: with the FMLA.
label: BODY

text: All employees who take FMLA leave because of their own serious health
label: BODY

text: condition shall be required to provide medical certification of their fitness
label: BODY

text: to report back to work. The City may seek fitness for duty certification only
label: BODY

text: with regard to the particular health condition that caused the employee's
label: BODY

text: need for FMLA leave.
label: BODY

text: The City may require an employee on FMLA leave to report periodically on the
label: BODY

text: employee's status and intent to return to work. An FMLA leave will not be granted
label: BODY

text: to permit an employee to accept gainful employment elsewhere, including self-
label: BODY

text: employment. If an employee gives unequivocal notice of intent not to return, the
label: BODY

text: City's obligations under FMLA to maintain health benefits (subject to COBRA
label: BODY

text: requirements) and to restore the employee cease.
label: BODY

text: Leaves that are granted under any other provision of this Contract or under State
label: BODY

text: law, whether paid or unpaid, including sick, disability and injury leave as provided
label: BODY

text: in Articles 20, 21 and 22, respectively, for purposes which are covered under the
label: BODY

text: Family Medical Leave Act, shall be charged as FMLA Leave and shall be subject
label: BODY

text: to the twelve (12) week per year limitation for the length of an FMLA leave.
label: BODY

text: The City, in its discretion, may implement the FMLA consistent with the foregoing
label: BODY

text: provisions of this Section 24.7 and in accordance with any Department of Labor
label: BODY

text: regulations, which may be in effect from time to time.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 25 - DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING
label: BODY

text: Section 25.1. Prohibited Conduct.
label: HH2

text: Employees shall be prohibited from:
label: BODY

text: Reporting to work or working under the influence of alcohol; or
label: BODY

text: Consuming or possessing alcohol at any time while on duty, or anywhere on any
label: BODY

text: City premises or in any City vehicle; or
label: BODY

text: Possessing, using, being under the influence of, selling, purchasing,
label: BODY

text: manufacturing, dispensing or delivering any illegal drug at any time and at any
label: BODY

text: place; or
label: BODY

text: Abusing, illegally distributing or selling any prescription drug; or
label: BODY

text: Failing to report to their supervisor any work-related restrictions imposed as a
label: BODY

text: result of prescription or over-the-counter medication they are taking; or
label: BODY

text: Using any adulterants or otherwise tampering with the specimen; or
label: BODY

text: Refusing to take a drug and/or alcohol test.
label: BODY

text: Section 25.2. Testing to be Conducted.
label: HH2

text: Reasonable Suspicion.  When the City has reason to believe an employee is: 1)
label: BODY

text: under the influence of alcohol, or consuming or possessing alcohol in violation of
label: BODY

text: this Article; or 2) is possessing, using or under the influence of illegal drugs; or 3)
label: BODY

text: is abusing prescription drugs, the City shall require the employee to submit to
label: BODY

text: drug and alcohol testing.
label: BODY

text: Testing procedures will be comparable to those set forth in Federal regulations
label: BODY

text: governing drug and alcohol testing for CDL holders; except as follows.  An
label: BODY

text: employee with an alcohol level of .04 to .06 shall be relieved of duty but the result
label: BODY

text: will not be considered positive.  Alcohol levels of higher than .06 shall be
label: BODY

text: considered positive; the employee will be referred to EAP and will be required to
label: BODY

text: take a return-to-duty test. The parties will work together to improve the process of
label: BODY

text: reasonable suspicion testing.
label: BODY

text: The City shall hold harmless any employee or supervisor, who, in good faith and
label: BODY

text: with just cause, recommends that an employee be tested for drugs and/or
label: BODY

text: alcohol.
label: BODY

text: Random Testing.  All employees required to possess a Commercial Drivers
label: BODY

text: License (CDL) shall be subject to random drug and alcohol testing pursuant to
label: BODY

text: federal law and guidelines and the Drug and Alcohol Testing Policy in effect on
label: BODY

text: April 1, 2002.
label: BODY

text: Post-Accident Testing.  All employees, while driving a City vehicle, who are
label: BODY

text: involved in a vehicular accident where any of the following occur:
label: BODY

text: A fatality; or
label: BODY

text: The employee receives a citation and the City vehicle is disabled and
label: BODY

text: requires a tow; or
label: BODY

text: The employee receives a citation and someone involved in the accident
label: BODY

text: requires off-site medical treatment,
label: BODY

text: shall be required to submit to drug and alcohol testing under the procedures for
label: BODY

text: reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol testing set forth in Section 25.3 below.
label: BODY

text: Section 25.3. Procedures.
label: HH2

text: Any employee who tests positive for drugs and/or alcohol shall be relieved of
label: BODY

text: duty without pay (unless the employee elects to use his/her available vacation or
label: BODY

text: compensatory time balances) and referred to the City’s Employee Assistance
label: BODY

text: Program (EAP). Before returning to work after a positive test result, an employee
label: BODY

text: must take a return-to-duty test and test negative. An employee shall be subject to
label: BODY

text: follow-up testing for one (1) year.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who voluntarily requests drug and/or alcohol education and/or
label: BODY

text: treatment shall not be disciplined in connection with that request, if the request is
label: BODY

text: done prior to selection for random testing.
label: BODY

text: Failure to cooperate and a refusal to test shall be construed as a positive test
label: BODY

text: result. Any drug test which reveals the presence of adulterants shall be
label: BODY

text: construed as a positive test.
label: BODY

text: Any employee that has completed his/her initial probationary period who tests
label: BODY

text: positive the first time will not be disciplined for the positive result, although he/she
label: BODY

text: may be disciplined for other work rule or policy violations in connection with that
label: BODY

text: positive result. A second positive drug or alcohol test shall result in discipline up
label: BODY

text: to and including termination of employment.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who tests between .04 - .06 of alcohol shall be relieved of duty for
label: BODY

text: the remainder of his/her scheduled work day, but may elect to use vacation leave
label: BODY

text: or compensatory time to cover this absence.
label: BODY

text: The City shall maintain a policy and procedure for drug and alcohol testing
label: BODY

text: consistent with the terms and provisions of this Contract.
label: BODY

text: The City will continue to conduct training on the reasonable suspicion and the
label: BODY

text: random drug and alcohol testing process. This training will be provided to all
label: BODY

text: affected employees, supervisors and Union representatives.
label: BODY

text: The City and the Union will make reasonable efforts to encourage self-referral to
label: BODY

text: the EAP for education and treatment programs, upon request.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 26 - WAGE AND COMPENSATION PLAN
label: HH1

text: Section 26.1.  General Pay Plan.
label: HH2

text: Pay Ranges and Rates of Pay.
label: BODY

text: Effective at the beginning of the pay period which includes April 1, 2008,
label: BODY

text: the following pay ranges and hourly rates of pay are hereby established
label: BODY

text: as the "General Pay Plan" of this Contract. These pay ranges and hourly
label: BODY

text: rates of pay shall be applied to the several classes of positions as set
label: BODY

text: forth in Appendix A.
