label: BODY

text: Effective at the beginning of the pay period which includes April 1, 2009,
label: BODY

text: the following pay ranges and hourly rates of pay are hereby established
label: BODY

text: as the "General Pay Plan" of this Contract. These pay ranges and hourly
label: BODY

text: rates of pay shall be applied to the several classes of positions as set
label: BODY

text: forth in Appendix A.
label: BODY

text: Effective at the beginning of the pay period which includes April 1, 2010,
label: BODY

text: the following pay ranges and hourly rates of pay are hereby established
label: BODY

text: as the "General Pay Plan" of this Contract. These pay ranges and hourly
label: BODY

text: rates of pay shall be applied to the several classes of positions as set
label: BODY

text: forth in Appendix A.
label: BODY

text: The pay plan shall be applied in the following manner:
label: BODY

text: All employees will be paid at Step 0 during their first year of continuous
label: BODY

text: service. Any employee initially hired after June 5, 2005 shall be paid in
label: BODY

text: Step A.
label: BODY

text: Upon completion of each year of continuous service all employees will
label: BODY

text: advance one step in their respective pay range until they reach Step 5.
label: BODY

text: At no time will an employee be paid higher than the maximum hourly rate
label: BODY

text: of any step.
label: BODY

text: Each year of continuous service shall be based upon an employee's continuous
label: BODY

text: service as defined in Article 2. Solely for purposes of Section 26.1(A) and 26.1(B)
label: BODY

text: of this Contract, a part-time employee will be deemed to have completed one (1)
label: BODY

text: year of continuous service when he/she has accumulated more than 2,080 hours
label: BODY

text: in paid status with no separation from City employment.
label: BODY

text: Employees shall qualify for the step increases provided for under this Section
label: BODY

text: 26.1 on the first day of the pay period following completion of each required
label: BODY

text: period of continuous service.
label: BODY

text: Section 26.2. Contributions to the Public Employees Retirement System of Ohio.
label: HH2

text: The term "earned compensation" shall mean any and all monies earned by an
label: BODY

text: employee from the City of Columbus, for which there is a pension contribution.
label: BODY

text: For full-time employees, that portion of an employee's contribution made to the
label: BODY

text: Ohio Public Employees Retirement System equal to ten percent (10%) of the
label: BODY

text: employee's earned compensation shall be picked up (assumed and paid) on
label: BODY

text: behalf of the employee, and in lieu of payment by the employee, by the City of
label: BODY

text: Columbus. The provisions of this paragraph shall apply uniformly to employees
label: BODY

text: and no such employee shall have the option to elect a wage increase or other
label: BODY

text: benefit in lieu of the payment provided for herein.
label: BODY

text: For part-time employees, that portion of an employee's contribution made to the
label: BODY

text: Ohio Public Employees Retirement System equal to six percent (6%) of the
label: BODY

text: employee's earned compensation shall be picked up (assumed and paid) on
label: BODY

text: behalf of the employee, and in lieu of payment by the employee, by the City of
label: BODY

text: Columbus. The provisions of this paragraph shall apply uniformly to employees
label: BODY

text: and no such employee shall have the option to elect a wage increase or other
label: BODY

text: benefit in lieu of the payment provided for herein.
label: BODY

text: The City shall, in reporting and making remittances to the Ohio Public Employee
label: BODY

text: Retirement System, report that each employee's contribution has been made as
label: BODY

text: provided by statute.
label: BODY

text: The City hereby declares that the sum paid hereunder by the City on behalf of an
label: BODY

text: employee, in Paragraphs (B) and (C), of the employee's earned compensation, is
label: BODY

text: not to be considered additional salary or wages and shall not be treated as
label: BODY

text: increased compensation. For purposes of computing the employee's earnings or
label: BODY

text: basis of his/her contribution to the Ohio Public Employees Retirement System,
label: BODY

text: the amount paid by the City on behalf of an employee as a portion of his/her
label: BODY

text: statutory obligation is intended to be and shall be considered as having been
label: BODY

text: paid by the employee in fulfillment of his/her statutory obligation.
label: BODY

text: If, at any time, the Ohio Public Employee Retirement System reduces the
label: BODY

text: employee contribution to an amount less than ten percent (10%), the City's
label: BODY

text: obligation shall be reduced accordingly with no further requirement to adjust
label: BODY

text: employees' compensation.
label: BODY

text: Section 26.3. Administration of Pay Plan.
label: HH2

text: Pay Rates. All employees in the bargaining unit shall be granted a three percent
label: BODY

text: (3%) pay increase effective at the beginning of the pay period which includes
label: BODY

text: April 1, 2008; a three percent (3%) increase effective at the beginning of the pay
label: BODY

text: period which includes April 1, 2009; and a three percent (3%) increase effective
label: BODY

text: at the beginning of the pay period which includes April 1, 2010. The hourly rate of
label: BODY

text: pay of each employee of the City shall be at the sole pay rate for employees
label: BODY

text: whose classes are assigned to Pay Range 29 or below. Employees whose
label: BODY

text: classes are assigned to Pay Range 30 or above shall be paid as provided herein,
label: BODY

text: or at an hourly rate authorized for that pay range as provided in Subsection (B),
label: BODY

text: (C), and (D) below. Changes in pay made to any rate in Pay Range 30 and
label: BODY

text: above shall be effective at the beginning of the next pay period following written
label: BODY

text: notice by the Appointing Authority to the Civil Service Commission. Except as set
label: BODY

text: forth in this Article, the City will not unilaterally change an employee’s Pay
label: BODY

text: Range.
label: BODY

text: New Hiring Rate. The hiring rate for a class shall be at the lowest pay rate in the
label: BODY

text: range except as otherwise provided herein. Wherein a multiple pay range is
label: BODY

text: established for a classification, the Appointing Authority will designate the range
label: BODY

text: at which the employee shall be paid in Step 0. Any employee initially hired after
label: BODY

text: June 5, 2005 shall be paid in Step A.
label: BODY

text: Demotion. Whenever an employee is reduced from his/her class to a class which
label: BODY

text: is assigned more than one pay range or more than one pay rate, the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority shall have the sole discretion as to which range or rate the employee is
label: BODY

text: entitled to be paid within the new class.
label: BODY

text: Local 1632 Merit Increases.  The City shall continue a merit pay review system
label: BODY

text: for bargaining unit employees assigned to classifications with variable pay
label: BODY

text: ranges and/or pay ranges 30 and above. Each employee shall be evaluated once
label: BODY

text: every two (2) years (provided the conditions set forth below are met) based on
label: BODY

text: the employee’s classification seniority date. If an employee meets or exceeds the
label: BODY

text: requirements of the merit pay review system, the Appointing Authority or
label: BODY

text: designee may approve a merit pay increase for him/her. If an employee has
label: BODY

text: reached the highest step of the highest pay range(s) assigned to his/her
label: BODY

text: classification, and otherwise qualifies for a merit increase, the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority or designee may give that employee a merit bonus of one hundred fifty
label: BODY

text: dollars ($150), less taxes and appropriate deductions. For those employees
label: BODY

text: whose seniority date falls on or after July 1, 2008, the merit bonus increases to
label: BODY

text: two hundred dollars ($200).  If an employee is denied a merit pay increase, the
label: BODY

text: employee shall be provided the reason(s) for such denial in writing. A merit
label: BODY

text: increase will not be denied solely on the basis of a lack of funding.
label: BODY

text: Any employee hired after June 1, 2003 will be eligible for merit consideration
label: BODY

text: after successful progression through Step 5.
label: BODY

text: For those employees whose classification seniority date falls on or after July 1,
label: BODY

text: 2008, after July 1, 2008, any applicable merit increase must be given no later
label: BODY

text: than the first day of the first pay period following the ninetieth (90th) day after the
label: BODY

text: employee’s classification seniority date.  Any merit increase processed after that
label: BODY

text: date will be retroactive to said date.
label: BODY

text: Additional Compensation or Benefits. Except as provided in Section 26.7 of this
label: BODY

text: Contract, no employee shall receive, and the City Treasurer shall not draw any
label: BODY

text: checks or any additional compensation in any form, sick and injury leave,
label: BODY

text: vacation, insurance coverage and any and all other benefits and privileges, for
label: BODY

text: any employee who substitutes or acts for another in the position of another, other
label: BODY

text: than the position to which he/she was appointed pursuant to the Ohio
label: BODY

text: Constitution, City Charter provisions, and the rules and regulations of the Civil
label: BODY

text: Service Commission. No Appointing Authority shall appoint any person or submit
label: BODY

text: any personnel action form contrary to said constitution, charter, rules and
label: BODY

text: regulations, and the provisions of this Contract.
label: BODY

text: Payroll Deductions. Payroll deductions shall be governed first by the ability of the
label: BODY

text: City Auditor's payroll system to handle them, and secondly, upon a determination
label: BODY

text: by the City of the type of payroll deductions which are to be offered to employees
label: BODY

text: and also based upon which ones will benefit the largest number of employees.
label: BODY

text: Section 26.4. Report-In Pay.
label: HH2

text: When any full-time employee reports for work in his/her regular shift and has not received
label: BODY

text: written notification from the Appointing Authority or his/her designee by the previous workday
label: BODY

text: not to report, he/she shall be assigned at least three (3) hours of work at any available job, or in
label: BODY

text: the event that no work is available, he/she shall be paid three (3) hours straight-time at his/her
label: BODY

text: regular hourly rate and released from duty no more than thirty (30) minutes after the report-in
label: BODY

text: time. All written notices not to report shall be countersigned by the employee affected. Where
label: BODY

text: written notice is provided, the written notice may direct employees not to report to work for
label: BODY

text: multiple work days. This Section 26.4 shall not apply in hazardous weather conditions as set
label: BODY

text: forth in Section 30.11.
label: BODY

text: Section 26.5. Call-Back Pay.
label: HH2

text: A call-back is defined as an unscheduled work assignment which does not immediately precede
label: BODY

text: or follow an employee's scheduled work hours (this provision, for example, does not apply to a
label: BODY

text: pre-scheduled early call-in or in cases of overtime authorized as an extension of a regular shift).
label: BODY

text: In any situation where notification of the overtime is given prior to the end of a scheduled shift,
label: BODY

text: call-back pay shall not apply. When any full-time employee is required by the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority or his/her designee to report to work after he/she has been relieved of duty upon the
label: BODY

text: completion of the employee's regular schedule and he/she does so report, he/she shall be paid
label: BODY

text: for a minimum of four (4) hours at time and one-half his regular hourly rate, except that if the
label: BODY

text: call-back occurs on the second regular day off and the employee is eligible for double time,
label: BODY

text: he/she shall be paid at the double time rate for a minimum of four (4) hours. If the call-back
label: BODY

text: occurs within two (2) hours of the start of the employee's regular shift, he/she shall be paid a
label: BODY

text: minimum of two (2) hours at time and one-half his/her regular hourly rate. If an employee is
label: BODY

text: called back to work, he/she will be paid from the time he/she leaves his/her home until the time
label: BODY

text: he/she is released from duty, subject to the above stated provisions. This provision does not
label: BODY

text: apply in cases of overtime authorized as an extension of a regular shift.
label: BODY

text: Section 26.6. Shift Differential.
label: HH2

text: The Appointing Authority, at the time of hire, shall designate or assign the
label: BODY

text: applicable shift for each new hire and such assignments shall not abridge the
label: BODY

text: seniority rights of employees. The shift designation shall determine the shift
label: BODY

text: differential for the entire shift. The provisions of this Section apply to full-time and
label: BODY

text: part-time employees.
label: BODY

text: A differential in pay of fifty-two cents ($.52) per hour over the regular hourly rate
label: BODY

text: shall be paid to employees who are assigned to work eight (8) hours on the
label: BODY

text: second shift; a differential of sixty cents ($.60) per hour over the regular hourly
label: BODY

text: rate shall be paid to employees who are assigned to work eight (8) hours on the
label: BODY

text: third shift.
label: BODY

text: Those employees whose regularly assigned shift is a rotating shift shall be paid a
label: BODY

text: shift differential of sixty cents ($.60) per hour over the regular hourly rate for all
label: BODY

text: hours worked regardless of shift.
label: BODY

text: For purposes of computing leave with pay, except for compensatory time, shift
label: BODY

text: differential shall not be paid in addition to regular pay.
label: BODY

text: In those departments, divisions, sections, offices, and programs where only one
label: BODY

text: (1) shift prevails, no differential shall be paid regardless of the hours of the day
label: BODY

text: that are worked.
label: BODY

text: Shift differential pay shall be added to the base hourly rate prior to computing the
label: BODY

text: overtime rate.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who participates in a flextime program shall not qualify for shift
label: BODY

text: differential pay.
label: BODY

text: Section 26.7. Working Out of Classification Pay.
label: HH2

text: Employees in full-time non-seasonal job classifications who are temporarily assigned to a
label: BODY

text: classification with a higher wage rate, will be paid four percent (4%) above the employee's
label: BODY

text: current rate for each hour worked in the higher class upon completing four (4) consecutive
label: BODY

text: hours in the higher class in a workday. Working out of class assignments are not to be used in
label: BODY

text: lieu of seeking approval for filling a vacant position, nor for the sole purpose of paying an
label: BODY

text: employee at a higher class in circumvention of the requirements set forth by the Civil Service
label: BODY

text: Commission.
label: BODY

text: Section 26.8. Service Credit.
label: HH2

text: A service credit payment shall be paid during December of each year to those full-time
label: BODY

text: employees of the City, who are in active service, paid status or authorized leave without pay as
label: BODY

text: of November 30 of each calendar year. The computation of the total years of continuous service
label: BODY

text: as set forth in the following schedule shall be based upon paid status as a full-time employee as
label: BODY

text: of November 30 of the appropriate calendar year. For the sole purpose of determining service
label: BODY

text: credit in this Section 26.9, the years of continuous service in the schedule below shall include
label: BODY

text: military leave without pay, leave without pay due to a City injury when the employee is receiving
label: BODY

text: payments in lieu of wages from the Ohio Bureau of Workers' Compensation, and other
label: BODY

text: administrative leave without pay as authorized by the Appointing Authority for activities
label: BODY

text: connected with City employee relations. No service credit shall be allowed or paid to any
label: BODY

text: employee for time lost for any other leave without pay or time lost as a result of disciplinary
label: BODY

text: action.

text: Section 26.9. Police Communication Technician Training Pay.
label: HH2

text: A full-time employee classified as Police Communication Technician who teaches a class of
label: BODY

text: employees in a classroom setting (e.g. not in the Radio Room) will be paid four percent (4%)
label: BODY

text: above the employee's regular hourly rate for each hour of training. Effective August 1, 2008, a
label: BODY

text: full-time employee classified as Police Communication Technician who instructs new employees
label: BODY

text: will be paid four percent (4%) for each hour of instruction.  The selection of Police
label: BODY

text: Communication Technicians to teach newly hired Police Communication Technicians will be at
label: BODY

text: the sole discretion of the Appointing Authority.

text: Section 26.10. Pay Review Committee.
label: HH2

text: The City and Union agree to recognize the existing Pay Review Committee, comprised of City
label: BODY

text: and Union members, to review pay range inequities resulting in difficulties in recruiting or
label: BODY

text: retaining employees or resulting from classification action taken by the Civil Service
label: BODY

text: Commission. Other inequities may be considered as determined by a consensus of the
label: BODY

text: Committee members or by the Director of the Department of Human Resources.
label: BODY

text: Section 26.11. Perfect Attendance.
label: HH2

text: Each employee who has perfect attendance for a full quarter of a payroll year shall receive one
label: BODY

text: hundred dollars ($100.00) incentive payment for that quarter less taxes and appropriate
label: BODY

text: deductions. Any vacation leave that must be taken or forfeited in accordance with Section 19.3,
label: BODY

text: will not be considered as leave time off when determining perfect attendance for that quarter.
label: BODY

text: Any vacation leave donated in accordance with the Time Donation Program set forth in Article
label: BODY

text: 33 will not be considered as leave time off when determining perfect attendance for that quarter.

label: BODY

text: (48) hours of admission, unless the employee is incapable of
label: BODY

text: communicating with the City due to his/her medical or psychological
label: BODY

text: conditions, or a ten percent (10%) penalty will be applied to total charges
label: BODY

text: in addition to the deductible, co-insurance and out-of-pocket maximum. In
label: BODY

text: the event the care is determined to be medically unnecessary, the
label: BODY

text: employee will be responsible for the cost of all medically unnecessary
label: BODY

text: care.
label: BODY

text: Assigned Length of Stay (Concurrent Review).  Once an elective
label: BODY

text: admission has been pre-certified, a length of stay is assigned. If the
label: BODY

text: hospital stay extends beyond the assigned length of stay, the employee
label: BODY

text: will be responsible for all additional charges of medically unnecessary
label: BODY

text: care, in addition to the deductible, coinsurance and out of pocket
label: BODY

text: maximum. Medically necessary care will constitute justification for
label: BODY

text: certification of a length of stay extension by the City's utilization review
label: BODY

text: administrator.
label: BODY

text: Continued Treatment and Technological Review. These treatments will
label: BODY

text: include:
label: BODY

text: Therapy
label: BODY

text: Physical Therapy
label: BODY

text: Occupational Therapy
label: BODY

text: Advanced Technological Procedures
label: BODY

text: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)
label: BODY

text: Lithotripsy
label: BODY

text: Ultrasound imaging during pregnancy
label: BODY

text: Angioplasty
label: BODY

text: Treatment
label: BODY

text: Chiropractic
label: BODY

text: Podiatric
label: BODY

text: Once the employee's physician informs the employee that it is medically
label: BODY

text: necessary for the employee to receive physical therapy, occupational
label: BODY

text: therapy, chiropractic treatment or podiatric treatment on an ongoing
label: BODY

text: basis, the employee must contact the City's medical utilization review
label: BODY

text: administrator to obtain continued treatment authorization. Also, if the
label: BODY

text: employee's physician instructs the employee to receive any of the listed
label: BODY

text: advanced technological procedures, it is necessary for the employee to
label: BODY

text: contact the City's utilization review administrator to obtain pre-treatment
label: BODY

text: authorization.
label: BODY

text: In the event the employee does not obtain authorization for continued
label: BODY

text: therapy, treatment or technological review, the employee will be
label: BODY

text: responsible for ten percent (10%) of the total charges, in addition to the
label: BODY

text: deductible, coinsurance and out of pocket maximum. In the event the
label: BODY

text: care the employee receives is determined to be medically unnecessary,
label: BODY

text: the employee will be responsible for the cost of all medically unnecessary
label: BODY

text: care.
label: BODY

text: Mandatory Second Surgical Opinion.  For all inpatient and outpatient non-
label: BODY

text: emergency surgeries, a second surgical opinion may be required as
label: BODY

text: directed by the utilization review administrator. This second opinion shall
label: BODY

text: be covered at one hundred percent (100%) of the reasonable charges. If
label: BODY

text: the first two opinions conflict, a third opinion shall also be covered at one
label: BODY

text: hundred percent (100%) of reasonable charges. If a second opinion is not
label: BODY

text: obtained for the surgeries, a ten percent (10%) penalty of total charges
label: BODY

text: shall be applied, in addition to the deductible, coinsurance and out of
label: BODY

text: pocket maximum.
label: BODY

text: Based on medical information obtained prior to the surgery, the City's
label: BODY

text: medical utilization review administrator may waive the mandatory second
label: BODY

text: surgical opinion requirement in specific cases.
label: BODY

text: Medical Case Management.  This program allows a consultant to review
label: BODY

text: an employee's medical treatment plan to determine whether the covered
label: BODY

text: person qualifies for alternate medical care. The determination of eligibility
label: BODY

text: for a patient's medical case management will be primarily based upon
label: BODY

text: medical necessity and appropriate medical care. Recommendations will
label: BODY

text: be made to the family and health care providers. The utilization review
label: BODY

text: administrator will recommend alternate medical treatment on a case-by-
label: BODY

text: case basis. Alternate medical treatment benefits refer to expenses that
label: BODY

text: are approved before they are incurred, which may not otherwise be
label: BODY

text: payable as covered expenses under the medical plan.
label: BODY

text: Planned Discharge Program.  In the event an employee is hospitalized
label: BODY

text: and it is determined that hospitalization is no longer needed, this program
label: BODY

text: allows the patient to receive care in the most medically appropriate
label: BODY

text: setting.
label: BODY

text: Hospital Bill Review.  If an employee reviews his/her hospital bill and
label: BODY

text: discovers overcharges by the provider, he/she will receive fifty percent
label: BODY

text: (50%) of the reimbursed overcharges up to a maximum of $250.00 per
label: BODY

text: employee per confinement, upon verification of such overcharges by the
label: BODY

text: third party administrator.
label: BODY

text: Hold Harmless.  In the event a dispute arises over payment for services
label: BODY

text: provided, the City shall hold harmless an employee or dependent who,
label: BODY

text: prior to receiving such services, has: 1) complied with the requirements
label: BODY

text: and certification of the cost containment program, and 2) verified benefit
label: BODY

text: plan coverage through the third party administrator.

text: Section 27.2. Life Insurance.
label: HH2

text: The City shall maintain term life insurance in the amount of one and one-half
label: BODY

text: times the employee's straight-time hourly rate in effect at the time of death,
label: BODY

text: multiplied by 2,080 hours, or $27,000, whichever is greater, for all full-time
label: BODY

text: employees less than sixty-five (65) years of age. Full-time employees sixty-five
label: BODY

text: (65) to seventy (70) years of age shall receive term life insurance in the amount
label: BODY

text: of either sixty-five percent (65%) of one and one-half times the employee's
label: BODY

text: straight time hourly rate in effect at the time of death multiplied by 2,080 hours, or
label: BODY

text: $17,700, whichever is greater. Full-time employees seventy (70) years of age
label: BODY

text: and over shall receive term life insurance in the amount of either thirty-nine
label: BODY

text: percent (39%) of one and one-half times the employee's hourly rate in effect at
label: BODY

text: the time of death multiplied by 2,080 hours, or $10,530, whichever is greater.
label: BODY

text: Voluntary Universal Life Insurance.  Employees shall be eligible to purchase
label: BODY

text: additional life insurance through payroll deductions. Upon termination,
label: BODY

text: employees will be eligible to continue life insurance coverage at the group rate at
label: BODY

text: their own expense, to the extent permitted by the terms of the City's group plan.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: Trifocal Lenses, up to
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: Frames, up to

text: Section 27.4. Eligibility for Insurance Plans.
label: HH2

text: Full-Time Employees.  Eligibility for enrolling new employees for health
label: BODY

text: insurance, dental insurance, vision care, prescription drug, and term life
label: BODY

text: insurance shall be based upon an employee's active service in a position or
label: BODY

text: employment, which is to be performed in accordance with an established
label: BODY

text: scheduled working time, such schedule to be based upon not less than forty (40)
label: BODY

text: hours per seven (7) consecutive calendar days for fifty-two (52) consecutive
label: BODY

text: seven (7) day periods per annum. Employees shall become eligible for the
label: BODY

text: benefits outlined in Sections 27.1 through 27.5 on the first of the month following
label: BODY

text: their hire date or on the first of the month following the date upon which they
label: BODY

text: complete one (1) year of continuous City service, unless hired on the first of the
label: BODY

text: month, whichever is applicable.
label: BODY

text: Full-time employees may waive coverage in the employee insurance programs
label: BODY

text: during the month of February in each calendar year. Once the waiver is
label: BODY

text: executed, the employee must wait until Open Enrollment Month (February) in a
label: BODY

text: subsequent year to re-enroll in the benefit plans. In the event of a divorce, legal
label: BODY

text: separation, the death of a spouse or the spouse involuntarily loses family
label: BODY

text: coverage through the spouse’s employer, the employee may enroll with the City
label: BODY

text: of Columbus insurance program within thirty (30) days of such event.
label: BODY

text: Full-Time Limited.  Eligibility for enrolling full-time limited employees for medical
label: BODY

text: and prescription insurance coverage only shall be based upon membership in the
label: BODY

text: bargaining unit; and the employee having worked a minimum of 1,040 hours the
label: BODY

text: previous calendar year; and payment of the full established funding rate, which
label: BODY

text: will be converted into a single and family premium. A special enrollment will be
label: BODY

text: held within one hundred twenty (120) days of the effective date of this Contract
label: BODY

text: for employee enrollment. Each year thereafter, enrollment will occur during Open
label: BODY

text: Enrollment Month (February). In the event of a divorce, legal separation, the
label: BODY

text: death of a spouse, or the spouse involuntarily loses family coverage through the
label: BODY

text: spouse's employer, the eligible employee may enroll with the City of Columbus
label: BODY

text: insurance program within thirty (30) days of such event. Upon the completion of
label: BODY

text: two (2) consecutive years and a minimum of 2,080 hours, and every consecutive
label: BODY

text: year thereafter, employees' eligible dependents are eligible to enroll for medical
label: BODY

text: coverage during Open Enrollment Month.
label: BODY

text: Part-Time Regular.  Eligibility for enrolling part-time regular employees for
label: BODY

text: medical and prescription insurance coverage only shall be based upon
label: BODY

text: membership in the bargaining unit; and the employee having worked a minimum
label: BODY

text: of 1,040 hours the previous calendar year; and payment of one-half of the
label: BODY

text: established funding rate, which will be converted into a single and family
label: BODY

text: premium. Enrollment will occur during Open Enrollment Month (February). In the
label: BODY

text: event of a divorce, legal separation, the death of a spouse, or the spouse
label: BODY

text: involuntarily loses family coverage through the spouse's employer, the eligible
label: BODY

text: employee may enroll with the City of Columbus insurance program within thirty
label: BODY

text: (30) days of such event. Upon the completion of two (2) consecutive years and a
label: BODY

text: minimum of 2,080 hours, and every consecutive year thereafter, employees'
label: BODY

text: eligible dependents are eligible to enroll for medical coverage during Open
label: BODY

text: Enrollment Month.
label: BODY

text: Section 27.5. Employee’s Monthly Premiums.
label: HH2

text: The monthly premium for all full-time employees who participate in the City's
label: BODY

text: insurance programs shall be an amount equal to nine percent (9%) of the
label: BODY

text: negotiated insurance base.  The negotiated insurance base shall be the total
label: BODY

text: actual cost to the City of the claims and administrative fees (not to include
label: BODY

text: internal City administrative costs) for medical, dental, vision and prescription
label: BODY

text: drugs for employees in this bargaining unit for the preceding benefit year of
label: BODY

text: February 1 through January 31. The premium will be established as single and
label: BODY

text: family rate. For full-time limited and part-time regular employees who participate
label: BODY

text: in the City’s insurance programs, premiums will be paid pursuant to provisions in
label: BODY

text: Section 27.4.
label: BODY

text: Half of the monthly premium will be deducted each pay period not to exceed the
label: BODY

text: total monthly premium.
label: BODY

text: If an employee elects individual life insurance coverage only, the pre-existing
label: BODY

text: monthly single employee life insurance premium rate to be charged to the
label: BODY

text: employee shall be five dollars and fifty cents ($5.50). Such premiums shall be
label: BODY

text: paid through an automatic payroll deduction.
label: BODY

text: Providing the employee continues monthly premium coverage payments,
label: BODY

text: insurance coverage’s for which the employee is eligible will be extended ninety
label: BODY

text: (90) days beyond the end of the month during which an employee's approved
label: BODY

text: leave without pay or leave of absence status became effective. The employee's
label: BODY

text: insurance will then be terminated with an option to participate in the City's
label: BODY

text: insurance continuation program, COBRA, as defined in Article 2, at the
label: BODY

text: employee's expense.
label: BODY

text: Section 27.6. Pre-Tax Benefits.
label: HH2

text: Full-time employees may choose to participate in a pre-tax Dependent Care and Pre-tax
label: BODY

text: Insurance Premium Program offered by the City or its appointed program administrator.
label: BODY

text: Enrollments will be offered at the time of hire or during an Open Enrollment Month each year.
label: BODY

text: Insurance Premiums.  Each participant who elects to pre-tax the monthly
label: BODY

text: insurance premium must complete the necessary election form, which authorizes
label: BODY

text: the City payroll to pre-tax that premium.
label: BODY

text: Dependent Care Program.  Each participating employee who elects to enroll in
label: BODY

text: the Dependent Care Program will determine an amount to be pre-taxed biweekly
label: BODY

text: through payroll deduction. The annual pre-tax limit, determined by each
label: BODY

text: participant, shall not conflict with IRS limits identified in the Internal Revenue
label: BODY

text: Code.
label: BODY

text: Amendments to the annual pre-tax maximum can only occur during Open
label: BODY

text: Enrollment Month, on the annual plan renewal date or when a change in status
label: BODY

text: occurs.
label: BODY

text: Participants will submit allowable claims to the City's plan administrator.
label: BODY

text: Remittance from the participant's Dependent Care account will be sent directly to
label: BODY

text: each plan participant. Amounts for which a participant does not have an eligible
label: BODY

text: claim will be forfeited at the end of each plan year. These pre-tax plans will
label: BODY

text: remain in effect so long as they continue to be authorized by the Internal
label: BODY

text: Revenue Code.
label: BODY

text: Section 27.7. Appeal Process.
label: HH2

text: The extent of coverage under the insurance policies (including self-insured plans) shall be
label: BODY

text: governed by the terms and conditions set forth in said policies or plans. Any questions or
label: BODY

text: disputes concerning an employee's claim for benefits under said insurance policies or plans
label: BODY

text: shall be resolved in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth in said policies or plans,
label: BODY

text: including the claims appeal process available through the insurance company or third party plan
label: BODY

text: administrator, and shall not be subject to the grievance procedure of this Contract. In the event
label: BODY

text: the employee benefit booklet and negotiated contract are not specific, the plan administrator's
label: BODY

text: administrative guidelines will prevail; provided, however, that this shall not prejudice the right of
label: BODY

text: the employee to appeal a claims dispute to the plan administrator and to the Ohio Department
label: BODY

text: of Insurance.

text: ARTICLE 28 - CONTINUING EDUCATION/TRAINING
label: HH1

text: Section 28.1.
label: HH2

text: Tuition Reimbursement.
label: BODY

text: All full-time employees with one (1) or more years of continuous active service shall be eligible
label: BODY

text: for a reimbursement of instructional fees and laboratory fees of up to one thousand six hundred
label: BODY

text: dollars ($1,600) per calendar year for undergraduate studies or up to two thousand dollars
label: BODY

text: ($2,000) per calendar year for graduate studies voluntarily undertaken by him/her.  Effective
label: BODY

text: January 1, 2009, all full-time employees with one (1) or more years of continuous active service
label: BODY

text: shall be eligible for a reimbursement of instructional fees and laboratory fees of up to three
label: BODY

text: thousand dollars ($3,000) per calendar year for undergraduate studies or up to three thousand
label: BODY

text: six hundred dollars ($3,600) per calendar year for graduate studies voluntarily undertaken by
label: BODY

text: him/her.  The tuition reimbursement program shall be subject to the following conditions:
label: BODY

text: No employee on an unpaid leave of absence, unauthorized leave of absence,
label: BODY

text: disability leave or injury leave may apply for tuition reimbursement.
label: BODY

text: All courses must be taken during other than scheduled working hours. All
label: BODY

text: scheduled hours for courses of instruction must be filed with the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority or his/her designee and with the Department of Human Resources. All
label: BODY

text: courses are subject to approval by the Department of Human Resources. There
label: BODY

text: must be a correlation between the employee's duties and responsibilities or
label: BODY

text: courses that may lead to career advancement within the City and the courses
label: BODY

text: taken or the degree program pursued. All scheduled times of courses must be
label: BODY

text: approved by the Appointing Authority or his/her designee. Any situation which, in
label: BODY

text: the discretion of the Appointing Authority or his/her designee, would require an
label: BODY

text: employee's presence on the job shall take complete and final precedence over
label: BODY

text: any time scheduled for courses.
label: BODY

text: Institutions must be located or courses of instruction given within Franklin County
label: BODY

text: or adjoining counties. If a specific course(s) is not offered at an approved
label: BODY

text: institution within Franklin County or adjoining counties, an approved institution
label: BODY

text: elsewhere in Ohio may be utilized. Courses must be taken at accredited
label: BODY

text: colleges, universities, technical and business institutes or at their established
label: BODY

text: extension centers. Internet courses will be approved on a case-by-case basis.
label: BODY

text: Correspondence courses, seminars, conferences and workshops are not
label: BODY

text: included.
label: BODY

text: The Department of Human Resources shall determine the approved institutions
label: BODY

text: for which reimbursement for instructional fees and laboratory fees may be made
label: BODY

text: under this Section 28.1. Only those institutions approved by the Department of
label: BODY

text: Human Resources shall establish eligibility of the employee to receive
label: BODY

text: reimbursement for instructional fees and laboratory fees. Additional institutions
label: BODY

text: may be added by forwarding an application for reimbursement to the Department
label: BODY

text: of Human Resources. Application for approval of institutions and courses must
label: BODY

text: be made to the Department of Human Resources not more than sixty (60) days
label: BODY

text: or less than ten (10) days prior to the first day of the scheduled course(s).
label: BODY

text: Any financial assistance from any governmental or private agency available to an
label: BODY

text: employee, whether or not applied for and regardless of when such assistance
label: BODY

text: may have been received, shall be deducted in the entire amount from the full
label: BODY

text: tuition reimbursement the employee is eligible for under this Section 28.1. If an
label: BODY

text: employee's tuition is fully covered by another governmental or private agency,
label: BODY

text: then the employee is not entitled to payment from the City.
label: BODY

text: Reimbursement for instructional fees and laboratory fees will be made when the
label: BODY

text: employee satisfactorily completes a course and presents an official certificate or
label: BODY

text: its equivalent and the original of the unpaid invoice from the institution confirming
label: BODY

text: completion of the approved course.
label: BODY

text: No reimbursement will be granted for books, paper, supplies of whatever nature,
label: BODY

text: transportation, meals or any other expense connected with any course except the
label: BODY

text: cost of instructional fees and laboratory fees as outlined in Paragraph (F).
label: BODY

text: Any employee participating in the tuition reimbursement program who resigns or
label: BODY

text: retires or is discharged for cause must repay the tuition reimbursement paid by
label: BODY

text: the City for courses taken less than two (2) years prior to the date of termination
label: BODY

text: or discharge. If necessary, this amount will be deducted from the employee's
label: BODY

text: terminal leave pay or his/her final paycheck.
label: BODY

text: The administration of the tuition reimbursement program will require the
label: BODY

text: Department of Human Resources to be responsible for establishing rules,
label: BODY

text: devising forms and keeping records for the program.
label: BODY

text: Section 28.2. General Educational Development (GED) Program.
label: HH2

text: Each full-time employee with one (1) or more years of continuous City service who successfully
label: BODY

text: completes GED certification shall be eligible for a reimbursement of the examination fee of up to
label: BODY

text: twenty dollars ($20.00) (or any future increase in examination fee that may be approved by the
label: BODY

text: Office of Adult Basic Education, Ohio Department of Education) subject to the following
label: BODY

text: conditions:
label: BODY

text: Any financial assistance from any governmental or private agency available to an
label: BODY

text: employee in pursuit of his/her GED shall be deducted in the entire amount from
label: BODY

text: the examination fee. If an employee's examination fee is fully covered by another
label: BODY

text: governmental or private agency, then the employee is not entitled to payment
label: BODY

text: from the City.
label: BODY

text: Reimbursement of the examination fee will be made when the employee
label: BODY

text: satisfactorily completes the GED examination and presents an official certificate
label: BODY

text: or its equivalent and a receipt of payment confirming completion of the
label: BODY

text: examination.
label: BODY

text: No reimbursement will be granted for books, paper, supplies of whatever nature,
label: BODY

text: transportation, child care, meals or any other expense connected with the GED
label: BODY

text: preparation or examination, except the cost of the examination fee as outlined in
label: BODY

text: (B) above.
label: BODY

text: Time off with pay may be granted, with the approval of the Appointing Authority,
label: BODY

text: for purposes of preparing for the GED examination and for purposes of taking the
label: BODY

text: examination. All scheduled hours for preparatory courses and examination must
label: BODY

text: be filed with the Appointing Authority and with the Department of Human
label: BODY

text: Resources within a reasonable time period. All scheduled times of courses must
label: BODY

text: be approved by the Appointing Authority or designee. Any situation which, at the
label: BODY

text: discretion of the Appointing Authority or designee, would require an employee's
label: BODY

text: presence on the job shall take complete and final precedence over any time
label: BODY

text: scheduled for courses.
label: BODY

text: The administration of the General Educational Development Program will require
label: BODY

text: the Director of the Department of Human Resources or his/her designee to be
label: BODY

text: responsible for establishing rules, devising forms, and keeping records.
label: BODY

text: Section 28.3. Employer-Provided Training Opportunities.
label: HH2

text: Any employee who receives training for a job assignment for which the City incurs costs of more
label: BODY

text: than fifteen hundred dollars ($1,500.00) in any twelve (12)-month period shall remain in that job
label: BODY

text: assignment for a minimum of two (2) years after the completion of such training. The fifteen
label: BODY

text: hundred dollars ($1,500.00) shall include tuition, course fees, travel expenses, per diem, the
label: BODY

text: value of compensated time away from work as well as any overtime paid to the employee while
label: BODY

text: attending such training, and the cost of any specialized equipment which may need to be
label: BODY

text: custom fitted or ordered for the employee to perform such job assignment. If the employee fails
label: BODY

text: to remain in the job assignment for the two (2) year minimum for any reason, except for a
label: BODY

text: promotion within the employee's Department, he/she will be required to repay such training
label: BODY

text: costs. Any amounts due to the City under this pay back requirement shall be deducted from the
label: BODY

text: employee's periodic paychecks (in amounts not to exceed five percent (5%) of gross wages per
label: BODY

text: paycheck). Any amounts still owing in the event of termination of employment shall be deducted
label: BODY

text: from the employee's final pay check or from the employee's terminal leave pay. The employee
label: BODY

text: shall make arrangements for payment of any additional balance due with his/her Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority before his/her last day of employment.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 29 - EQUIPMENT AND CLOTHING
label: HH1

text: Section 29.1.  Uniforms.
label: HH2

text: The uniform policy as detailed below is applicable to the following City departments:
label: BODY

text: Department of Public Safety
label: BODY

text: Department of Public Service
label: BODY

text: Department of Public Utilities
label: BODY

text: Department of Recreation and Parks
label: BODY

text: Department of Technology
label: BODY

text: Department of Development
label: HH3

text: City Treasurer's Office
label: BODY

text: Department of Finance and Management
label: BODY

text: Department of Health
label: BODY

text: The Appointing Authority or designee, in consultation with the Union President,
label: BODY

text: shall establish policies regarding the necessity and types of work uniforms to be
label: BODY

text: made available to employees. The City shall enter into appropriate contracts with
label: BODY

text: vendors to provide items of clothing required under the Appointing Authority's
label: BODY

text: policies. If uniforms are required, employees shall be furnished with a voucher to
label: BODY

text: obtain the appropriate types and quantities.
label: BODY

text: The purchase, fitting, and cleaning of uniforms shall be done outside of work
label: BODY

text: time.
label: BODY

text: Section 29.2. Protective Clothing, Rain Gear, Gloves, and Safety-Type Shoes.
label: HH2

text: The City shall provide an initial issue of rain jacket and rain pants to all City
label: BODY

text: refuse collectors. One pair each of rubber, canvas, and brown jersey gloves will
label: BODY

text: be provided to refuse collectors once every six (6) months.
label: BODY

text: For Divisions other than Refuse Collection, the Appointing Authority or designee,
label: BODY

text: in consultation with the Union President, shall provide to employees, when
label: BODY

text: necessary to perform assigned work duties one or more of the following items:
label: BODY

text: protective clothing, rain gear, gloves and safety-type shoes.
label: BODY

text: When any items issued pursuant to this Section 29.2 are damaged in the course
label: BODY

text: of employment, the damaged gear must first be returned prior to issuing a
label: BODY

text: replacement. If the items issued pursuant to this Section 29.2 are lost or stolen,
label: BODY

text: such items shall not be replaced by the City. Upon termination, all items provided
label: BODY

text: pursuant to this Section 29.2 must be returned to the Appointing Authority or
label: BODY

text: designee.
label: BODY

text: The City shall enter into appropriate contracts with vendors to provide items
label: BODY

text: outlined herein pursuant to voucher arrangements.
label: BODY

text: The purchase, fitting, and cleaning of protective clothing shall be done outside of
label: BODY

text: work time.
label: BODY

text: The City shall provide employees working under hazardous weather conditions
label: BODY

text: as specified in Section 30.12 with the protective, foul weather gear and clothing
label: BODY

text: specified by the Appointing Authority or designee in consultation with the Union
label: BODY

text: as provided herein. The City shall be responsible for continuing to clean such
label: BODY

text: items and shall furnish such items for use by employees under hazardous
label: BODY

text: weather conditions. The employees shall return such items at the end of each
label: BODY

text: day of use during hazardous weather conditions, unless otherwise directed by
label: BODY

text: the Appointing Authority or designee.
label: BODY

text: Section 29.3. Tools and Equipment.
label: HH2

text: The City agrees to furnish all employees, except those specified in Section 29.4 of this Article,
label: BODY

text: with tools and equipment necessary to perform their jobs. Such tools and equipment, as well as
label: BODY

text: the employees who receive the same, shall be determined by the City. The City shall retain
label: BODY

text: ownership of such tools and equipment and the same shall be returned by employees upon
label: BODY

text: their separation from City service. The City agrees to replace any damaged or worn out tools
label: BODY

text: and equipment. However, employees shall be responsible for replacing those items which are
label: BODY

text: lost or stolen through fault of the employee.
label: BODY

text: The parties agree to the following regarding the security of personal tools of employees:
label: BODY

text: Employees will use the “buddy system” (i.e., looking after each other's property
label: BODY

text: while one is away from the work area) during working hours as a safeguard
label: BODY

text: against tool theft.
label: BODY

text: During working hours when the building is not secured and the employee is not
label: BODY

text: on duty, forcible entry into the locked tool box will suffice as evidence of theft.
label: BODY

text: Employees will be responsible for securing personal tools during non-working
label: BODY

text: hours. The City will assume liability for tools stolen during an employee's non-
label: BODY

text: working hours provided forcible entry to either the building or the employee's
label: BODY

text: locked tool box can be shown. A police report must be filed by the employee.
label: BODY

text: Employees will be responsible for maintaining a tool inventory form which will be
label: BODY

text: supplied by the City and updating the inventory as purchases are made. The City
label: BODY

text: will only reimburse for those tools listed on the inventory. Reimbursement for
label: BODY

text: stolen tools will be limited to replacement of the tools stolen with tools of the
label: BODY

text: same brand and value, unless the employee agrees to another brand.
label: BODY

text: Section 29.4. Tool Allowance.
label: HH2

text: The City will credit every employee in the classifications of Auto Mechanic (Light), Auto
label: BODY

text: Mechanic (Heavy), Auto Mechanic Supervisor I, Automotive Body Mechanic and Auto Body
label: BODY

text: Repairer Supervisor on the first day of the calendar month with thirty-five dollars ($35) per
label: BODY

text: month applicable towards the purchase of tools as determined necessary by the employee and
label: BODY

text: the Appointing Authority or designee. This credit will be cumulative and the balance will be
label: BODY

text: forwarded to subsequent calendar years. A universal contract will be entered into by the City
label: BODY

text: providing eligible employees the opportunity to purchase tools under the program.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 30 - MISCELLANEOUS
label: HH1

text: Section 30.1.
label: HH2

text: Gender.
label: BODY

text: Every effort has been made to make the context gender neutral, however unless the context in
label: BODY

text: which they are used clearly requires otherwise, words used in this Contract denoting gender
label: BODY

text: shall be deemed to refer to both the masculine and feminine.
label: BODY

text: Section 30.2.
label: HH2

text: Pay Stub Information.
label: BODY

text: Employees shall be provided with a record of accumulated earned vacation, sick leave and
label: BODY

text: compensatory time on a bi-weekly basis.
label: BODY

text: Section 30.3.
label: HH2

text: Fund Receipts and Disbursements.
label: BODY

text: The City agrees to diligently pursue an administrative policy of eliminating, insofar as possible,
label: BODY

text: the necessity for City employees to handle cash monies. Concentration of the money deposits
label: BODY

text: or payments for all purposes within the Treasurer's Office is strongly recommended. Individual
label: BODY

text: cash drawers and receipt boxes shall be established wherever possible to facilitate
label: BODY

text: establishment of individual responsibility for the handling of funds.
label: BODY

text: Section 30.4. Mileage Allowance.
label: HH2

text: When a City employee uses his/her private car for transportation on any City
label: BODY

text: business, in or out of the City of Columbus, he/she shall be reimbursed for
label: BODY

text: mileage actually traveled on City business. The mileage reimbursement rate shall
label: BODY

text: be equal to the Internal Revenue Service allowable rate for business mileage in
label: BODY

text: effect on each January 1 for the succeeding twelve (12) months for the duration
label: BODY

text: of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: Employees who are regularly required to report directly to job sites away from
label: BODY

text: their City reporting locations are entitled to mileage allowance to the extent such
label: BODY

text: mileage exceeds that from their home to their reporting location. No allowance is
label: BODY

text: payable from the employee's home to or from his/her City reporting location.
label: BODY

text: In order for an employee to be reimbursed for such expenses incurred while on
label: BODY

text: City business, said employee must obtain authorization for such reimbursement
label: BODY

text: from the proper department or division head prior to the use of a privately-owned
label: BODY

text: vehicle for City business. In order to receive timely reimbursement, a form,
label: BODY

text: approved by the Auditor's Office, must be submitted by the employee by the fifth
label: BODY

text: (5th) day of the month, for the preceding month's mileage, to the Department
label: BODY

text: Head.
label: BODY

text: Section 30.5. Comprehensive Physicals and Respiratory Protection.
label: HH2

text: Examinations/Identification Potential Hazardous Working Conditions. The City
label: BODY

text: has the responsibility to provide a safe working environment for all employees. In
label: BODY

text: recognition of this responsibility and in order to provide a means to carry out the
label: BODY

text: same, the City shall continue a program to conduct mandatory comprehensive
label: BODY

text: physical examinations and/or testing in accordance with federal, state, and local
label: BODY

text: laws, including but not limited to Ohio’s Public Employment Risk Reduction
label: BODY

text: Program (O.R.C. Chapter 4167) to determine and identify potential hazardous
label: BODY

text: working conditions and locations. Further, these physical examinations and/or
label: BODY

text: testing will be for the purpose of enabling the City to comply with legal obligations
label: BODY

text: imposed upon it as an employer under applicable federal, state and local laws
label: BODY

text: together with administrative rules and regulations promulgated pursuant thereto,
label: BODY

text: such as, but not limited to, the Public Employment Risk Reduction Program
label: BODY

text: (O.R.C. Chapter 4167).
label: BODY

text: Other than for the purposes specified herein, the data collected during the
label: BODY

text: physical examinations and/or testing shall remain confidential, unless the
label: BODY

text: employee waives such confidentiality in writing.
label: BODY

text: The City shall also continue to offer voluntary physical examinations and testing
label: BODY

text: to all bargaining unit members who have been afforded such examinations/tests
label: BODY

text: in the past.  Employees voluntarily participating in physical examinations and
label: BODY

text: testing will be required to sign a form indicating that the examinations/testing is
label: BODY

text: voluntary.
label: BODY

text: Refusal to submit to a mandatory physical examination and/or testing as required
label: BODY

text: by federal, state and local laws, including but not limited to, Ohio’s Public
label: BODY

text: Employment Risk Reduction Program (O.R.C. Chapter 4167) may be grounds for
label: BODY

text: discipline, up to and including termination.
label: BODY

text: The physical examinations and/or testing shall not in any way be used for
label: BODY

text: alcohol, drug, or substance abuse testing, nor shall the results of examinations
label: BODY

text: and/or testing be used to relieve an employee of duty involuntarily without due
label: BODY

text: process.
label: BODY

text: Respiratory Protection. It is agreed that the City will take the appropriate steps
label: BODY

text: necessary to comply with applicable federal, state, and local laws, including but
label: BODY

text: not limited to Ohio’s Public Employment Risk Reduction Program (O.R.C.
label: BODY

text: Chapter 4167), dealing with respiratory protection. To that end, the City will
label: BODY

text: provide respirators that are applicable and suitable for the purposes intended
label: BODY

text: consistent with applicable provisions of law. Employees shall use the respiratory
label: BODY

text: protection provided in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions, training
label: BODY

text: provided, and all applicable provisions of law. Further, employees will be fit-
label: BODY

text: tested for respirators in order to ensure that a proper facial seal exists as
label: BODY

text: prescribed and mandated by current law. The City will require employees to
label: BODY

text: correct conditions which prevent, impair, or impede a proper facial seal, including
label: BODY

text: but not limited to, a growth of beard, sideburns, any object worn that projects
label: BODY

text: under the facepiece, or temple pieces on glasses. The refusal or failure of any
label: BODY

text: employee, after being advised by management, to take corrective action to
label: BODY

text: remedy those conditions which prevent, impair or impede the proper fit of a
label: BODY

text: respirator may subject such employee to disciplinary action, up to and including
label: BODY

text: termination.
label: BODY

text: Employees who are assigned a respirator must be medically cleared to
label: BODY

text: determine their fitness to wear the respirator, which may require a physical
label: BODY

text: examination. No employee will be assigned a task requiring the use of a
label: BODY

text: respirator unless found physically able to perform the work while wearing the
label: BODY

text: respirator.  Physical examinations to determine medical fitness to where a
label: BODY

text: respirator shall be conducted by a licensed health care professional.
label: BODY

text: Certain provisions of applicable occupational health and safety laws require site
label: BODY

text: and/or job specific policies, procedures and protocols. It is further agreed that the
label: BODY

text: City will promulgate and employees will comply with such site and/or job specific
label: BODY

text: policies, procedures and protocols. Failure of an employee to comply with such
label: BODY

text: policies, procedures and protocols may result in disciplinary action, up to and
label: BODY

text: including termination.
label: BODY

text: Section 30.6. Contract Copies.
label: HH2

text: The City agrees to equally share the cost of printing the Contract with AFSCME Local 1632.
label: BODY

text: Section 30.7. Operational Changes.
label: HH2

text: Should the City intend to institute any new methods of operation that would result
label: BODY

text: in a material change in the essential functions of a job presently being done by
label: BODY

text: employees covered by this Contract, the City shall meet with the Union at the
label: BODY

text: earliest possible time but not later than thirty (30) days prior to the
label: BODY

text: implementation of such intended changes and/or methods of operations; extreme
label: BODY

text: emergencies excluded.
label: BODY

text: Prior to the effective date of implementation, upon written request by the Union, a
label: BODY

text: joint conference shall be scheduled for the purpose of discussion with respect to
label: BODY

text: the following subjects: transfer to comparable work, retraining for transferred
label: BODY

text: employees or the disposition of displaced employees resulting from the institution
label: BODY

text: of such new methods, machinery or equipment.
label: BODY

text: Section 30.8. Errors and Omissions Policy.
label: HH2

text: It is the policy of the City to cover employees for errors and omissions by such employees while
label: BODY

text: performing duties within the scope of their employment by the City.
label: BODY

text: Section 30.9. Application of Contract to Part-Time Employees.
label: HH2

text: Except as otherwise specifically provided elsewhere in this Contract, part-time employees in the
label: BODY

text: bargaining unit shall not be eligible for any fringe benefits under this Contract (other than
label: BODY

text: specifically noted), including but not limited to sick leave, other leaves of absence, holidays,
label: BODY

text: vacations, service credit, and tuition reimbursement.
label: BODY

text: Section 30.10. Employee Address.
label: HH2

text: Employees shall provide their payroll clerk or other individual designated by the Appointing
label: BODY

text: Authority with their correct current name, home address, and home telephone number (if any),
label: BODY

text: and shall update this information with their payroll clerk to keep it current at all times.
label: BODY

text: Section 30.11. Employee Assistance Program.
label: HH2

text: The City and the Union recognize the significance of employees' personal problems and the
label: BODY

text: effect those problems may have on personal well being and productivity. The City and the Union
label: BODY

text: agree to utilize the City's Employee Assistance Program to refer employees with potential
label: BODY

text: problems to the appropriate assistance program. Employees referred to the EAP will be granted
label: BODY

text: up to a maximum of three (3) free visits per calendar year to the EAP for assessment, referral
label: BODY

text: and follow-up without being charged with time off.
label: BODY

text: Professional assistance should be encouraged and sought by employees with
label: BODY

text: problems related to stress, substance abuse, mental or emotional illness,
label: BODY

text: finances, legal issues or family crisis; however, employee participation shall be
label: BODY

text: strictly voluntary.
label: BODY

text: Employees participating in this program should be made aware that treatment
label: BODY

text: records may be maintained and such records shall remain confidential.
label: BODY

text: All employees receiving treatment shall remain in paid status, until the
label: BODY

text: employee's accrued vacation and sick leave credits are exhausted. After the
label: BODY

text: exhaustion of these benefits, the City may, at its option, advance sick leave
label: BODY

text: through a pay back arrangement. Should termination occur, sick days borrowed
label: BODY

text: shall be repaid from wages and benefits due at the time of termination.
label: BODY

text: The City's designated disciplinary hearing officer may order an employee to EAP
label: BODY

text: as part of a disciplinary order.
label: BODY

text: Section 30.12. Hazardous Weather Conditions.
label: HH2

text: In cases of severe wind, rain or electrical storms, severe temperatures/wind chill factors or
label: BODY

text: severe snowstorms and ice blanketing, no employee shall be unnecessarily compelled to work
label: BODY

text: under conditions, which involve a physical risk to his/her health and personal safety. In the
label: BODY

text: event the Union believes employees are being compelled to work under such conditions, the
label: BODY

text: Local Union President or designee has the right to discuss the matter with the Director of the
label: BODY

text: Department of Human Resources or designee. However, such discussion shall not affect the
label: BODY

text: City's rights under this Section 30.12. If, after such discussion, the City maintains that
label: BODY

text: employees should work under such conditions, the City shall provide such employees with the
label: BODY

text: protective, foul weather gear and clothing as provided in Section 29.2(F).
label: BODY

text: Section 30.13. Effect of Article and Section Headings.
label: HH2

text: The article and section headings contained in this Contract are included only for convenience of
label: BODY

text: reference and do not define, limit, explain or modify this Contract or its interpretation,
label: BODY

text: construction or implementation.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 31 - RELATION TO OTHER LAWS AND SEPARABILITY
label: HH1

text: Section 31.1. Savings Clause.
label: HH2

text: If any article, section or appendix of this Contract should be held illegal by operation of law or by
label: BODY

text: any tribunal of competent jurisdiction; or if compliance with or enforcement of any article or
label: BODY

text: section should be restrained by such tribunal pending a final determination as to its legality, the
label: BODY

text: remainder of this Contract or the application of such article, section or appendix to persons or
label: BODY

text: circumstances other than those as to which it has been held illegal or as to which compliance
label: BODY

text: with, or enforcement of, has been restrained, shall not be affected. It is understood by the
label: BODY

text: parties that nothing in this Contract shall be deemed to conflict with Federal laws, and the
label: BODY

text: Constitutions of the State of Ohio and the United States of America.
label: BODY

text: Section 31.2. Negotiations.
label: HH2

text: In the event any article, section or appendix is declared illegal, this Contract shall
label: BODY

text: be reopened on such article, section or appendix. The City’s Chief Negotiator
label: BODY

text: and the Union shall meet within thirty (30) calendar days for the purpose of
label: BODY

text: negotiating a lawful alternate provision. However, such negotiations shall not
label: BODY

text: affect the enforcement or validity of any other provision of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: No ordinance or resolutions dealing with negotiated wages, hours, and terms and
label: BODY

text: conditions of employment shall be submitted to City Council or to the Board of
label: BODY

text: Health until negotiated and approved by the City and the Union with the
label: BODY

text: exception of those classifications in a federally funded program wherein the
label: BODY

text: imposition of federal constraints negate the bargaining process.
label: BODY

text: Section 31.3. Effect of Subsequently-Enacted Legislation.
label: HH2

text: It is agreed that, in the event the Ohio General Assembly or the United States Congress passes
label: BODY

text: legislation which becomes law and which affects the City of Columbus and this Contract, the
label: BODY

text: Contract can be reopened only for purposes of amending said Contract to conform to such law
label: BODY

text: or laws. Either party hereto shall have the right to call for a reopening of the Contract under
label: BODY

text: such circumstances by giving notice to the other party in writing; said notice may be given at
label: BODY

text: any time after such legislation is signed into law and prior to the effective date of such law or
label: BODY

text: laws. Such negotiations shall commence within ten (10) days after written notification.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 32 - ENTIRE AGREEMENT/MID-TERM MODIFICATIONS
label: HH1

text: Section 32.1. Entire Agreement/Precedence of Agreement.
label: HH2

text: This Contract, upon ratification, supersedes all prior practices and agreements, whether written
label: BODY

text: or oral, unless expressly stated to the contrary herein, and constitutes the complete and entire
label: BODY

text: agreement between the parties, and concludes collective bargaining for its term. Therefore,
label: BODY

text: except as provided in Articles 31 and 32, the parties, for the duration of this Contract, each
label: BODY

text: voluntarily waives the right and obligation to bargain collectively with respect to any subject
label: BODY

text: covered by this Contract. This Contract is not intended, however, to render null and void prior
label: BODY

text: arbitration, judicial and applicable administrative agency decisions involving the parties to the
label: BODY

text: extent that such decisions involve contract language which remains unchanged and to the
label: BODY

text: extent that the governing law involved in such judicial and administrative agency decisions
label: BODY

text: remains unchanged.
label: BODY

text: Section 32.2. Changes in Conditions of Employment Which Are Not Specifically
label: HH2

text: Established by Contract.
label: HH1

text: Any term and/or conditions of employment not specifically established by this Contract shall
label: BODY

text: remain within the discretion of the City to modify, establish or eliminate; provided, however, that
label: BODY

text: no such determination shall be implemented prior to consultation with the Union, as provided
label: BODY

text: below in Subsections (A) and (B):
label: BODY

text: Changes in Mandatory Subjects Not Specifically Established by Contract.  The
label: BODY

text: parties agree the City may implement changes in terms and conditions of
label: BODY

text: employment during the term of the Contract where the subject matter of the
label: BODY

text: change is a mandatory subject of bargaining under Ohio Revised Code (ORC),
label: BODY

text: Chapter 4117, and where the Contract does not expressly address the subject
label: BODY

text: matter of the change after giving the Union notice of the proposed change and a
label: BODY

text: reasonable opportunity to bargain about it. In the event the parties do not reach
label: BODY

text: an agreement about the proposed change, the parties agree that the Union may
label: BODY

text: choose to grieve the matter to arbitration pursuant to the arbitration provisions of
label: BODY

text: Section 11.5(D). The City will not implement its proposed change until the
label: BODY

text: arbitrator issues an award, unless the Union chooses not to grieve in which case
label: BODY

text: the City may implement its final proposal.
label: BODY

text: Changes in Permissive Subjects Not Specifically Established by Contract.  It is
label: BODY

text: further agreed that this bargaining obligation referenced in Subsection (A) above
label: BODY

text: does not apply to any change which does not constitute a mandatory subject of
label: BODY

text: bargaining under ORC Chapter 4117. The City retains complete discretion to
label: BODY

text: modify, establish or eliminate any term or condition of employment which is not
label: BODY

text: expressly addressed in the parties' Contract. If the City intends to modify,
label: BODY

text: establish or eliminate any term or condition of employment which is not expressly
label: BODY

text: addressed in the parties' Contract, and which is not a mandatory subject of
label: BODY

text: bargaining under ORC Chapter 4117, the City may do so after consultation with
label: BODY

text: the Union. The City also shall comply with the posting and notification
label: BODY

text: requirements set forth in Article 8 of the Contract, when applicable. If the Union
label: BODY

text: disagrees with the change in terms and conditions of employment after the City
label: BODY

text: implements it, the Union may choose to grieve the reasonableness of the
label: BODY

text: implemented term or condition of employment under the grievance procedure of
label: BODY

text: the Contract.
label: BODY

text: Section 32.3. Changes in Conditions of Employment Which Are Specifically Established
label: HH2

text: by Contract.
label: HH1

text: The parties may, by mutual agreement, reopen negotiations to expand, clarify, modify or amend
label: BODY

text: provisions of this Contract. In order to amend the Contract, the party proposing the amendment
label: BODY

text: shall identify to the other party the specific section(s) of the Contract to be reopened. Except as
label: BODY

text: stated in other sections of this Contract, neither party shall be obligated to agree to reopen the
label: BODY

text: Contract.
label: BODY

text: In addition to reopening this Contract for the purpose of amendment, the parties may enter into
label: BODY

text: written memoranda of understanding that define, clarify, interpret or construe the meaning of
label: BODY

text: specific contract sections. Such memoranda of understanding shall not be valid until signed by
label: BODY

text: the City’s Chief Negotiator or designee and appropriate Union officials. Such memoranda of
label: BODY

text: understanding cease to exist at the date stated therein or the expiration of the current contract
label: BODY

text: (whichever is less) unless the parties specifically incorporate them by reference into the
label: BODY

text: successor contract. Any action taken by the Civil Service Commission which would change
label: BODY

text: Appendix A of this Contract shall be accomplished by a memorandum of understanding.
label: BODY

text: Neither party hereto shall attempt to achieve the alteration of this Contract by recommending
label: BODY

text: changes in, additions to or deletions from ordinances or resolutions of the Columbus City
label: BODY

text: Council.
