text: ARTICLE 33 – TIME DONATION PROGRAM
label: HH1

text: Section 33.1. Purpose.
label: HH2

text: Effective ninety (90) days after the effective date of this Contract, a time donation program will
label: BODY

text: be established to assist full-time employees, eligible to earn accruals, who have exhausted all
label: BODY

text: accumulated paid leave and all disability leave benefits available as a result of a catastrophic
label: BODY

text: illness or injury that is not job related. This program neither supersedes nor replaces other
label: BODY

text: disability programs covered by this Contract.
label: BODY

text: Section 33.2. Conditions.
label: HH2

text: An employee may utilize the time donation program only if all of the following conditions are
label: BODY

text: met:
label: BODY

text: Prior to requesting approval for donation of vacation leave, the employee
label: BODY

text: must have exhausted all paid leave and disability leave benefits available to
label: BODY

text: him/her; and
label: BODY

text: The employee shall submit an application requesting donation of vacation
label: BODY

text: leave from other bargaining unit employees in the same division to the
label: BODY

text: Director of the Department of Human Resources or designee. The application
label: BODY

text: shall include acceptable medical documentation of a catastrophic illness or
label: BODY

text: injury that is not job related, including diagnosis and prognosis. The injury or
label: BODY

text: long-term illness must require the employee to be away from work for at least
label: BODY

text: one (1) full pay period. This application shall be on a form mutually agreed to
label: BODY

text: by the City and the Union; and
label: BODY

text: The Director of the Department of Human Resources or designee shall
label: BODY

text: determine that the injury or long-term illness is catastrophic in nature and that
label: BODY

text: the employee is eligible to receive vacation leave donations from other
label: BODY

text: bargaining unit employees in the same division.  If an employee works in a
label: BODY

text: division with fewer than forty (40) employees in the bargaining unit, the City
label: BODY

text: would consider donations from employees from outside the division, but
label: BODY

text: inside the department; and
label: BODY

text: The approved application shall be forwarded to Local 1632. The Local shall
label: BODY

text: post a notice on the Union bulletin boards to other bargaining unit employees
label: BODY

text: in the same division that the eligible employee may receive donations of
label: BODY

text: vacation leave; and
label: BODY

text: If the eligible employee is in a probationary period, the probation will be
label: BODY

text: extended by the number of days the employee is off duty receiving leave
label: BODY

text: donations. The Civil Service Commission must be notified of an extension of
label: BODY

text: any probationary period; and
label: BODY

text: Donated leave shall be considered sick leave but shall never be converted
label: BODY

text: into a cash benefit.
label: BODY

text: Section 33.3. Employees Donating Vacation Time.
label: HH2

text: An employee desiring to donate vacation leave shall submit a completed time
label: BODY

text: donation form to the Division payroll office.
label: BODY

text: It is understood that all vacation leave donations are voluntary and once
label: BODY

text: vacation leave is donated, it will not be returned to the donating employee.
label: BODY

text: All donated vacation leave shall be paid at the regular hourly rate of the
label: BODY

text: employee receiving and using the donated leave, not at the regular hourly
label: BODY

text: rate of the employee donating the leave.
label: BODY

text: Vacation leave may be donated in increments of at least four (4) hours.
label: BODY

text: This is a completely voluntary program. A decision made by the City regarding implementation,
label: BODY

text: acceptance or rejection of an application for donations shall be final and the same shall not be
label: BODY

text: subject to the grievance and arbitration procedure.
label: BODY

text: ARTICLE 34 - DURATION OF CONTRACT
label: BODY

text: This Contract signed on _____________, shall be effective as of April 1, 2008, and shall remain in full force
label: BODY

text: and effect through March 31, 2011 unless either party gives written notice to the other of its intent to terminate
label: BODY

text: or modify at least one hundred twenty (120) days prior to its expiration date.

label: BODY

text: The City of Columbus and AFSCME, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632, enter into this Memorandum of
label: BODY

text: Understanding (hereinafter referred to as MOU) and agree that the following provisions shall be enacted for
label: BODY

text: employees of the Division of Fleet Management working at the Groves Road Facility in the job classifications
label: BODY

text: known as Automotive Mechanic Heavy (AMH), Automotive Partskeeper (ATP), and Automotive Mechanic
label: BODY

text: Helper (AHLP).
label: BODY

text: HOURS OF WORK
label: HH2

text: The normal workweek for those classifications covered by this MOU shall consist of four (4) ten (10) hour
label: BODY

text: workdays to be worked within the seven (7) day workweek and in accordance with the schedules herein. Each
label: BODY

text: employee will have three (3) scheduled days off during each workweek under the terms of this MOU. Per the
label: BODY

text: appended schedules, the three (3) scheduled days off will be either three (3) consecutive days off or two (2)
label: BODY

text: consecutive days off with the third scheduled day off occurring elsewhere during the workweek.
label: BODY

text: The following work schedules are appended to this MOU to illustrate the anticipated schedules to be assigned
label: BODY

text: to the affected employees. Under the terms of this MOU, management retains the right to apportion staff to any
label: BODY

text: of the anticipated work schedules.
label: BODY

text: DISABILITY LEAVE PROCEDURES
label: HH2

text: All full-time employees working four (4) ten (10) hour shifts shall be eligible to participate in the
label: BODY

text: City’s disability leave program as provided in Article 21 of the Contract, provided however that
label: BODY

text: any ten (10) hour employee deemed to be on said disability leave program shall receive a
label: BODY

text: payment of 81% of said employee’s gross wage under the following formula:
label: BODY

text: The employee’s gross wages shall be computed on a forty (40) hour workweek for
label: BODY

text: each full week in which an employee is off work.
label: BODY

text: The employee shall receive a payment of 81% of his gross wages based upon said
label: BODY

text: forty (40) hour workweek for each full week in which an employee is off work.
label: BODY

text: For any partial week in which an employee is on the disability leave program, said
label: BODY

text: employee shall receive a payment of 81% of his gross wages, under the above-
label: BODY

text: noted formula, pro-rated to the numbers of hours said employee is off work during
label: BODY

text: his regularly scheduled workweek.
label: BODY

text: HOLIDAY SCHEDULE
label: HH2

text: The provisions contained in Article 17 of the Contract shall govern the eligibility and use of
label: BODY

text: holiday pay for those employees covered within this MOU, unless specifically indicated below.
label: BODY

text: If the holiday falls on the first or second regularly scheduled day off, the holiday shall
label: BODY

text: be observed on the day preceding the first regularly scheduled day off.
label: BODY

text: If the holiday falls on the third regularly scheduled day off, the holiday shall be
label: BODY

text: observed on the following work day.
label: BODY

text: An employee under this MOU working a four (4) ten (10) hour shift and who works on
label: BODY

text: a day celebrated as a holiday shall be paid at the rate of time and one-half (1-1/2) for
label: BODY

text: all hours worked, in addition to any holiday pay for which the employee is eligible.
label: BODY

text: When taking a birthday holiday, an employee under this MOU shall be paid ten (10)
label: BODY

text: hours of holiday pay.
label: BODY

text: Memorandum of Understanding #2008-01 (revised May 2008)
label: HH1

text: City/AFSCME 1632
label: HH1

text: Page 3 of 4
label: HH1

text: SHIFT DIFFERENTIAL
label: HH2

text: Shift differential eligibility and pay will be administered pursuant to Section 26.6 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: The applicable shift differential rate will be paid over and above the regular hourly
label: BODY

text: rate to employees who are assigned to work ten (10) hours on the second shift and
label: BODY

text: the applicable shift differential rate will be paid over and above the regular hourly rate
label: BODY

text: to employees who are assigned to work ten (10) hours on the third shift. The
label: BODY

text: applicable shift differential rate will be the negotiated rate as provided in the
label: BODY

text: Contract.
label: BODY

text: For purposes of this section, an employee is considered to be on the first shift if the
label: BODY

text: majority of their hours worked fall between 7:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m. An employee is
label: BODY

text: considered to be on the second shift if the majority of their hours worked fall between
label: BODY

text: 3:00 p.m. and 11:00 p.m. An employee is considered to be on the third shift if the
label: BODY

text: majority of their hours worked fall between 11:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m.
label: BODY

text: VACATION LEAVE
label: HH2

text: An employee’s vacation leave accrual and/or usage shall be in accordance with the provisions
label: BODY

text: contained in Article 19 of the Contract. An employee who requests and is granted a vacation
label: BODY

text: day off for a day on which he is scheduled to work a four (4) ten (10) hour shift shall be charged
label: BODY

text: ten (10) hours of vacation pay for said day off.  For vacation leave of less than one (1) full work
label: BODY

text: day, an employee shall be charged in increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all
label: BODY

text: time on vacation during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: SICK LEAVE ENTITLEMENT
label: HH2

text: Sick leave entitlement and usage shall be administered for employees covered by this MOU in
label: BODY

text: accordance with the provisions contained in Article 20 of the Contract. For each ten (10) hours
label: BODY

text: of regularly scheduled work from which an employee is absent, sick leave with pay shall be
label: BODY

text: used at the rate of ten (10) hours.  For sick leave of less than one (1) full work day, an employee
label: BODY

text: shall be charged increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on sick leave
label: BODY

text: during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: PERSONAL BUSINESS DAY
label: HH2

text: Personal business day entitlement and usage shall be administered in accordance with the
label: BODY

text: provisions of Article 18 of the Contract. Employees will be required to supplement the eight (8)
label: BODY

text: hour personal business day with two (2) hours of vacation leave or compensatory time in order
label: BODY

text: to be paid for a ten (10) hour workday.
label: BODY

text: This MOU remains in full force and effect until March 31, 2011 unless either party gives written

text: notice to the other of its intent to terminate this MOU at least thirty (30) days prior to its
label: BODY

text: termination date.

text: Regarding OPERATORS IN TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION INCENTIVE
label: BODY

text: Pursuant to Sections 26.10 and 32.3 of the Collective Bargaining Contract between the City of
label: BODY

text: Columbus and the American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees, Ohio
label: BODY

text: Council 8, Local 1632, the parties hereby agree to amend Appendix A of the Collective
label: BODY

text: Bargaining Contract dated April 1, 2008 - March 31, 2011, as follows:
label: BODY

text: Class Code
label: HH1

text: Classification
label: BODY

text: Pay Range
label: BODY

text: Operator In Training
label: BODY

text: Further, the parties agree to modify the contract for employees in the classification of Operator
label: BODY

text: In Training, Wastewater Plant Operator, Water Plant Operator I, and Wastewater Plant
label: BODY

text: Supervisor I as follows:
label: BODY

text: TRAINING FOR THE CERTIFICATION
label: HH2

text: An Operator In Training (OIT) will be provided with Operator Training Committee of Ohio
label: BODY

text: (OTCO) Water I or Wastewater I course in a correspondence format and will be provided the
label: BODY

text: materials at no cost to the employee.
label: BODY

text: Study time will be incorporated into the eight (8) hour day for employees in the OIT
label: BODY

text: classification.
label: BODY

text: ON THE JOB TRAINING
label: HH2

text: Rotation of OITs within each of the plant sections during the probationary period will be done so
label: BODY

text: that knowledge and competence is developed and maintained by the employee.  All plant staff
label: BODY

text: are required to demonstrate equipment and explain procedures to any and all employees as
label: BODY

text: directed by management.
label: BODY

text: OPERATOR CERTIFICATION EXAMINATION
label: HH2

text: An OIT is required to do the following:
label: BODY

text: An OIT will successfully complete the OTCO correspondence course within one
label: BODY

text: (1) year of appointment and receive a score of 70% or greater;
label: BODY

text: An OIT will take the Wastewater Works Operator Class I or Public Water System
label: BODY

text: Operator I certification exam, at least once, during the probationary period;
label: BODY

text: An OIT must take all Wastewater Works Operator Class I or Public Water
label: BODY

text: System Operator I certification exams administered after the one (1) year
label: BODY

text: anniversary date until passing.
label: BODY

text: Failure to meet one or more of the above standards may result in termination of
label: BODY

text: the employee.
label: BODY

text: Memorandum of Understanding #2007-01 (revised May 2008)
label: HH1

text: City/AFSCME 1632
label: HH1

text: Page 2 of 4
label: HH1

text: An OIT must obtain and maintain his/her Class 1 certification within twenty-four (24)
label: BODY

text: months of date of hire or a disciplinary hearing will be held that will result in termination.
label: BODY

text: OVERTIME
label: HH1

text: Overtime will be set up on a hierarchy in wastewater treatment plants, consistent with Section
label: BODY

text: 16.4 of the contract, with OITs not being eligible for overtime until they have successfully
label: BODY

text: completed the on-the-job training curriculum.  After completion of the on-the-job training
label: BODY

text: program, OITs will be eligible for authorized overtime within the Wastewater Plant Operator
label: BODY

text: classification that is called in the following order:
label: BODY

text: Wastewater Plant Operators will be offered first.
label: BODY

text: OITs will be offered second.
label: BODY

text: Wastewater Plant Supervisor Is will be offered third.
label: BODY

text: OITs, once trained in specific process areas, will be used to fill in for operator vacancies prior to
label: BODY

text: authorizing overtime.  An OIT filling in for a Wastewater Plant Operator shall not constitute a
label: BODY

text: working out of classification assignment.
label: BODY

text: Overtime will be set up on a hierarchy in water treatment plants for overtime within the Water
label: BODY

text: Plant Operator I classification in the following order:
label: BODY

text: Water Plant Operator Is will be offered first.
label: BODY

text: OITs will be offered second.
label: BODY

text: OITs working in a water treatment plant must have the appropriate laboratory certification (full or
label: BODY

text: operational) required by the City of Columbus before being eligible for overtime as a Water
label: BODY

text: Plant Operator I.  An OIT filling in for a Water Plant Operator I shall not constitute a working out
label: BODY

text: of classification assignment.
label: BODY

text: PROMOTION
label: HH1

text: An OIT may be promoted to the Wastewater Plant Operator or Water Plant Operator I
label: BODY

text: classification(s) after the following four (4) conditions are met:
label: BODY

text: An OIT has obtained the Class I certification; AND
label: BODY

text: An OIT has worked at the plant for one (1) year; AND
label: BODY

text: An OIT in Water must have the appropriate laboratory certification (full or
label: BODY

text: operational) as required by the OEPA; AND
label: BODY

text: Satisfaction of all Civil Service and Department of Public Utilities’ rules, policies
label: BODY

text: and procedures.
label: BODY

text: Memorandum of Understanding #2007-01 (revised May 2008)
label: HH1

text: City/AFSCME 1632
label: HH1

text: Page 3 of 4
label: HH1

text: A leave of absence from the OIT to accept an appointment to another classification will not be
label: BODY

text: granted.
label: BODY

text: SHIFT SELECTION
label: HH2

text: At the time of initial appointment, the OIT will be assigned to a shift by management.
label: BODY

text: Once an OIT has completed all of the requirements to be an operator as stated in the
label: BODY

text: “PROMOTION” section above, the OIT’s shift will be bid per Section 13.3 of the collective
label: BODY

text: bargaining agreement.
label: BODY

text: If, during the course of the shift bidding process a more senior Water Plant Operator I or
label: BODY

text: Wastewater Plant Operator requests the OIT’s shift through the seniority transfer process, the
label: BODY

text: OIT will then be required to accept the shift remaining after the bid process is complete.  This
label: BODY

text: may result in the OIT being transferred to another shift and/or another plant.
label: BODY

text: CERTIFICATION INCENTIVE
label: HH2

text: Incentive pay for certifications beyond what is required by the classification specification will be
label: BODY

text: provided for each hour worked.  Effective with the first payperiod following passage of the 2008-
label: BODY

text: 2011 Collective Bargaining Agreement by City Council, employees will receive the incentive
label: BODY

text: based on hours in paid status as follows:
label: BODY

text: Classification
label: BODY

text: Certification Required
label: BODY

text: Incentive Provided
label: BODY

text: Wastewater Plant Operator
label: BODY

text: Wastewater Works Operator Class I/Class II      $0.25
label: BODY

text: Wastewater Plant Operator
label: BODY

text: Wastewater Works Operator Class I/Class III     $0.50
label: BODY

text: Wastewater Plant Supervisor I Wastewater Works Operator Class II/Class III     $0.25
label: BODY

text: Water Plant Operator I
label: BODY

text: Public Water System Operator I/Class II
label: BODY

text: Water Plant Operator I
label: BODY

text: Public Water System Operator I/Class III
label: BODY

text: Incentive pay will be effective the first payperiod following notice of certification.
label: BODY

text: Employees who are receiving an incentive and fail to maintain a valid certification shall notify
label: BODY

text: plant management within one (1) working day of loss of such certification.
label: BODY

text: Certifications will be verified at least once per year by the Human Resources Section of the
label: BODY

text: Department of Public Utilities working in conjunction with Plant Management.
label: BODY

text: For purposes of this paragraph, “grandparented” applies only to Wastewater Plant Operators
label: BODY

text: who were hired prior to the Civil Service requirement of possessing an EPA certification (June
label: BODY

text: 27, 2005).  Employees who were not grandparented into the classification and fail to maintain
label: BODY

text: Memorandum of Understanding #2007-01 (revised May 2008)

text: City/AFSCME 1632

text: Page 4 of 4
label: HH1

text: the required certification for their class will have a disciplinary hearing scheduled that will result
label: BODY

text: in termination.  Employees who are grandparented into the classification, obtain the certification
label: BODY

text: and then subsequently fail to maintain certification will only lose the incentive pay (i.e., the
label: BODY

text: incentive for each hour worked will discontinue being paid).
label: BODY

text: DURATION
label: HH2

text: This MOU may be terminated by either party giving to the other party thirty (30) days prior
label: BODY

text: written notice, but shall not extend beyond March 31, 2011.

text: REGARDING CRIME LABORATORY 4X10 HOUR SCHEDULE
label: BODY

text: The City of Columbus and AFSCME, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632, hereby agree to the following
label: BODY

text: provisions being enacted for the employees of the Department of Public Safety, Division of
label: BODY

text: Police, Crime Laboratory, in the position of Forensic Scientist I, with more than six (6) months
label: BODY

text: continuous employment.  Unless specifically amended by this Memorandum of Understanding
label: BODY

text: (hereinafter referred to as MOU), all wages, hours and terms of conditions of employment shall
label: BODY

text: be administered in accordance with the Collective Bargaining Contract (hereinafter referred to
label: BODY

text: as the Contract).
label: BODY

text: HOURS OF WORK
label: HH2

text: The normal workweek shall consist of four (4) ten (10) hour days.  For purposes of overtime,
label: BODY

text: calculations will be based on a workweek of a Sunday through Saturday schedule.  Each
label: BODY

text: employee shall be assigned with days off consisting of F/S/S or S/S/M.  Management shall
label: BODY

text: determine the number of employees to be assigned with designated days off.  Duty hours will
label: BODY

text: begin no earlier than 6:00 am and no later than 9:00 am and will continue for 10 ½ hours.
label: BODY

text: HOLIDAY PAY
label: HH2

text: The provisions contained in Article 17 of the Contract shall govern the eligibility and
label: BODY

text: usage of holiday pay for those employees covered herein unless specifically changed
label: BODY

text: hereunder.
label: BODY

text: In accordance with Section 17.9, the Appointing Authority shall adjust the workweek
label: BODY

text: schedule for a holiday week.  The workweek will consist of five (5) eight (8) hour
label: BODY

text: workdays, and the employee will receive eight (8) hours of holiday pay.
label: BODY

text: DISABILITY LEAVE PROCEDURES
label: HH2

text: All employees working ten (10) hour days shall be eligible to participate in the City’s disability
label: BODY

text: leave program as provided in Article 21 of the Contract, provided however, that a ten (10) hour
label: BODY

text: employee on approved disability leave shall receive 81% of his/her gross wage under the
label: BODY

text: following formula:
label: BODY

text: The employee’s gross wage shall be computed on a forty (40) hour workweek for
label: BODY

text: each full week in which an employee is off work.
label: BODY

text: The employee shall receive 81% of his/her gross wage based upon said forty (40)
label: BODY

text: hour workweek for each full week the employee is off work.
label: BODY

text: MOU #2006-06 (revised May 2008)
label: HH1

text: City/AFSCME
label: HH3

text: Crime Laboratory
label: HH1

text: Page 2
label: HH3

text: For any partial week in which an employee is on the disability program, the employee
label: BODY

text: shall receive 81% of his/her gross wage, under the above noted formula prorated to
label: BODY

text: the number of hours the employee is off work due to disability during his/her regularly
label: BODY

text: scheduled workweek
label: BODY

text: VACATION LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Any employee who requests and is granted a vacation day off for any day on which
label: BODY

text: he/she is scheduled to work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of
label: BODY

text: vacation leave for said day off.  For vacation leaves of less than one (1) full workday, an
label: BODY

text: employee shall be charged in increments of one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time off during
label: BODY

text: any shift.
label: BODY

text: The Bureau Commander or his/her designee shall determine the number of employees
label: BODY

text: allowed on scheduled vacation at any one time.  Vacations shall be bid by seniority in
label: BODY

text: accordance with the Contract.
label: BODY

text: SICK LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Sick leave usage shall be administered in accordance with the provisions of Article 20 of the
label: BODY

text: Contract with the following modifications:
label: BODY

text: For each ten (10) hours of regular work from which an employee is absent, sick leave
label: BODY

text: shall be used at the rate of ten (10) hours.  For sick leave of less than one (1) full
label: BODY

text: workday, an employee shall be charged in increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10)
label: BODY

text: hour for all time on sick leave during any shift.
label: BODY

text: OVERTIME ELIGIBILITY AND PAY
label: HH2

text: Overtime eligibility and pay for the purposes of determining weekly overtime as provided
label: BODY

text: in Section 16.3(B) and (C) shall be calculated on a Sunday through Saturday schedule.
label: BODY

text: For purposes of this MOU, the employee’s third consecutive day off will be considered
label: BODY

text: their “regular second day off” for calculating double time payment.
label: BODY

text: PERSONAL BUSINESS DAY
label: HH2

text: In accordance with Article 18 of the Contract, employees are to receive eight (8) hours of leave
label: BODY

text: for a Personal Business Day (PBD).  Employees scheduled to work a (4) four ten (10) hour
label: BODY

text: workweek and are approved for their PBD leave must either supplement the remaining time with
label: BODY

text: other leave or must report to work for the remaining (2) two hours.
label: BODY

text: MOU #2006-06 (revised May 2008)

text: City/AFSCME
label: HH3

label: HH1

text: Page 3
label: HH3

text: INJURY LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Any employee, who is working a ten (10) hour shift and is off work as a result of a job-related
label: BODY

text: injury, shall be assigned to the first shift, Monday through Friday, for the duration of his/her
label: BODY

text: injury leave.
label: BODY

text: COMPENSATORY TIME
label: HH2

text: An employee who requests and is granted compensatory time off for a day on which he/she is
label: BODY

text: scheduled to work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of compensatory time for
label: BODY

text: said day off. For compensatory time of less than one (1) full work day, an employee shall be
label: BODY

text: charged in increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on compensatory time
label: BODY

text: during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: NON-PARTICIPANTS
label: HH1

text: Any employee choosing not to participate in the four (4) ten (10) hour per day work schedule
label: BODY

text: shall be assigned to the traditional (8) eight hour per day schedule (5) five days per workweek
label: BODY

text: schedule.
label: BODY

text: DURATION
label: HH2

text: This alternative work schedule is considered a pilot program for the Division of Police, Crime
label: BODY

text: Laboratory.  This MOU may be terminated by either party giving to the other party thirty (30)
label: BODY

text: days prior written notice, but the duration shall not extend beyond March 31, 2011.

label: BODY

text: The City of Columbus and AFSCME, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632 hereby agree to the following
label: BODY

text: provisions being enacted for the employees of the Public Service Department, 311 Service
label: BODY

text: Center.  Unless specifically amended by this Memorandum of Understanding (MOU), all wages,
label: BODY

text: hours and other terms and conditions of employment shall be administered in accordance with
label: BODY

text: the Collective Bargaining Contract.
label: BODY

text: Work Schedule and Hours of Work
label: HH2

text: Two (2) 311 Service Representatives II will rotate between a work schedule of
label: BODY

text: Tuesday through Saturday and Monday through Friday.  Each 311 Service Rep II will
label: BODY

text: work a schedule of Tuesday through Saturday for two (2) weeks and a work
label: BODY

text: schedule of Monday through Friday for four (4) weeks throughout the calendar year.
label: BODY

text: The hours of work for both schedules will be from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. with a one
label: BODY

text: (1) hour unpaid lunch.
label: BODY

text: 311 Service Representatives I who are assigned to the work schedule of Tuesday
label: BODY

text: through Saturday on a permanent basis will work from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. with a
label: BODY

text: one (1) hour unpaid lunch.
label: BODY

text: Overtime Eligibility and Pay
label: HH1

text: The provisions contained in Article 16 of the Contract shall govern the eligibility for overtime
label: BODY

text: pay.
label: BODY

text: For purposes of overtime, calculations shall be based on a workweek of Sunday
label: BODY

text: through Saturday.
label: BODY

text: 311 Service Representatives I working Tuesday through Saturday will be paid double
label: BODY

text: time for time worked on the second consecutive day off, Monday, provided the
label: BODY

text: employees have accumulated forty (40) straight time rate hours in paid status during
label: BODY

text: the workweek in accordance with Section 16.3 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: Memorandum of Understanding #2006-05 (revised May 2008)
label: HH1

text: City/AFSCME
label: HH3

text: 311 Service Center
label: HH2

text: Page Two
label: HH1

text: 311 Service Representatives II will be paid double time for time worked on the
label: BODY

text: second consecutive day off provided the employees have accumulated forty (40)
label: BODY

text: straight time rate hours in paid status during the workweek in accordance with
label: BODY

text: Section 16.3 of the Contract; Sunday shall be deemed the second consecutive day
label: BODY

text: off when working the Monday through Friday schedule and Monday shall be deemed
label: BODY

text: the second consecutive day off when working the Tuesday through Saturday
label: BODY

text: schedule.
label: BODY

text: Holiday Pay
label: HH2

text: The provisions contained in Article 17 of the Contract shall govern the eligibility and usage of
label: BODY

text: holiday pay for those covered herein, unless specifically changed hereunder.
label: BODY

text: 311 Service Representatives I and II working a schedule of Tuesday through Saturday shall
label: BODY

text: celebrate a holiday that falls on their first regularly scheduled day off on the last previous
label: BODY

text: workday, Saturday.  If the holiday falls on the second regularly scheduled day off, the holiday
label: BODY

text: shall be celebrated on the first scheduled work day (Tuesday).  At the time of a shift change
label: BODY

text: which necessitates three (3) consecutive days off for 311 Service Representatives II, a holiday
label: BODY

text: which falls on either the second or third day off shall be celebrated on the next subsequent work
label: BODY

text: day, Tuesday.
label: BODY

text: Non-Participants
label: HH2

text: Employees in the 311 Service Center working another schedule currently shall retain that
label: BODY

text: schedule until a vacancy exists, at which time they may choose to bid on that vacancy in
label: BODY

text: accordance with Article 13 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: REGARDING ONE STOP SHOP PARTICIPATING DEPARTMENTS
label: H3

text: (DEVELOPMENT, PUBLIC SERVICE AND PUBLIC UTILITIES)
label: BODY

text: The City of Columbus Engineering Plans Review Section (hereinafter referred to as One Stop
label: BODY

text: Shop) participating Departments and AFSCME Local 1632 hereby agree that the following
label: BODY

text: provisions shall be enacted for employees co-locating to the Carolyn Avenue facility.  Unless
label: BODY

text: specifically amended by this Memorandum of Understanding (hereinafter referred to as MOU),
label: BODY

text: all wages, hours and other terms and conditions of employment shall be administered in
label: BODY

text: accordance with the Collective Bargaining Contract (hereinafter referred to as Contract).
label: BODY

text: Employees of the Department of Public Service and the Department of Public
label: BODY

text: Utilities who are a part of the One Stop Shop of the Department of Development,
label: BODY

text: Building Services Division, shall report to 757 Carolyn Avenue.
label: BODY

text: Employees of the Department of Public Service and the Department of Public
label: BODY

text: Utilities who are a part of the One Stop Shop of the Department of Development,
label: BODY

text: Building Services Division, shall have a workday that consists of either (8) hours
label: BODY

text: of work, plus an unpaid lunch period scheduled near the middle of an employee’s
label: BODY

text: shift.  The normal workday for employees assigned to the One Stop Shop is 8:00
label: BODY

text: a.m. – 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.
label: BODY

text: Employees of the Department of Public Service and the Department of Public
label: BODY

text: Utilities who are a part of the One Stop Shop will remain on their home
label: BODY

text: Department’s payroll and operate under the same time and attendance
label: BODY

text: requirements of the employee’s home department.
label: BODY

text: Employees of the Department of Public Service and the Department of Public
label: BODY

text: Utilities who are a part of the One Stop Shop will forward requests for vacation
label: BODY

text: leave, compensatory leave, personal business day, birthday holiday and sick
label: BODY

text: leave to the Chief Plans Official for recommended approval.  Leave request
label: BODY

text: forms and all supporting documentation will be forwarded to the respective home
label: BODY

text: Department for final approval and payroll processing.
label: BODY

text: A recommendation that overtime work is needed will be made by the Chief Plans
label: BODY

text: Official to the respective Department giving sufficient notice.  Overtime shall only
label: BODY

text: be performed if authorized by the respective Department in accordance with
label: BODY

text: Article 16 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: Memorandum of Understanding #2005-09 (revised May 2008)
label: HH3

text: One Stop Shop

label: BODY

label: BODY

text: home Department, in cooperation with the Chief Plans Official, consistent with
label: BODY

text: the procedures outlined in the City of Columbus Performance Appraisal System.
label: BODY

text: When appropriate, a recommendation for discipline will be forwarded to the home
label: BODY

text: Department’s Appointing Authority for review and final determination.  The Chief
label: BODY

text: Plans Official, in cooperation with the employee’s home Department Human
label: BODY

text: Resources designee, will conduct the investigation into the alleged work rule
label: BODY

text: violation(s).
label: BODY

text: The
label: BODY

text: recommendation
label: BODY

text: packet
label: BODY

text: shall
label: BODY

text: include
label: BODY

text: all
label: BODY

text: information/documentation disclosed during the investigation.  Employee
label: BODY

text: representation will be from the home Department’s Chief Steward.  All applicable
label: BODY

text: timelines will be enforced in accordance with Article 10 of the Contract.
label: BODY

label: HH2

text: This MOU may be terminated by either party giving to the other party thirty (30) days prior

label: HH2

text: Pursuant to the provisions of Article 16, Section 16.4 of the Collective Bargaining Agreement
label: BODY

text: between the parties, the Agreement is hereby modified for employees in the classifications of
label: BODY

text: Equipment Operator I, Equipment Operator II and Laborer for the duration of the designated
label: BODY

text: winter season only (December through April) as detailed below.   Unless specifically amended
label: BODY

text: by this Memorandum of Understanding (MOU), all wages, hours, and other terms and
label: BODY

text: conditions of employment shall be administered in accordance with the Collective Bargaining
label: BODY

text: Agreement.
label: BODY

text: Overtime Equalization List for Winter Season Assignments
label: HH1

text: 1. The overtime equalization list for Equipment Operator I, Equipment Operator II and
label: BODY

text: Laborer at each Street Maintenance reporting location shall be frozen at the beginning of
label: BODY

text: the Winter Season.
label: BODY

text: 2. A “special” winter overtime equalization list shall be created for Equipment Operator I,
label: BODY

text: Equipment Operator II, and Laborer at each Street Maintenance reporting location. The
label: BODY

text: “special” winter overtime equalization list is to be used for the duration of the winter
label: BODY

text: season assignments only, December through April. The “special” winter overtime
label: BODY

text: equalization list shall begin with zero (0) hours and be created by offering overtime to the
label: BODY

text: most senior employee for the first overtime opportunity. Thereafter, the next most senior
label: BODY

text: employee shall be assigned the next overtime opportunity until all employees have
label: BODY

text: worked an overtime assignment.
label: BODY

text: 3. At the end of the designated Winter Season, when employees are returned to their pre-
label: BODY

text: winter season reporting locations, the frozen overtime list shall be reactivated. The
label: BODY

text: overtime hours accumulated on the “special” winter overtime equalization list during the
label: BODY

text: winter season shall not be transferred to the frozen list but shall be void. At the
label: BODY

text: beginning of each Winter Season, a “special” winter overtime equalization list shall be
label: BODY

text: created as detailed above.
label: BODY

text: Regarding Overtime

text: The City of Columbus, Public Service Department, Transportation Division and Ohio Council 8,
label: BODY

text: AFSCME Local 1632, hereby agree to the following provisions being enacted for the employees
label: BODY

text: of the 1800 E. 17th Avenue location.  Unless specifically amended by this Memorandum of
label: BODY

text: Understanding (MOU) all wages, hours, terms and conditions of employment shall be
label: BODY

text: administered in accordance with the AFSCME Collective Bargaining Agreement (hereinafter
label: BODY

text: referred to as the Contract).
label: BODY

text: AFFECTED CLASSIFICATIONS:
label: HH2

text: Construction Inspector I and II
label: BODY

text: Engineering Aide I and II
label: BODY

text: Engineering Associate I and II
label: BODY

text: ADMINISTRATION:
label: HH1

text: In order to maintain job continuity and data integrity required by the customers, employees in
label: BODY

text: classifications covered by this MOU and currently assigned to a project will be given first
label: BODY

text: opportunity to work the overtime resulting from that project, including weekends and holidays.
label: BODY

text: The assigned employees shall possess the required certifications, technical training or special
label: BODY

text: knowledge required for the type of work being performed.
label: BODY

text: If the employee assigned is unable to work the overtime, the overtime eligibility list for voluntary
label: BODY

text: overtime shall be used.
label: BODY

text: It is the responsibility of the employees covered by this MOU and desiring to work overtime on
label: BODY

text: weekends and holidays, to contact the Location Office (645-3182) no later than 2:00 P.M. each
label: BODY

text: Friday, or by 2:00 P.M. on the last work day prior to a holiday.
label: BODY

text: An overtime eligibility list shall be compiled, updated each pay period, posted, and used for call
label: BODY

text: in purposes by supervisors based upon the names of those overtime-eligible employees calling
label: BODY

text: in as described above.  On the following business day after any overtime has been distributed
label: BODY

text: from the overtime list, the supervisor shall report those individuals who where called and
label: BODY

text: designate hours offered to those individuals to be charged.
label: BODY

text: MOU #2005-01 (revised May 2008)
label: HH3

text: City/AFSCME
label: HH3

text: Construction Services - Overtime
label: HH3

text: Page Two
label: HH1

text: Per Article 16.4(C), a record of the overtime hours worked and overtime hours offered shall be
label: BODY

text: kept and updated each time overtime is offered and charged.
label: BODY

text: Employees shall be called from the overtime list in the following order:
label: BODY

text: Construction Inspector I (FTR)
label: BODY

text: Construction Inspector I (FTL)
label: BODY

text: Construction Inspector I (FTR-Testing)
label: BODY

text: Construction Inspector I (FTL-Testing)
label: BODY

text: Construction Inspector II
label: BODY

text: Civil Engineering Associate I
label: BODY

text: Civil Engineering Associate II
label: BODY

text: Civil Engineering Aide I
label: BODY

text: Civil Engineering Aide II
label: BODY

text: The Testing and Survey Section’s overtime shall be accounted for separately on the overtime
label: BODY

text: list due to the nature of its work and will have primary eligibility for all overtime which becomes
label: BODY

text: available within its section.  All other overtime at the location will be distributed according to the
label: BODY

text: order detailed above.
label: BODY

text: During the hours of 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. on Friday and continuing at 6:30 a.m. to 8:00 a.m. on
label: BODY

text: the weekend or holiday to be worked, supervisors from the location will be calling employees
label: BODY

text: from the compiled overtime eligibility list.  Overtime shall be offered to the employee with the
label: BODY

text: fewest number of total overtime hours worked and offered to his/her credit at that time.  If the
label: BODY

text: employee does not accept the assignment, the employee with the next fewest hours shall be
label: BODY

text: offered the assignment.  This procedure shall be followed until the required numbers of
label: BODY

text: employees have been selected for the overtime work available.
label: BODY

text: If an employee turns down the overtime offered, or is unable to respond when contacted, the
label: BODY

text: number of hours offered shall be credited to his/her overtime hours.  Employees who do not call
label: BODY

text: in by 2:00 p.m. to participate in the voluntary overtime shall be automatically credited with the
label: BODY

text: highest number of overtime hours worked on the day in question if they would have been called,
label: BODY

text: had they signed up.
label: BODY

text: The supervisor placing the call will let the phone ring 10 times.  If, after 10 rings, there is no
label: BODY

text: answer, the supervisor will hang up and proceed to the next eligible employee.
label: BODY

text: If the phone rings busy, the supervisor will call back after five (5) minutes.  There will be no
label: BODY

text: further calls after the first call back.
label: BODY

text: If the employee has an answering machine or voice mail service, the supervisor will state the
label: BODY

text: nature and time of the call.  The employee has 10 minutes from the stated time to notify the
label: BODY

text: supervisor he/she accepts or refuses the offered overtime.
label: BODY

text: Regarding Work Schedule for EMS Instructor
label: BODY

text: The City of Columbus and AFSCME, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632 hereby agree that the following
label: BODY

text: provisions shall be enacted for employees classified as EMS Instructor working in the
label: BODY

text: Department of Public Safety, Division of Fire. Unless specifically amended by this Memorandum
label: BODY

text: of Understanding (hereinafter referred to as MOU), all wages, hours, and other terms and
label: BODY

text: conditions of employment shall be administered in accordance with the Collective Bargaining
label: BODY

text: Contract (hereinafter referred to as Contract).
label: BODY

text: Hours of Work
label: HH1

text: Said employees shall work forty (40) hours within a five (5) day period.
label: BODY

text: Overtime/Compensatory Time Eligibility
label: HH1

text: Time and one-half will be paid for hours in excess of forty (40) straight-time hours
label: BODY

text: in paid status during said employee’s workweek in accordance with Article 16.
label: BODY

text: Time and one half will be paid for time worked on an employee’s first regularly
label: BODY

text: scheduled day off, providing that said employee has accumulated forty (40)
label: BODY

text: straight-time rate hours in paid status during said workweek in accordance with
label: BODY

text: Article 16.
label: BODY

text: For the purposes of this MOU, Sunday shall be considered the second
label: BODY

text: consecutive day off for which double-time will be paid for any employee who, on
label: BODY

text: that day, is in an overtime situation, providing that said employee had
label: BODY

text: accumulated forty (40) straight-time rate hours in paid status in accordance with
label: BODY

text: Article 16.
label: BODY

text: There is no shift-to-shift calculation of daily overtime.
label: BODY

text: THIRD SHIFT PERSONNEL, CENTRAL OUTPOST, 650 NATIONWIDE BLVD.
label: BODY

text: The City of Columbus and AFSCME, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632 hereby agree this
label: BODY

text: Memorandum of Understanding shall apply to all 3rd shift employees classified as Equipment
label: BODY

text: Operator I, Equipment Operator II, and Laborer in the Street Maintenance Section.  This
label: BODY

text: proposal does not apply to winter staffing (December to April).  To allow for fair evaluation, the
label: BODY

text: suggested pilot program is recommended for one complete normal staffing season (2004) with
label: BODY

text: the ability to terminate the program with a 30-day advance notice to the Union.  Unless
label: BODY

text: specifically amended by this MOU, all wages, hours, and other terms and conditions of
label: BODY

text: employment shall be administered in accordance with the Collective Bargaining Contract.
label: BODY

text: HOURS OF WORK
label: HH2

text: The normal workweek shall be Sunday through Saturday and consist of four (4)
label: BODY

text: workdays of ten hours per day and three (3) consecutive days off.
label: BODY

text: The hours of work will be from 8:30 p.m. to 7:00 a.m., ten (10) work hours plus a thirty
label: BODY

text: (30) minute unpaid lunch.
label: BODY

text: VACATION LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Vacation leave entitlement and usage shall be administered in accordance with the provisions of
label: BODY

text: Article 19 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: MOU #2004-03 (revised May 2008)
label: HH3

text: 4-10 HOUR DAYS WORK SCHEDULE

text: FOR 3RD SHIFT PERSONNEL

label: HH3

text: Page Two
label: HH1

text: Any employee who requests and is granted a vacation day off for any day on which he/she is
label: BODY

text: scheduled to work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of vacation pay for said
label: BODY

text: day off.  For vacation leaves of less than one (1) full workday, an employee shall be charged in
label: BODY

text: increments of one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time off during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: To ensure adequate shift coverage, the Street Maintenance Manager/Street Maintenance
label: BODY

text: Assistant Manager shall determine the number of employees on scheduled vacation on each
label: BODY

text: shift at any one time.
label: BODY

text: COMPENSATORY TIME
label: HH2

text: An employee who requests and is granted compensatory time off for a day on which he/she is
label: BODY

text: scheduled to work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of compensatory time for
label: BODY

text: said day off. For compensatory time of less than one (1) full work day, an employee shall be
label: BODY

text: charged in increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on compensatory time
label: BODY

text: during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: PERSONAL BUSINESS DAY
label: HH2

text: Personal business day entitlement and usage shall be administered in accordance with the
label: BODY

text: provisions of Article 18 of the Contract.  Employees will be required to supplement two (2) hours
label: BODY

text: of vacation leave or compensatory time in order to be paid for a ten (10) hour workday.
label: BODY

text: SICK LEAVE ENTITLEMENT AND USAGE
label: HH2

text: Sick leave entitlement and usage shall be administered in accordance with the provisions of
label: BODY

text: Article 20 of the Contract.  For each ten (10) hours of regularly scheduled work from which an
label: BODY

text: employee is absent due to illness, sick leave with pay shall be used at the rate of ten (10) hours.
label: BODY

text: For sick leave of less than one (1) full work day, an employee shall be charged in increments of
label: BODY

text: not less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on sick leave during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: DISABILITY LEAVE
label: HH2

text: All full-time non-seasonal employees working ten (10) hour shifts shall be eligible to participate
label: BODY

text: in the City’s disability leave program as provided in Article 21 of the Contract provided, however,
label: BODY

text: that any ten (10) hour employee deemed to be on said disability leave program shall receive
label: BODY

text: 81% of said employee’s gross wage, less applicable taxes, under the following formula:
label: BODY

text: The employee’s gross wages shall be computed on a forty (40) hour workweek for each full
label: BODY

text: week in which an employee is off work.
label: BODY

text: MOU #2004-03 (revised May 2008)

text: INJURY LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Any employee, who is working a ten (10) hour shift and is off work as a result of a job-related
label: BODY

text: injury, shall be assigned to the first shift, Monday through Friday, for the duration of his/her
label: BODY

text: injury leave.
label: BODY

text: OVERTIME ELIGIBILITY AND PAY
label: HH2

text: The provisions contained in Article 16.3 of the Contract shall govern the eligibility for overtime
label: BODY

text: pay.
label: BODY

text: Employees working a ten (10) hour workday shall be eligible for daily overtime after
label: BODY

text: actually working ten (10) hours in the workday.
label: BODY

text: Double time will be paid for time worked on Saturday, provided the employee has
label: BODY

text: accumulated forty (40) straight time rate hours in paid status during the workweek in
label: BODY

text: accordance with Article 16.3 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: HOLIDAY AND PAY SCHEDULE
label: HH2

text: The provisions contained in Article 17 of the Contract shall govern the eligibility and usage of
label: BODY

text: holiday pay for those covered herein, unless specifically changed hereunder.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who does not work a day on which a holiday is celebrated shall be paid ten (10)
label: BODY

text: hours of straight-time hourly pay for said holiday.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who is working a ten (10) hour shift and who works a day celebrated as a holiday
label: BODY

text: shall be paid at the rate of time and one-half (1-1/2) for all hours worked, in addition to the
label: BODY

text: holiday pay (which shall be paid at the straight-time hourly rate), unless the holiday falls on a
label: BODY

text: double-time day in which case he/she shall be compensated at the double-time rate in addition
label: BODY

text: to his/her holiday pay in accordance with Article 16 and 17 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: When the holiday falls on Monday, the holiday will be celebrated on the first regularly
label: BODY

text: scheduled workday (Sunday).
label: BODY

text: MOU #2004-03 (revised May 2008)

label: HH3

text: When the holiday falls on the first or second day off, the holiday will be celebrated on the
label: BODY

text: last previous workday (Wednesday).
label: BODY

text: When the holiday falls on the third day off, the holiday will be celebrated on the following
label: BODY

text: day (Sunday).
label: BODY

text: DURATION
label: HH2

text: The City of Columbus will periodically review this experimental schedule and both parties agree
label: BODY

text: that this MOU may be terminated by either party giving to the other party thirty (30) days prior
label: BODY

text: written notice of termination, but the duration shall be no longer than March 31, 2011.

text: Regarding Cashier I & II Work Schedule
label: BODY

text: The City of Columbus and AFSCME, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632, hereby agree that the
label: BODY

text: following provisions shall be enacted for employees working in the cashier area of the Parking
label: BODY

text: Violations Bureau, working as Cashier I’s and II’s.  Unless specifically amended by this
label: BODY

text: Memorandum of Understanding (hereinafter referred to as MOU), all wages, hours and other
label: BODY

text: terms and conditions of employment shall be administered in accordance with the Collective
label: BODY

text: Bargaining Contract (hereinafter referred to as Contract).
label: BODY

text: HOURS OF WORK
label: HH2

text: The normal workweek shall consist of four (4) days of ten (10) hours per day. This schedule
label: BODY

text: shall be worked Monday through Saturday. Hours of work and days off will be determined by
label: BODY

text: seniority. The starting times begin at 9:00 A.M. and conclude at 8:00 P.M., Monday through
label: BODY

text: Friday and 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. on Saturdays.
label: BODY

text: EXCEPTION
label: H3

text: One (1) Cashier II (the most senior) and two (2) Cashier I’s (the most senior) will
label: BODY

text: be grandfathered under different schedules. The Cashier II will continue
label: BODY

text: to work five (5) eight (8) hour days, Monday through Friday. The Cashier
label: BODY

text: I’s will work 7:00am to 6:00pm. Management reserves the right to alter
label: BODY

text: the top three (3) abovementioned positions in the event that the
label: BODY

text: incumbents separate from those positions.
label: BODY

text: HOLIDAY PAY
label: HH2

text: The provisions contained in Article 17, Holidays, of the Contract shall govern the
label: BODY

text: eligibility and usage of holiday pay for those employees covered herein, unless
label: BODY

text: specifically changed hereunder.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who does not work a day on which a holiday is celebrated shall be paid
label: BODY

text: for the hours that would normally be worked on that scheduled day at his/her regular
label: BODY

text: straight-time hourly rate of pay for said holiday.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who works on a day that is celebrated as a holiday, shall be paid at the
label: BODY

text: rate of time and one-half (1-1/2) for all hours worked in addition to his/her regular straight
label: BODY

text: time hourly pay for the holiday.
label: BODY

text: MOU #2003-03 (revised May 2008)
label: HH3

text: City/AFSCME
label: HH3

text: Work Schedule
label: HH3

text: Page 2
label: HH3

text: In accordance with the provisions of Article 17, if the holiday falls on the first or second
label: BODY

text: regularly scheduled day off (RDO), the holiday will be celebrated on the previous
label: BODY

text: workday.  If the holiday falls on the third day off it will be celebrated on the following
label: BODY

text: workday.  Cashier II (Position B) and Cashier I (Position G) will rotate days observed as
label: BODY

text: holidays.  These rotating days off will be Saturday prior to the holiday and Wednesday
label: BODY

text: following the holiday.
label: BODY

text: OVERTIME ELIGIBILITY AND PAY
label: HH2

text: Overtime eligibility and pay will be administered pursuant to Article 16 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: For purposes of this MOU, work performed on an employee’s second consecutive
label: BODY

text: regular day off will be paid at the double-time rate, providing that the provisions of
label: BODY

text: Section 16.3(C) of the Contract are met.
label: BODY

text: When a need for overtime arises at the end of the shift, the supervisor will first contact
label: BODY

text: those employees who meet the following criteria (regardless of whether the employee
label: BODY

text: works an eight (8) hour shift or ten (10) hour shift:
label: BODY

text: 1. Employees already working will be asked if they can stay over (based on seniority),
label: BODY

text: and;
label: BODY

text: 2. Employee(s) next on the overtime list.
label: BODY

text: VACATION LEAVE
label: HH2

text: An employee’s vacation leave accrual and/or usage shall be in accordance with the
label: BODY

text: provisions contained in Article 19 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: An employee who requests and is granted a vacation day off for a day on which he is
label: BODY

text: scheduled to work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of vacation for
label: BODY

text: said day off. For vacation leave of less than one (1) full work day, an employee shall be
label: BODY

text: charged in increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on vacation
label: BODY

text: leave during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: COMPENSATORY TIME
label: HH2

text: An employee who requests and is granted compensatory time off for a day on which he/she is
label: BODY

text: scheduled to work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of compensatory time for
label: BODY

text: said day off. For compensatory time of less than one (1) full work day, an employee shall be
label: BODY

text: charged in increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on compensatory time
label: BODY

text: during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: SICK LEAVE ENTITLEMENT AND USAGE
label: HH2

text: Sick leave entitlement and usage shall be administered for employees on ten (10) hour
label: BODY

text: shifts in accordance with the provisions contained in Article 20 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: For each ten (10) hours of regularly scheduled work from which an employee is absent,
label: BODY

text: sick leave with pay shall be used at the rate of ten (10) hours. For sick leave of less than
label: BODY

text: one (1) full work day, an employee shall be charged in increments of not less than one-
label: BODY

text: tenth (1/10) hour for all time on sick leave during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: INJURY LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Any employee who is working a ten (10) hour shift and is off work as a result of a job-related
label: BODY

text: injury, shall be assigned to the first shift, Monday through Friday, for the duration of his/her
label: BODY

text: injury leave.
label: BODY

text: DISABILITY LEAVE PROCEDURES
label: HH2

text: All full-time employees working ten (10) hour shifts shall be eligible to participate in the City’s
label: BODY

text: disability leave program provided in Article 21 of the Contract, provided, however, that any ten
label: BODY

text: (10) hour employee deemed to be on said disability leave program shall receive a payment of
label: BODY

text: 81% of said employee’s gross wages under the following formula:
label: BODY

text: The employee’s gross wages shall be computed on a forty (40) hour workweek
label: BODY

text: for each full week in which an employee is off work.
label: BODY

text: The employee shall receive a payment of 81% of his/her gross wages based
label: BODY

text: upon said forty (40) hour workweek for each full week in which an employee is off
label: BODY

text: work.
label: BODY

text: For any partial week in which an employee is on the disability leave program,
label: BODY

text: said employee shall receive a payment of 81% of his/her gross wages, under the
label: BODY

text: above-noted formula, pro-rated to the number of hours said employee is off work
label: BODY

text: during his/her regularly scheduled work week.
label: BODY

text: PERSONAL BUSINESS DAY
label: HH2

text: Personal business day entitlement and usage shall be administered in accordance with the
label: BODY

text: provisions of Article 18 of the Contract.  Employees will be required to supplement two (2) hours
label: BODY

text: of vacation leave or compensatory time in order to be paid for a ten (10) hour workday.

text: Regarding Western-Southern Life Payroll Deduction
label: BODY

text: AFSCME, Local 1632 is desirous of providing a group life insurance program by payroll
label: BODY

text: deduction to its members and has requested that the City grant a payroll deduction slot for the
label: BODY

text: voluntary deduction of monthly premiums from eligible bargaining members’ wages.  The City
label: BODY

text: has agreed to provide AFSCME Local 1632 (hereinafter referred to as Local 1632) with a payroll
label: BODY

text: deduction slot to be used for such purpose as follows:
label: BODY

text: The group life insurance, provided by Western Southern Financial Group, will be
label: BODY

text: the complete and sole responsibility of Local 1632 to process, administer and monitor.
label: BODY

text: The City will provide Local 1632 access to a payroll deduction slot and will
label: BODY

text: facilitate enrollment by eligible bargaining unit members of Local 1632 and in individual City
label: BODY

text: departments by agreeing to have payroll clerks process the payroll deduction authorization for
label: BODY

text: the Local 1632 sponsored group life insurance.
label: BODY

text: All monies deducted monthly for participation in the group life insurance program
label: BODY

text: will be forwarded to the Treasurer of Local 1632 in the aggregate amount by a warrant separate
label: BODY

text: and apart from the warrant provided to the Comptroller of AFSCME, Ohio Council 8 as provided
label: BODY

text: in Article 5 of the Collective Bargaining Contract currently in effect between the City and
label: BODY

text: AFSCME, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632.  All funds transmitted to Local 1632 pursuant to the
label: BODY

text: payroll deduction authorization for the group life insurance program shall be the sole
label: BODY

text: responsibility of Local 1632 to administer and disperse.
label: BODY

text: Deductions under the terms of this MOU shall be made during one (1) pay period
label: BODY

text: each month; if any participating bargaining unit member’s pay for the period is insufficient to
label: BODY

text: cover the deduction for the plan after the withholding of all other legal and required deductions
label: BODY

text: (including Union dues), the City will make a deduction from the pay earned during the next pay
label: BODY

text: period.  In the event a deduction is not made for any participating member during any particular
label: BODY

text: month, the City, upon verification in writing from the President of Local 1632, will make the
label: BODY

text: appropriate deduction in the following month.
label: BODY

text: The deductions made under the terms of this MOU, accompanied by an
label: BODY

text: alphabetical list of all participating bargaining unit members shall be transmitted to the Treasurer
label: BODY

text: of Local 1632, no later than ten (10) days following the end of the pay period in which the
label: BODY

text: deduction is made, if so approved by the City Auditor.
label: BODY

text: It shall be the sole and exclusive responsibility of Local 1632 to administer the
label: BODY

text: group life insurance program, including solicitation and distribution of information related to
label: BODY

text: enrollment or participation in the plan.
label: BODY

text: AFSCME/City of Columbus
label: HH1

label: HH1

text: The City’s role will be solely clerical in nature, that is, to process the amount of
label: BODY

text: the payroll deduction for the Local 1632 sponsored group life insurance program and to transmit
label: BODY

text: the monies deducted from payroll to Local 1632.
label: BODY

text: Only Local 1632 bargaining unit members who have properly executed and
label: BODY

text: validated dues deduction authorization cards on file with their payroll clerk or the Central Payroll
label: BODY

text: section of the City Auditor’s Office shall be eligible to execute payroll deduction authorization
label: BODY

text: cards for the sponsored group life insurance program.
label: BODY

text: Any eligible bargaining unit member of Local 1632 wishing to participate in the
label: BODY

text: payroll deduction of premiums for the Local 1632 sponsored group life insurance program shall
label: BODY

text: be required to execute the required payroll deduction authorization card.
label: BODY

text: An annual enrollment period during the month of February each year is hereby
label: BODY

text: established, during which interested eligible bargaining unit members may sign a payroll
label: BODY

text: deduction card for the plan.  Payroll deduction authorization cards received by the City on or
label: BODY

text: after March 1 of each year shall be deemed invalid.  In any event, the City shall not be obligated
label: BODY

text: in any way to honor the payroll deduction authorization cards for the Local 1632 sponsored life
label: BODY

text: insurance program until such time as Local 1632 presents to the City a minimum of 50 properly
label: BODY

text: executed payroll deduction authorization cards in a timely manner evidencing the desire of at
label: BODY

text: least 50 eligible bargaining unit members to participate in the payroll deduction program for the
label: BODY

text: Local 1632 sponsored group life insurance program.
label: BODY

text: The City shall continue to make the appropriate monthly deduction from the pay
label: BODY

text: of a participating bargaining unit member until such time as the City receives a written
label: BODY

text: revocation of the authorization for payroll deduction during the month of February by the
label: BODY

text: participating member.  To be valid and effective a written revocation must be signed, submitted
label: BODY

text: and received by the City during the month of February in each year.
label: BODY

text: In the event less than 50 eligible members of the bargaining unit participated in
label: BODY

text: the program at any time, the City’s obligation to withhold shall automatically terminate and the
label: BODY

text: Office of the City Auditor shall inform Local 1632 of the termination of this deduction.  In such
label: BODY

text: event, it shall be the sole responsibility of Local 1632 to notify participating bargaining unit
label: BODY

text: members of the termination of the payroll deduction.
label: BODY

text: 13.  No solicitation or enrollment activity shall take place during working hours or on City
label: BODY

text: property.

text: CUSTOMER SERVICE CENTER
label: H3

text: The City of Columbus and AFSCME, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632 hereby agree to the following
label: BODY

text: provisions being enacted for the employees of the Department of Public Utilities, Division of
label: BODY

text: Power and Water (Water), Customer Service Center.  Unless specifically amended by this
label: BODY

text: Memorandum of Understanding (hereinafter referred to as MOU), all wages, hours and terms
label: BODY

text: and conditions of employment shall be administered in accordance with the Collective
label: BODY

text: Bargaining Contract (hereinafter referred to as the Contract).
label: BODY

text: HOURS OF WORK
label: HH2

text: The normal workweek shall consist of four (4) ten (10) hour days that shall be worked
label: BODY

text: Monday through Friday.
label: BODY

text: Shift A shall be 7:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. with Monday, Tuesday,
label: BODY

text: Wednesday, Thursday or Friday off.  The shift will include an unpaid
label: BODY

text: ½ hour for lunch.
label: BODY

text: Shift B shall be 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. with Monday, Tuesday,
label: BODY

text: Wednesday, Thursday or Friday off.  The shift will include an unpaid
label: BODY

text: ½ hour for lunch.
label: BODY

text: Shift C shall be 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. with Monday, Tuesday,
label: BODY

text: Wednesday, Thursday or Friday off.  The shift will include an unpaid
label: BODY

text: one (1) hour for lunch.
label: BODY

text: Core work hours of office employees participating in flex time remain 9:00 a.m. to 4:00
label: BODY

text: p.m.  This means that an office employee’s working hours may begin no later than 9:00
label: BODY

text: a.m. and end no earlier than 4:00 p.m.
label: BODY

text: HOLIDAY PAY
label: HH2

text: The provisions contained in Article 17 of the Contract shall govern the eligibility and
label: BODY

text: usage of holiday pay for those employees covered herein, unless specifically changed
label: BODY

text: hereunder.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who does not work a day on which a holiday is celebrated shall be paid
label: BODY

text: ten (10) hours of straight time pay for the said holiday.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who is working a ten (10) hour shift and who works on a day on which a
label: BODY

text: holiday is celebrated, shall be paid at the rate of time and one-half (1 ½ ) for all hours
label: BODY

text: worked, in addition to his/her ten (10) hours of straight time pay for the holiday.
label: BODY

text: MOU #2002 –01 (revised May 2008)
label: HH3

text: City/AFSCME
label: HH3

text: Division of Power and Water (Water)
label: HH3

text: Page 2
label: HH3

text: When the holiday falls on the first day of an employee’s regularly schedule day off, it
label: BODY

text: shall be celebrated on the previous day: when a holiday falls on the second day of an
label: BODY

text: employee’s regularly scheduled day off, it shall be celebrated on the following day,
label: BODY

text: except that at the time of a shift change which necessitates more than a two (2) day
label: BODY

text: weekend, a holiday which falls on either the first two days shall be celebrated on the last
label: BODY

text: previous workday, and a holiday which falls on any other day of such weekend shall be
label: BODY

text: celebrated on the next subsequent workday.
label: BODY

text: DISABILITY LEAVE PROCEDURES
label: HH2

text: All employees working ten (10) hour days shall be eligible to participate in the City’s disability
label: BODY

text: leave program as provided in Article 21 of the Contract, provided however, that a ten (10) hour
label: BODY

text: employee on approved disability leave shall receive 81% of his/her gross wage under the
label: BODY

text: following formula:
label: BODY

text: The employee’s gross wage shall be computed on a forty (40) hour workweek for
label: BODY

text: each full week in which an employee is off work.
label: BODY

text: The employee shall receive 81% of his/her gross wage based upon said forty
label: BODY

text: (40) hour workweek for each full week the employee is off  work.
label: BODY

text: For any partial week in which an employee is on the disability program, the
label: BODY

text: employee shall receive 81% of his/her gross wage,  under
label: BODY

text: the
label: BODY

text: above
label: BODY

text: noted
label: BODY

text: formula prorated to the number of hours the employee is off work due to disability
label: BODY

text: during his/her regularly scheduled workweek.
label: BODY

text: VACATION LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Any employee who requests and is granted a vacation day off for any day on which he/she is
label: BODY

text: scheduled to work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of vacation leave for said
label: BODY

text: day off.  For vacation leaves of less than one (1) full workday, an employee shall be charged in
label: BODY

text: increments of one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time off during any shift.
label: BODY

text: The number of employees allowed on scheduled vacation at any one time shall be determined
label: BODY

text: by the section manager.  This is to ensure adequate coverage during the various shifts.
label: BODY

text: Vacations shall be bid by seniority by December 10th of the previous year.
label: BODY

text: PERSONAL BUSINESS DAY
label: HH2

text: Personal business day entitlement and usage shall be administered in accordance with the
label: BODY

text: provisions of Article 18 of the Contract.  Employees will be required to supplement two (2) hours
label: BODY

text: of vacation leave or compensatory time in order to be paid for a ten (10) hour workday.
label: BODY

text: MOU #2002-01 (revised May 2008)
label: HH3

text: City/AFSCME
label: HH3

text: Division of Power and Water (Water)
label: HH3

text: Page 3
label: HH3

text: SICK LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Sick leave entitlement and usage shall be administered in accordance with the
label: BODY

text: provisions of Article 20 of the Contract with the following modifications:
label: BODY

text: For each ten (10) hours of regular work from which an employee is absent, sick leave
label: BODY

text: shall be used at the rate of ten (10) hours.  For sick leave of less than one (1) full
label: BODY

text: workday, an employee shall be charged in increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10)
label: BODY

text: hour for all time on sick leave during any shift.
label: BODY

text: OVERTIME ELIGIBILITY AND PAY
label: HH2

text: Overtime eligibility and pay shall be administered as provided in Article 16 of the
label: BODY

text: Contract.
label: BODY

text: For purposes of this MOU, Sunday shall be considered the double time day for all
label: BODY

text: employees.
label: BODY

text: INJURY LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Any employee, who is working a ten (10) hour shift and is off work as a result of a job-related
label: BODY

text: injury, shall be assigned to the first shift, Monday through Friday, for the duration of his/her
label: BODY

text: injury leave.
label: BODY

text: COMPENSATORY TIME
label: HH2

text: An employee who requests and is granted compensatory time off for a day on which he/she is
label: BODY

text: scheduled to work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of compensatory time for
label: BODY

text: said day off. For compensatory time of less than one (1) full work day, an employee shall be
label: BODY

text: charged in increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on compensatory time
label: BODY

text: during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: NON-PARTICIPANTS
label: HH1

text: Any employee not wishing to participated in the four (4) day ten (10) hour  per
label: BODY

text: day
label: BODY

text: work
label: BODY

text: schedule, shall continue to work a traditional eight (8) hour per day schedule five (5) days per
label: BODY

text: week, Monday through Friday, with starting and quitting times as are currently in effect at the
label: BODY

text: time of signature by the parties of this MOU.
label: BODY

label: H3

text: The City of Columbus and AFSCME, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632 hereby agree that this
label: BODY

text: Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) shall apply to part-time employees in the Permits
label: BODY

text: Section in the classifications of Laborer, Recreation Program Assistant, Recreation Service
label: BODY

text: Representative, and Recreation and Parks Aide.  Unless specifically provided for in this MOU,
label: BODY

text: all wages, hours and other terms and conditions of employment shall be administered in
label: BODY

text: accordance with the terms and provisions of the current collective bargaining contract between
label: BODY

text: the parties.
label: BODY

text: Hours of Work
label: HH1

text: Part-time employees, defined as those employees regularly assigned to work twenty (20) hours
label: BODY

text: or more per week, who are in the above classifications and assigned to the Permits Section,
label: BODY

text: may voluntarily participate in this alternative work schedule.  If part-time employees elect to
label: BODY

text: participate, they may be scheduled to work for more than eight (8) hours in a workday, and will
label: BODY

text: be paid at the straight time rate for all hours worked.  If they elect to participate, they will not be
label: BODY

text: eligible for daily overtime.
label: BODY

text: Part-time employees ordinarily will not exceed thirty-two (32) hours in a workweek.  If a part-
label: BODY

text: time employee works forty (40) hours in a workweek, the daily overtime provisions of the current
label: BODY

text: AFSCME collective bargaining contract shall apply.
label: BODY

text: Management will assign and schedule the part-time employees participating in this alternative
label: BODY

text: work schedule based on the operational needs of the Recreation and Parks Department, and
label: BODY

text: the availability of the employees to work.  To the extent that it is possible to do so, management
label: BODY

text: will distribute the available work hours fairly and equitably.
label: BODY

text: Employees are not required to participate in this alternative work schedule, and will not be
label: BODY

text: penalized for electing not to participate.  Management reaffirms its right not to schedule
label: BODY

text: employees who do not participate in the alternative schedule for more than eight (8) hours in a
label: BODY

text: workday.
label: BODY

text: Procedure
label: HH1

text: Part-time employees electing to participate in this alternative work schedule must communicate
label: BODY

text: that to management in writing as soon as possible.  Employees may use the attached form
label: BODY

text: Memorandum of Understanding #2001-09 (revised May 2008)
label: HH3

text: City/AFSCME Local 1632
label: HH3

text: Page Two
label: HH1

text: if they wish, or may document their election by e-mail or other writing if they please.  Employees
label: BODY

text: may decide at any time that they no longer wish to participate in the alternative work schedule,
label: BODY

text: and must notify management in writing if and when they make such a decision.
label: BODY

text: Duration
label: HH2

text: This Memorandum of Understanding remains in full force and effect until March 31, 2011,
label: BODY

text: unless either party gives written notice to the other of its intent to terminate this MOU at least
label: BODY

text: thirty (30) days prior to its expiration date or any anniversary thereof.
label: BODY
