text: The following is the process agreed upon by the parties to transfer employees from the
label: BODY

text: Columbus Health Department to the Columbus Department of Development:
label: BODY

text: Sanitarian I’s without a degree will transfer as a PMI Trainee at pay range 24 and
label: BODY

text: will retain their current step, unless they receive BOCA certification.
label: BODY

text: Sanitarian I’s with a degree will transfer as a PMI Trainee at pay grade 25 and
label: BODY

text: will retain their current step, unless they receive BOCA certification.
label: BODY

text: Any Sanitarian I that obtains BOCA certification will immediately become a PMI
label: BODY

text: at pay grade 28 retaining their current step.
label: BODY

text: Any Sanitarian I that does not obtain BOCA certification will remain in the
label: BODY

text: classification of PMI Trainee indefinitely.
label: BODY

text: No probationary period will be served in the PMI Trainee position, no testing, civil
label: BODY

text: service or otherwise, will be required for the PMI Trainee position, and they will
label: BODY

text: not be required to be on the list for the PMI Trainee classification.
label: BODY

text: No probationary period will be served in the PMI position and there will be no civil
label: BODY

text: service testing or requirement to be on a list to advance to the PMI position.  The
label: BODY

text: only examination necessary and required for advancement is the BOCA
label: BODY

text: examination.
label: BODY

text: All employees holding clerical classifications reallocated to Development (1
label: BODY

text: Admin. Asst.; 2 Typist Clerks; 1 Data Entry Operator; and, 1 Clerk II) will be
label: BODY

text: transferred in their current classification, pay grade and step.
label: BODY

text: No probationary period will be served by any clerical staff transferring.
label: BODY

text: Pursuant to Article 32, Entire Agreement/Mid-Term Modifications, and Article 16, Hours of Work
label: BODY

text: and Overtime, of the Collective Bargaining Contract (Contract) between the City of Columbus
label: BODY

text: and AFSCME Local 1632, the parties hereby agree that this Memorandum of Understanding
label: BODY

text: (MOU) shall apply to employees of the Division of Transportation and pursuant to a mutual
label: BODY

text: agreement and desire to establish a four (4) day per week, ten (10) hour per day work schedule
label: BODY

text: for the Pavement Marking Operation, and Sign Installation Operation.
label: BODY

text: Unless specifically amended by this MOU, all wages, hours, and other terms and conditions of
label: BODY

text: employment shall be administered in accordance with the Collective Bargaining Contract.
label: BODY

text: HOURS OF WORK
label: HH2

text: The normal workweek shall consist of four (4) work days of ten (10) hours per day and three (3)
label: BODY

text: consecutive days off or five (5) work days of eight (8) hours per day and two (two) consecutive
label: BODY

text: days off (per attached schedule).  There shall be one (1) ten (10)-hour and one (1) eight (8)
label: BODY

text: hour shift in each twenty-four (24) hour period on Monday through Friday.
label: BODY

text: The starting time for all employees involved will be between the hours of 6:00 a.m. and 8:00
label: BODY

text: a.m. and the quitting time will be between the hours of 4:30 p.m. and 7:00 p.m.
label: BODY

text: OVERTIME ELIGIBILITY AND PAY
label: HH2

text: Overtime will be administered per Article 16, Hours of Work and Overtime, of the
label: BODY

text: Contract.
label: BODY

text: For purposes of this MOU, Sundays will be double-time pay for every affected
label: BODY

text: employee, pursuant to Section 16.3.
label: BODY

text: VACATION LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Any employee who requests and is granted a vacation day off for any day on which he is
label: BODY

text: scheduled to work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of vacation pay for said
label: BODY

text: day off.  For vacation leaves of less than one (1) full workday, an employee shall be charged in
label: BODY

text: increments of one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time off during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: The Section Manager shall determine the number of employees on scheduled vacation in each
label: BODY

text: section at any one time.  This is to ensure adequate coverage during the Monday through
label: BODY

text: Friday period.
label: BODY

text: SICK LEAVE ENTITLEMENT AND USAGE
label: HH2

text: Sick leave shall be administered for employees on ten (10) hour shifts in
label: BODY

text: accordance with the provisions contained in Article 20 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: For each ten (10) hours of regularly scheduled work from which an employee is
label: BODY

text: absent, sick leave with pay shall be used at the rate of ten (10) hours.  For sick
label: BODY

text: leave of less than one (1) full work day, an employee shall be charged in
label: BODY

text: increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on sick leave during
label: BODY

text: any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: HOLIDAY SCHEDULE
label: HH2

text: The provisions contained in Article 17 of the Contract shall govern the eligibility and usage of
label: BODY

text: holiday pay for those employees covered herein, unless specifically changed hereunder.
label: BODY

text: In accordance with Section 17.9, during the week of a holiday, employees covered herein, shall
label: BODY

text: work a traditional eight (8) hour per day work schedule five (5) days per week Monday through
label: BODY

text: Friday excluding the day observed as the holiday.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who is working an eight (8) hour shift and who works on a day celebrated as a
label: BODY

text: holiday, shall be paid at the rate of time and one-half (1-1/2) for all hours worked, in addition to
label: BODY

text: his regular eight (8) hours of straight-time hourly pay for the holiday.
label: BODY

text: In accordance with Section 17.2, if the holiday falls on the first RDO, the holiday shall be
label: BODY

text: observed on the previous day.  If the holiday falls on the third RDO, the holiday shall be
label: BODY

text: observed on the following day.  If the holiday falls on the middle day off for "Crew A" the holiday
label: BODY

text: will be observed on the following Monday; if the holiday falls on the middle day off for "Crew B"
label: BODY

text: the holiday will be observed on the proceeding Friday.
label: BODY

text: DISABILITY LEAVE PROCEDURES
label: HH2

text: All full-time non-seasonal employees working ten (10) hour shifts shall be eligible to participate
label: BODY

text: in the City's disability leave program as provided in Article 21 of the Contract, provided however
label: BODY

text: that any ten (10) hour employee deemed to be on said disability leave program shall receive
label: BODY

text: 81% of said employee's gross wage, less applicable taxes, under the following formula:
label: BODY

text: The employee's gross wages shall be computed on a forty- (40) hour workweek for each full
label: BODY

text: week in which an employee is off work.
label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

text: during any ten (10) hour shift.

label: BODY

text: DISABILITY LEAVE PROCEDURES
label: HH2

text: All full-time employees working ten (10) hour shifts shall be eligible to participate in the City’s disability
label: BODY

text: leave program provided in Article 21 of the Contract, provided, however, that any ten (10) hour
label: BODY

text: employee deemed to be on said disability leave program shall receive a payment of 81% of said
label: BODY

text: employee’s gross wages under the following formula:
label: BODY

text: The employee’s gross wages shall be computed on a forty (40) hour workweek for
label: BODY

text: each full week in which an employee is off work.
label: BODY

text: The employee shall receive a payment of 81% of his gross wages based upon said
label: BODY

text: forty (40) hour work-week for each full week in which an employee is off work.
label: BODY

text: For any partial week in which an employee is on the disability leave program, said
label: BODY

text: employee shall receive a payment of 81% of his gross wages, under the above-noted
label: BODY

text: formula, pro-rated to the number of hours said employee is off work during his regularly
label: BODY

text: scheduled work week.
label: BODY

text: Pursuant to Section 32.3 of the Collective Bargaining Contract between the City of Columbus and the
label: BODY

text: American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632, the
label: BODY

text: parties hereby agree to the following provisions being enacted for employees of the Division of
label: BODY

text: Information Services, Operations Section in the job classifications known as Computer Operator I and
label: BODY

text: Computer Operator II. Unless specifically amended by this Memorandum of Understanding
label: BODY

text: (hereinafter referred to as MOU), all wages, hours, and other terms and conditions of employment
label: BODY

text: shall be administered in accordance with the Collective Bargaining Contract (hereinafter referred to as
label: BODY

text: Contract).
label: BODY

text: For several years Information Services has scheduled its shift workers on an eight (8) week rotation
label: BODY

text: changing their days off. This schedule allows more frequent days off of Saturday and Sunday as
label: BODY

text: opposed to the three (3) month rotation outlined in the Contract. The number of positions allocated to
label: BODY

text: a shift will determine the frequency of Saturday and Sunday days off.
label: BODY

text: The shift rotations are started at midnight Saturday night. The shift rotations may result in an
label: BODY

text: employee having less than forty (40) straight time rate hours in paid status between the regular days
label: BODY

text: off under the old schedule and the regular days off under the new schedule.  This MOU is being
label: BODY

text: executed to clarify the treatment of overtime worked on the first or second regular day off of the new
label: BODY

text: schedule for the first seven calendar days of the new schedule as follows:
label: BODY

text: With respect to Section 16.3(E) of the collective bargaining contract, for purposes of this MOU,
label: BODY

text: the reference to the three (3) month schedule change will apply to this eight (8) week schedule
label: BODY

text: change.
label: BODY

text: If an employee works his/her first regular day off during the first week of the new schedule and
label: BODY

text: in the previous five calendar days does not have any AWOL, sick, injury or disability time off,
label: BODY

text: the employee will be paid at time and one-half (1.5) for any time worked on the first regular
label: BODY

text: day off of the new schedule.  If an employee works his second regular day off during the first
label: BODY

text: week of the new schedule and in the previous six calendar days does not have any AWOL,
label: BODY

text: sick, injury or disability time off, the employee will be paid at double time (2.0) for any time
label: BODY

text: worked on the second regular day off.  Any AWOL, sick, injury or disability time taken will be
label: BODY

text: replaced hour for hour with straight time before receiving any premium pay.
label: BODY

text: DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY, DIVISION OF POLICE
label: BODY

text: Regarding Communication Technicians/Small Craft Activities
label: BODY

text: It is essential that Communication Technicians be immediately available to answer telephone calls from the
label: BODY

text: public as well as other police personnel. To that end, Communication Technicians are assigned to consoles to
label: BODY

text: answer such incoming calls. Although Communication Technicians are available, there are times when incoming
label: BODY

text: telephone calls are not constant. It is not practical to permit Communication Technicians to leave their
label: BODY

text: respective consoles when they are awaiting incoming telephone calls.
label: BODY

text: In order to promote the alertness of Communication Technicians awaiting incoming telephone calls, it is agreed
label: BODY

text: that they be permitted to work on small craft activities at non-emergency telephone consoles in the Police
label: BODY

text: Communications Center. Small craft activities include such things as knitting, cross-stitching and needlework. It
label: BODY

text: is essential that the individual be able to immediately stop the craft activity in order to answer incoming calls.
label: BODY

text: Small craft activities shall not be permitted at consoles receiving incoming 9-1-1 calls.
label: BODY

text: No activity shall involve the use of any liquids, scraps, or other fragments which may deter the Communications
label: BODY

text: Bureau’s equipment or operations.
label: BODY

text: Permission to engage in small craft activities shall be subject to guidelines formulated by management. The
label: BODY

text: privilege to engage in such activities may be temporarily or permanently revised, rescinded or otherwise
label: BODY

text: modified by management at any time. Any Division of Police supervisor may order an individual to cease small
label: BODY

text: craft activity at any time.
label: BODY

text: This Memorandum of Understanding applies only to Police Communication Technicians working in the Police
label: BODY

text: Communications Center.
label: BODY

text: DURATION
label: HH2

text: This MOU may be terminated by either party giving thirty (30) days prior written notice to the other party, but
label: BODY

text: shall not extend beyond March 31, 2011.

text: Section.  All assignments within the Street Maintenance Section shall be filled on the

text: basis of classification seniority.

label: BODY

text: designated Winter season, at a date determined by management, all employees in the
label: BODY

text: Street Maintenance Section shall be returned to their pre-seasonal shifts and hours of
label: BODY

text: work at their respective work locations.

label: H3

text: Regarding Mandatory Overtime Procedures
label: BODY

text: It is agreed by the City of Columbus and AFSCME, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632, to continue the
label: BODY

text: resolution reached in the settlement of Grievance Numbers 219/220/242-90, and 26-91, Policy
label: BODY

text: Grievances (FMCS #91-09143) and any and all matters contested therein as follows:
label: BODY

text: A sign-up sheet shall be posted at each reporting location by noon Friday of each
label: BODY

text: week to permit employees to volunteer to work overtime on specific days for the
label: BODY

text: next succeeding week, including Saturdays and Sundays.
label: BODY

text: Employees desiring to volunteer to work overtime shall sign up for days they
label: BODY

text: desire to work.
label: BODY

text: There shall be no limit to the number of days or hours an employee may
label: BODY

text: volunteer to work overtime.  Employees may not work more than sixteen (16)
label: BODY

text: hours in one day.
label: BODY

text: The Appointing Authority shall determine, at his discretion, the need for overtime
label: BODY

text: work.
label: BODY

text: Where practical, in the broadest sense, on days when overtime is available, the
label: BODY

text: Appointing Authority or designee shall announce by 10:00 a.m. on the first shift
label: BODY

text: that overtime is being worked.
label: BODY

text: When overtime is worked by volunteers, the overtime roster shall be annotated
label: BODY

text: for equalization purposes consistent with the provisions of Article 16.4 of the
label: BODY

text: Collective Bargaining Contract between the parties.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who has volunteered to work overtime and who does not work and
label: BODY

text: has not (a) removed his/her name from the volunteer list twenty-four (24) hours in
label: BODY

text: advance of the announcement that overtime will be worked, or (b) made a valid
label: BODY

text: reasonable request not to work as determined by the Division Administrator or
label: BODY

text: his designee, may be subject to disciplinary action.
label: BODY

text: MOU #1994-05 (revised May 2008)

text: City of Columbus and AFSCME Local 1632

text: Division of Refuse Collection

label: HH3

text: If an insufficient number of employees are available at the reporting location
label: BODY

text: where overtime is to be worked, then mandatory overtime shall be assigned
label: BODY

text: within classifications by seniority, least senior first.
label: BODY

text: Mandatory overtime shall be limited to a maximum of sixteen (16) hours per
label: BODY

text: employee per week.
label: BODY

text: No emergency vacation or compensatory time will be approved in lieu of working
label: BODY

text: mandatory overtime.
label: BODY

text: An employee assigned to work mandatory overtime, who does not work, and who
label: BODY

text: has not made a valid, reasonable request not to work, as determined by the
label: BODY

text: Administrator or his designee, may be subject to disciplinary action.
label: BODY

text: Employees on an approved extended leave or on a prior approved vacation or
label: BODY

text: compensatory time of more than one day will not be required to work mandatory
label: BODY

text: overtime.
label: BODY

text: This settlement applies only to the Division of Refuse Collection, Department of Public Service.
label: BODY

text: This MOU shall be effective through March 31, 2011 unless terminated at any time prior thereto,
label: BODY

text: by either party giving to the other party thirty (30) days prior written notice.

label: BODY

text: REGARDING PAYROLL DEDUCTION SLOT FOR
label: H3

text: AFSCME, LOCAL 1632 SPONSORED GROUP LEGAL SERVICES PLAN
label: BODY

text: AFSCME Local 1632 is desirous of providing a group legal services plan to eligible bargaining unit members
label: BODY

text: (as defined in paragraph number eight (8) below) and, to that end, has requested that the City grant it a payroll
label: BODY

text: deduction slot for the voluntary deduction of monthly premiums from eligible bargaining members' wages.  The
label: BODY

text: City has agreed to provide AFSCME Local 1632 with a payroll deduction slot to be used for such purpose,
label: BODY

text: consistent with the terms and conditions of this Memorandum of Understanding (hereinafter referred to as
label: BODY

text: MOU).  Accordingly, the parties agree as follows:
label: BODY

text: The group legal services plan sponsored by AFSCME Local 1632 will be the complete and sole
label: BODY

text: responsibility of AFSCME Local 1632 to process, administer and monitor.
label: BODY

text: The City will provide AFSCME Local 1632 access to a payroll deduction slot and will facilitate
label: BODY

text: enrollment by eligible bargaining unit members of AFSCME Local 1632 and in individual City
label: BODY

text: departments by agreeing to have payroll clerks process the payroll deduction authorization for
label: BODY

text: the AFSCME Local 1632 sponsored group legal services plan.
label: BODY

text: All monies deducted monthly for participation in the group legal services plan will be forwarded
label: BODY

text: to the Treasurer of AFSCME Local 1632 in the aggregate amount by a warrant separate and
label: BODY

text: apart from the warrant provided to the Comptroller of AFSCME, Ohio Council 8 as provided in
label: BODY

text: Article 5 of the Collective Bargaining Contract currently in effect between the City and AFSCME,
label: BODY

text: Ohio Council 8, Local 1632.  All funds transmitted to AFSCME Local 1632, pursuant to the
label: BODY

text: payroll deduction authorization for the AFSCME Local 1632 sponsored group legal services
label: BODY

text: plan, shall be the sole responsibility of AFSCME Local 1632 to administer and disperse.
label: BODY

text: Deductions under the terms of this MOU shall be made during one (1) pay period each month; if
label: BODY

text: any participating bargaining unit member's pay for the period is insufficient to cover the
label: BODY

text: deduction for the plan after the withholding of all other legal and required deductions (including
label: BODY

text: Union dues), the City will make a deduction from the pay earned during the next pay period.  In
label: BODY

text: the event a deduction is not made for any participating member during any particular month, the
label: BODY

text: City, upon verification in writing from the President of AFSCME Local 1632, will make the
label: BODY

text: appropriate deduction in the following month.
label: BODY

text: The deductions made under the terms of this MOU, accompanied by an alphabetical list of all
label: BODY

text: participating bargaining unit members shall be transmitted to the Treasurer of AFSCME Local
label: BODY

text: 1632, no later than ten (10) days following the end of the pay period in which the deduction is
label: BODY

text: made, if so approved by the City Auditor.
label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

text: City Auditor's Office shall be eligible to execute payroll deduction authorization cards for the

text: AFSCME Local 1632 sponsored group legal insurance plan.

label: BODY

text: deduction of premiums for the AFSCME Local 1632 sponsored group legal services plan shall
label: BODY

text: be required to execute the required payroll deduction authorization card (a copy of which is
label: BODY

text: attached hereto as Appendix A).
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: the plan.  Payroll deduction authorization cards received by the City on or after March 1 of each
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: the payroll deduction authorization cards for the AFSCME Local 1632 sponsored group legal
label: BODY

text: services plan until such time as AFSCME Local 1632 presents to the City in a timely manner a
label: BODY

text: minimum of 50 properly executed payroll deduction authorization cards evidencing the desire of
label: BODY

text: at least 50 eligible bargaining unit members to participate in the payroll deduction program for
label: BODY

text: the AFSCME Local 1632 sponsored group legal services plan.
label: BODY

text: The City shall continue to make the appropriate monthly deduction from the pay of a
label: BODY

text: participating bargaining unit member until such time as the City receives during the month of
label: BODY

text: February a written revocation of the authorization for payroll deduction signed by the
label: BODY

text: participating member.  To be valid and effective, a written revocation must be submitted and
label: BODY

text: received by the City during the month of February in each year.
label: BODY

text: In the event less than 50 eligible members of the bargaining unit participate in the program at
label: BODY

text: any time, the City's obligation to withhold shall automatically terminate and the Office of the City
label: BODY

text: Auditor shall inform AFSCME Local 1632 of the termination of this deduction.  In such event, it
label: BODY

text: shall be the sole responsibility of AFSCME Local 1632 to notify participating bargaining unit
label: BODY

text: members of the termination of the payroll deduction.
label: BODY

text: No solicitation or enrollment activity shall take place during working hours or on City property.

text: Regarding Electric Switchboard Section
label: BODY

text: The City of Columbus and AFSCME, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632, hereby agree that this
label: BODY

text: Memorandum of Understanding (hereinafter referred to as MOU) shall apply to employees of the
label: BODY

text: Department of Public Utilities, Division of Power and Water (Power) pursuant to a mutual agreement
label: BODY

text: and desire to establish a four (4) day per week, ten (10) hour per day work schedule for employees in
label: BODY

text: the job classifications known as Electricity Load Dispatcher, Electric Switchboard Operator, and
label: BODY

text: Electric Switchboard Operator Trainee.  Unless specifically amended by this MOU, all wages, hours
label: BODY

text: and other terms and conditions of employment shall be administered in accordance with the Collective
label: BODY

text: Bargaining Contract (hereinafter referred to as Contract).
label: BODY

text: HOURS OF WORK
label: HH2

text: The Electric Switchboard is a twenty-four (24) hour-a-day, seven (7) day a week operation.
label: BODY

text: Employees shall work four (4) ten (10) hour work days with three (3) consecutive days off.  Shift
label: BODY

text: assignments will be established through the bidding process for first, second and third shifts.
label: BODY

text: OVERTIME ELIGIBILITY AND PAY
label: HH2

text: Overtime eligibility and pay will be administered per Article 16 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: For purposes of this agreement, work performed on an employee's second consecutive
label: BODY

text: regular day off will be paid at the double-time rate, providing that said employee has
label: BODY

text: accumulated forty (40) straight-time rate hours in paid status.
label: BODY

text: VACATION LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Any employee who requests and is granted a vacation day off for any day on which he is scheduled to
label: BODY

text: work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of vacation leave for said day off.  For
label: BODY

text: vacation leaves of less than one (1) full workday, an employee shall be charged in increments of one-
label: BODY

text: tenth (1/10) hour for all time off during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: The number of employees allowed on scheduled vacation on each shift at any one time shall be
label: BODY

text: determined by Distribution Management.
label: BODY

text: MOU #1993-08 (revised May 2008)
label: HH3

text: City/AFSCME
label: HH3

text: Page 2
label: HH3

text: SICK LEAVE ENTITLEMENT AND USAGE
label: HH2

text: Sick leave entitlement shall be administered for employees on ten (10) hour shifts in
label: BODY

text: accordance with the provisions contained in Article 20 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: For each ten (10) hours of regularly scheduled work from which an employee is absent,
label: BODY

text: sick leave with pay shall be charged at the rate of ten (10) hours per day.  For sick
label: BODY

text: leave of less than one full work day, an employee shall be charged in increments of not
label: BODY

text: less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on sick leave during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: DISABILITY LEAVE PROCEDURES
label: HH2

text: All full-time non-seasonal employees working ten (10) hour shifts shall be eligible to participate in the
label: BODY

text: City's disability leave program as provided in Article 21 of the Contract, provided, however, that any
label: BODY

text: ten (10) hour employee deemed to be on said disability leave program shall receive a payment of
label: BODY

text: 81% of said employee's gross wages under the following formula:
label: BODY

text: The employee's gross wages shall be computed on a forty (40) hour work week
label: BODY

text: for each full week in which an employee is off work.
label: BODY

text: The employee shall receive a payment of 81% of his gross wages based upon
label: BODY

text: said forty (40) hour work week for each full week in which an employee is off
label: BODY

text: work.
label: BODY

text: For any partial week in which an employee is on the disability leave program,
label: BODY

text: said employee shall receive a payment of 81% of his gross wages, under the
label: BODY

text: above-noted formula, pro-rated to the number of hours said employee is off
label: BODY

text: work during his regularly scheduled work week.
label: BODY

text: HOLIDAY SCHEDULE
label: HH2

text: Any employee working a ten (10) hour shift and who works on a day celebrated as a holiday, shall be
label: BODY

text: paid at the rate of time and one-half (1-1/2) for all hours worked, in addition to his regular ten (10)
label: BODY

text: hours at the straight-time hourly rate for the holiday.
label: BODY

text: When a holiday falls on an employee's regularly scheduled day off, the holiday shall be celebrated on
label: BODY

text: Wednesday of that calendar week.
label: BODY

text: PERSONAL BUSINESS DAY
label: HH2

text: Personal business day entitlement and usage shall be administered in accordance with the provisions
label: BODY

text: of Article 18 of the Contract.  Employees will be required to supplement two (2) hours of vacation
label: BODY

text: leave or compensatory time in order to be paid for a ten (10) hour workday.
label: BODY

text: MOU #1993-08 (revised May 2008)
label: HH3

text: City/AFSCME
label: HH3

text: Page 3
label: HH3

text: INJURY LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Any employee, who is working a ten (10) hour shift and is off work as a result of a job-related injury,
label: BODY

text: shall be assigned to the first shift, Monday through Friday, for the duration of his/her injury leave.
label: BODY

text: COMPENSATORY TIME
label: HH2

text: An employee who requests and is granted compensatory time off for a day on which he/she is
label: BODY

text: scheduled to work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of compensatory time for said
label: BODY

text: day off. For compensatory time of less than one (1) full work day, an employee shall be charged in
label: BODY

text: increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on compensatory time  during any ten
label: BODY

text: (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: DURATION
label: HH2

text: This MOU may be terminated by either party giving to the other party thirty (30) days prior written
label: BODY

text: notice, but shall not extend beyond March 31, 2011.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: HOURS OF WORK
label: HH2

text: The normal work week shall consist of four (4) ten (10) hour days that shall be worked Monday
label: BODY

text: through Thursday.  The shift will begin at 7:00 a.m. and conclude at 5:30 p.m.
label: BODY

text: Core working hours for office employees participating in flex time shall remain 9:00 a.m. to 4:00
label: BODY

text: p.m.  This means that an office employee’s working hours may begin no later than 9:00 a.m. or
label: BODY

text: end no earlier than 4:00 p.m.

label: HH2

text: The provisions contained in Article 17 of the Collective Bargaining Contract (hereinafter referred
label: BODY

text: to as Contract) shall govern the eligibility and usage of holiday pay for those employees covered
label: BODY

text: herein, unless specifically changed hereunder.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: hours straight-time hourly pay for said holiday.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who is working a ten (10) hour shift and who works on a day celebrated as a
label: BODY

text: holiday, shall be paid at the rate of time and one-half (1-½) for all hours worked, in addition to
label: BODY

text: his regular ten (10) hours of straight time hourly pay for the holiday.
label: BODY

text: If a holiday falls on Friday or Saturday, the holiday will be celebrated on Thursday.
label: BODY

label: HH2

text: Personal business day entitlement and usage shall be administered in accordance with the
label: BODY

text: provisions of Article 18 of the Contract.  Employees will be required to supplement two (2) hours
label: BODY

text: of vacation leave or compensatory time in order to be paid for a ten (10) hour workday.
label: BODY

text: INJURY LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Any employee, who is working a ten (10) hour shift and is off work as a result of a job-related
label: BODY

text: injury, shall be assigned to the first shift, Monday through Friday, for the duration of his/her
label: BODY

text: injury leave.

label: BODY

label: BODY

text: The City of Columbus and AFSCME, Ohio Council 8, Local 1632, hereby agree that the
label: BODY

text: following provisions shall be enacted for employees working at the Department of Public
label: BODY

text: Utilities, Southerly Wastewater Treatment Plant in the job classifications known as Wastewater
label: BODY

text: Plant Operator and Wastewater Plant Supervisor I, as determined by the Appointing Authority.
label: BODY

text: Unless specifically amended by this Memorandum of Understanding (hereinafter referred to as
label: BODY

text: MOU), all wages, hours and other terms and conditions of employment shall be administered in
label: BODY

text: accordance with the Collective Bargaining Contract (hereinafter referred to as Contract).
label: BODY

text: There are four (4) operating shifts providing the City of Columbus and the Southerly Wastewater
label: BODY

text: Treatment Plant twenty-four (24) -hour, seven (7) -days per week plant operation coverage.
label: BODY

text: Said seven (7)- day period begins at 12:01 a.m. Sunday through midnight Saturday.
label: BODY

text: First Shift:
label: BODY

text: Monday through Friday; from 6:45 a.m. to 2:45 p.m.; days off are
label: BODY

text: Saturday and Sunday.
label: BODY

text: Second Shift:
label: BODY

text: Saturday through Wednesday; from 2:45 p.m. to 10:45 p.m.; days
label: BODY

text: off are Thursday and Friday.
label: BODY

text: Third Shift:
label: BODY

text: Thursday through Monday; 10:45 p.m. to 6:45 a.m.; days off are
label: BODY

text: Tuesday and Wednesday.
label: BODY

text: Fourth Shift:
label: BODY

text: Tuesday through Saturday; Hours of work are Tuesday and
label: BODY

text: Wednesday from 10:45 p.m. to 6:45 a.m.; Thursday and Friday
label: BODY

text: from 2:45 p.m. to 10:45 p.m.; and Saturday from 6:45 a.m. to 2:45
label: BODY

text: p.m.
label: BODY

text: Overtime Scheduling Eligibility and Pay
label: HH1

text: For purposes of this MOU, the Sunday first-shift shall be an overtime shift staffed by rotating the
label: BODY

text: four (4) operating shifts each, one through four.  The needed staff shall be scheduled with
label: BODY

text: employees from that operating shift next in the rotation, beginning with the employee with the
label: BODY

text: lowest overtime hour charges.
label: BODY

text: and double time will be paid to first-shift personnel providing that said employees have
label: BODY

text: accumulated forty (40) straight-time hours in paid status during said employees regular
label: BODY

text: workweek; in accordance with Article 16.
label: BODY

text: Sunday first-shift overtime shall be scheduled and posted on the prior Tuesday and all
label: BODY

text: personnel shall be charged the appropriate overtime hours when asked.  Any overtime shift
label: BODY

text: vacancies left unfilled from the scheduled shift shall be filled and administered per Article 16 of
label: BODY

text: the Contract, and if possible, on Saturday morning prior to the Sunday overtime shift between

text: The parties hereby agree that this Memorandum of Understanding (hereinafter referred to as MOU) shall apply
label: BODY

text: to employees of the Department of Public Utilities, Southwesterly Composting Facility, in the job classifications
label: BODY

text: known as Equipment Operator II, Plant Maintenance Mechanic and Auto Mechanic (Heavy) pursuant to a
label: BODY

text: mutual agreement and desire to establish at the Facility a four (4) day per week, ten (10) hours per day work
label: BODY

text: schedule for said classifications.  Unless specifically amended by this MOU, all wages, hours and other terms
label: BODY

text: and conditions of employment shall be administered in accordance with the Collective Bargaining Contract
label: BODY

text: (hereinafter referred to as Contract):
label: BODY

text: Hours of Work
label: HH1

text: The normal workweek shall consist of four (4) ten (10) hour days that shall be worked as
label: BODY

text: follows:
label: BODY

text: Workgroup A
label: BODY

text: 6 Equipment Operator II’s
label: BODY

text: Monday - Friday
label: BODY

text: 3 Plant Maintenance Mechanics
label: BODY

text: 1 Auto Mechanic (Heavy)
label: BODY

text: Workgroup B
label: BODY

text: 4 Equipment Operator II’s
label: BODY

text: Wednesday - Saturday
label: BODY

text: Workgroup C
label: BODY

text: Equipment Operator II (New Hire)
label: BODY

text: Sunday - Saturday
label: BODY

text: The number of Equipment Operator II’s in Workgroup A will be maintained at a level of not less
label: BODY

text: than six (6) operators for the purpose of bidding work schedules only.  This does not establish
label: BODY

text: minimum staffing levels for the purpose of overtime.
label: BODY

text: All employees hired prior to the effective date of this MOU will have Sunday as a day off.  Group
label: BODY

text: A will have Saturday and Sunday off with an additional weekday off, and Group B will have
label: BODY

text: Sunday through Tuesday off.
label: BODY

text: The starting time for all employees will be 6:00 a.m. except for those performing duties as a
label: BODY

text: sludge truck driver.  The workday will end ten and one-half (10.5) hours after that starting time
label: BODY

text: (ten work hours plus a 30 minute unpaid lunch).
label: BODY

text: Equipment Operator II’s assigned sludge hauling duties will have their schedule determined by
label: BODY

text: management based upon operating conditions.   The starting time will be one and one-half (1.5)
label: BODY

text: hours earlier than 6:00 a.m.; and the employees will be given 24 hours notice of the early start.
label: BODY

text: If any employee is not given 24 hours notice of the early start, the employee may be paid for
label: BODY

text: call-back under the provisions of 26.5 of the Contract; or may elect to end the workday ten and
label: BODY

text: one-half (10.5) hours after starting time.
label: BODY

text: Equipment Operators II’s who desire to be part of the sludge hauling rotation, will notify
label: BODY

text: management of their desire to be part of the rotation.  This will be on a voluntary basis.  In the
label: BODY

text: event that no Equipment Operator volunteers, the duties of sludge hauling will be assigned to
label: BODY

text: the least senior Equipment Operator II qualified to drive the truck and scheduled to work.  The
label: BODY

text: rotation will be for a two (2)-week period per Equipment Operator II.  This rotation will remain in
label: BODY

text: effect for the duration of this MOU.
label: BODY

text: In the event that a vacancy occurs for any of the above work schedules, that vacancy shall be
label: BODY

text: filled in accordance with Article 13 of the Contract.  (See attached schedule for the purpose of
label: BODY

text: schedule implementation).
label: BODY

text: Overtime Eligibility and Pay
label: HH1

text: Overtime eligibility and pay shall be administered per Article 16 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: For the purposes of this MOU, Sunday will be considered the double-time day for all employees not regularly
label: BODY

text: scheduled to work Sunday (Group A and Group B).  All other employees will have their second consecutive
label: BODY

text: day-off as their double-time day (Group C), pursuant to Section 16.3(C).
label: BODY

text: Vacation Leave
label: HH1

text: Vacation leave and usage shall be administered in accordance with the provisions of Article 19 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who requests and is granted a vacation day off for any day on which he is scheduled to work a
label: BODY

text: ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of vacation leave for said day off.  For vacation leaves of
label: BODY

text: less than one (1) full workday, an employee shall be charged in increments of one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time
label: BODY

text: off during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: MOU #1991-01 (revised May 2008)
label: HH3

text: City/AFSCME
label: HH3

text: Division of Sewerage and Drainage
label: HH3

text: Page 3
label: HH3

text: Personal Business Day
label: HH1

text: Personal business day entitlement and usage shall be administered in accordance with the provisions of Article
label: BODY

text: 18 of the Contract.  Employees will be required to supplement two (2) hours of vacation leave or compensatory
label: BODY

text: time in order to be paid for a ten (10) hour workday.
label: BODY

text: Injury Leave
label: HH1

text: Any employee, who is working a ten (10) hour shift and is off work as a result of a job-related injury, shall be
label: BODY

text: assigned to the first shift, Monday through Friday, for the duration of his/her injury leave.
label: BODY

text: Compensatory Time
label: HH1

text: An employee who requests and is granted compensatory time off for a day on which he/she is scheduled to
label: BODY

text: work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of compensatory time for said day off. For
label: BODY

text: compensatory time of less than one (1) full work day, an employee shall be charged in increments of not less
label: BODY

text: than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on compensatory time  during any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: Sick Leave Entitlement and Usage
label: HH1

text: Sick leave entitlement and usage shall be administered in accordance with the provisions of Article 20 of the
label: BODY

text: Contract.
label: BODY

text: For each ten (10) hours of regularly scheduled work from which an employee is absent due to illness, sick
label: BODY

text: leave with pay shall be used at the rate of ten (10) hours.  For sick leave of less than one (1) full work day, an
label: BODY

text: employee shall be charged in increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on sick leave during
label: BODY

text: any ten (10) hour shift.
label: BODY

text: Non-Participation
label: HH1

text: Employees, who are covered by this MOU, may elect to work an alternate five (5) eight (8) hour day schedule.
label: BODY

text: The schedule will be a five (5) consecutive eight (8) hour day from 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. with two days off to
label: BODY

text: be determined by management.  The employee will not be considered to be part of Workgroup A, may be
label: BODY

text: scheduled to work on Saturday, and will have work assigned daily as directed by management.  After the initial
label: BODY

text: bid, an employee may request non-participation due to an emergency or personal hardship.  Management and
label: BODY

text: the Union will attempt to resolve the conflict through good faith discussions.
label: BODY

label: HH2

text: The provisions contained in Article 17 of the Contract shall govern the eligibility and usage of holiday pay for
label: BODY

text: those covered herein, unless specifically changed hereunder.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who does not work on a day on which a holiday is celebrated shall be paid ten (10) hours of
label: BODY

text: straight-time hourly pay for said holiday.
label: BODY

text: Any employee who is working a ten (10) hour shift and who works on a day celebrated as a holiday, shall be
label: BODY

text: paid at the rate of time and one-half (1-1/2) for all hours worked, in addition to the holiday pay (which shall be
label: BODY

text: paid at the straight-time hourly rate), unless the holiday falls on a double-time day in which case he shall be
label: BODY

text: compensated at the double-time rate in addition to his holiday pay in accordance with Articles 16 and 17.
label: BODY

text: Group A
label: HH1

text: When the holiday falls on Saturday, the holiday will be celebrated on the previous normal
label: BODY

text: workday.
label: BODY

text: When the holiday falls on Sunday, the holiday will be celebrated on the first normal workday of
label: BODY

text: the next week.
label: BODY

text: When the holiday falls on the day off during the week, the holiday will be celebrated on either
label: BODY

text: the day before or the day after.
label: BODY

text: Group B
label: HH1

text: When the holiday falls on the first day off, the holiday will be celebrated on the previous day
label: BODY

text: (Saturday).
label: BODY

text: When the holiday falls on the second consecutive day off, the holiday will be celebrated on the
label: BODY

text: previous workday day.
label: BODY

text: When the holiday falls on the third day off, the holiday will be celebrated on the following day
label: BODY

text: (Wednesday).

label: HH2

text: When the holiday falls on the first day off, the holiday will be celebrated on the previous day.
label: BODY

text: When the holiday falls on the second consecutive day off, the holiday will be celebrated on the
label: BODY

text: following day.
label: BODY

text: When the holiday falls on the third day off, the holiday will be celebrated on the following day.

label: H3

text: The parties hereby agree to the following provisions being enacted for employees of the Department of Public
label: BODY

text: Utilities, Division of Power and Water (Power), Distribution Section in the job classifications known as
label: BODY

text: Automotive Mechanic (Heavy), Automotive Mechanic Supervisor I, Power Line Worker Supervisor I, Power
label: BODY

text: Line Worker II, Power Line Worker I, Laborer, Cable Worker Supervisor I, Cable Worker II, Cable Worker I,
label: BODY

text: Power Line Cable Worker Trainee, Electric Metering Supervisor I, Utility Service Technician II, Storekeeper,
label: BODY

text: Senior Storekeeper, Office Assistant II, Substation Maintenance Technician and Substation Maintenance
label: BODY

text: Supervisor.  This agreement does not include any shift workers.
label: BODY

text: HOURS OF WORK
label: HH2

text: The schedule for the aforementioned classifications shall be four (4) work days of ten (10) hours per day and
label: BODY

text: three (3) consecutive days off (per attached schedule).  The shift will begin at 6:15 a.m. and conclude at 4:45
label: BODY

text: p.m.  There shall be one (1) straight ten (10) hour shift in each twenty-four (24) hour period.
label: BODY

text: DISABILITY LEAVE PROCEDURES
label: HH2

text: All full-time non-seasonal employees working ten (10) hour shifts shall be eligible to participate in the City’s
label: BODY

text: disability leave program as provided in Article 21 of the Collective Bargaining Contract (hereinafter referred to
label: BODY

text: as Contract), provided however that any ten (10) hour employee deemed to be on said disability leave program
label: BODY

text: shall receive a payment of 81% of said employee’s gross wage under the following formula:
label: BODY

text: The employee’s gross wages shall be computed on a forty (40) hour workweek for each
label: BODY

text: full week in which an employee is off work.
label: BODY

text: The employee shall receive a payment of 81% of his gross wage based upon said (40)
label: BODY

text: hour workweek for each full week in which an employee is off work.
label: BODY

text: For any partial week in which an employee is on the disability leave program, said
label: BODY

text: employee shall receive a payment of 81% of his gross wages, under the above-noted
label: BODY

text: formula, pro-rated to the numbers of hours said employee is off work during his regularly
label: BODY

text: scheduled workweek.
label: BODY

text: as RDO), the holiday shall be observed on the previous day.  If the holiday falls on the third RDO, the holiday
label: BODY

text: will be observed on the following day.
label: BODY

text: If the holiday falls on the middle day off for “Crew A” the holiday will be observed on the following Monday; if
label: BODY

text: the holiday falls on the middle day off for “Crew B” the holiday will be observed on the preceding Friday.

label: BODY

text: will be double-time pay for each employee involved.

label: BODY

text: contained in Article 19 of the Contract.

label: BODY

text: scheduled to work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten
label: BODY

text: (10) hours of vacation pay for said day off.  For vacation leave of less than one (1) full work day,
label: BODY

text: an employee shall be charged in increments of not less than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time
label: BODY

text: on vacation during any ten (10) hour shift.

label: BODY

text: accordance with the provisions contained in Article 20 of the Contract.
label: BODY

text: For each ten (10) hours of regular scheduled work from which an employee is absent, sick leave
label: BODY

text: with pay shall be used at the rate of ten (10) hours.  For sick leave of less than one (1) full work
label: BODY

text: INJURY LEAVE
label: HH2

text: Any employee who is working a ten (10) hour shift and is off work as a result of a job-related injury, shall be
label: BODY

text: assigned to the first shift, Monday through Friday, for the duration of his/her injury leave.

text: COMPENSATORY TIME
label: HH2

text: An employee who requests and is granted compensatory time off for a day on which he/she is scheduled to
label: BODY

text: work a ten (10) hour shift shall be charged ten (10) hours of compensatory time for said day off. For
label: BODY

text: compensatory time of less than one (1) full work day, an employee shall be charged in increments of not less
label: BODY

text: than one-tenth (1/10) hour for all time on compensatory time  during any ten (10) hour shift.

text: 16.2(A)(1) In situations where the City believes that alternate or flexible work schedules, different from those set forth in
label: BODY

text: Section 16.1 above, are needed for operational efficiency and effectiveness, the City will give the Union President and
label: BODY

text: Chief Steward for the Department (where applicable) written notice of the proposed work schedule and a list of those job
label: BODY

text: classification(s)/position assignment(s) affected at least fourteen (14) days in advance of any proposed change(s).  If the
label: BODY

text: Union wants to bargain about the proposed change(s), one representative from the City’s Labor Relations Section and
label: BODY

text: two representatives from the Department involved shall meet with the Union President, Regional Director or designee and
label: BODY

text: Chief Steward in the affected Department (where applicable), to negotiate the proposed schedule changes as well as the
label: BODY

text: impact of such change(s) on matters such as holidays, sick leave, vacation leave, etc.  In the absence of an agreement
label: BODY

text: being reached within the fourteen (14)-day period, the City may, at the end of the fourteen (14)-day period, implement its
label: BODY

text: proposed work schedule.

text: 16.2(A)(3) The process set forth in this Section 16.2(A) applies only to changes in work schedules or shifts that are of a
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: longer.  No changes shall be made to work schedules or shifts unless they are of a permanent nature, except as provided
label: BODY
